<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Data powers the future of eero. We rely on data to inform and drive product decisions, improve network and mesh performance, set marketing strategies, enhance factory testing, provide better customer support and much more ( https://blog.eero.com/in-data-we-trust/ ). As a Data Scientist at eero, you will participate in product development by bringing analytical and statistical expertise to solve new and complex problems. Working closely with our product & engineering leadership, you will dig deep into the largest data set from consumer mesh networks ever compiled to drive the understanding, growth and success of eero.
<br><br>
You will…
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Partner with Product and Engineering teams to develop key performance indicators, answer important questions with data and identify new product opportunities</li>
<li>Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and data storytelling to build compelling stories about how our users interact with our product</li>
<li>Develop statistical models on large data sets to better understand our business and the drivers of change</li>
<li>Present your analysis with logical recommendations to influence product direction and communicate the state of the business</li>
<li>Build and automate actionable analytics and reporting for key business processes</li>
<li>Innovate to derive meaning from new data sources and devise new measurement frameworks</li>
<li>Mentor others within eero in SQL, Analytics, statistics, and all things data</li>
</ul>
Currently, you…
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Have 3+ years of work experience in quantitative analysis with a demonstrable business impact</li>
<li>Possess strong analytic skills and the ability to synthesize large datasets into meaningful insights.</li>
<li>Are building statistical models to segment and predict user behavior</li>
<li>Design and evaluate key performance indicators and experiments to validate hypotheses</li>
<li>Build datasets from large amounts of structured and unstructured data using SQL and the Hadoop Ecosystem (Redshift, Vertica, Spark, Hive, Presto, Pig, etc)</li>
<li>Possess deep understanding statistics and application utilizing R or Python Pandas</li>
<li>Have demonstrable general purpose coding experience with a dynamic language such as Python, Ruby, Node.js, PHP, Clojure, etc</li>
<li>Build key data sets and compelling, intelligible visualizations using tools such as Looker or Tableau</li>
<li>Have a PhD or MS degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields.</li>
<li>Are confident in your communication and presentation skills</li>
</ul>
Bonus Points if you…

<li>Have deployed production models to predict or classify</li>
<li>Have coding experience in languages such as Scala, Java, C++, C#, or Go</li>
</ul>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>Data Scientist, Machine Learning Evaluation
<br>
Machine Learning is a critical part of Adobe&rsquo;s Cloud offering. Adobe Clouds enable customers to create and manage digital content, such as assets, composites, 3D, documents etc., and digital experience and transformations.
<br>
Creative Cloud is focused on visual imagination and creation, and includes such well-known products as Photoshop CC, Illustrator CC, Lightroom CC, and Adobe Stock. Document Cloud is centered around the creation and management of textual documents, including Acrobat DC and Adobe Sign. Experience Cloud is the set of offerings for the large-scale enterprise, covering marketing, advertising, and analytics.
<br>
We are building new machine learning platform, called Adobe Sensei, that powers machine learning and AI across all of these Adobe Cloud product lines. This platform will enable thousands of applied researchers, millions of users, and billions of content pieces. The objective is to make machine learning offerings a world-class, leading-edge, differentiating product in Adobe Cloud ecosystem. We match the pace, innovation and excitement of a startup, backed by the resources and infrastructure of Adobe!
<br>
A crucial piece of developing machine learning solutions is the evaluation process. How do we know the quality of our algorithms and models? What is the ground truth we use for judging them? Where do they succeed and how do they fail? These problems are even more subtle in the complex, creative domains of Adobe products &ndash; for example, how should we judge the quality of similarity search, where a user finds new images with an image as the query?
<br>
How can you participate? We&rsquo;re looking for data scientists to define, drive, and coordinate evaluation for the Applied Machine Learning team at Adobe. This will involve thinking hard about product quality, the role of machine learning in those products, and the capabilities of both A/B tests and human-judgment tasks to arrive at quantitative evaluations that measure how well our AI/ML algorithms are doing their jobs.
<br>
Responsibilities:
<br>
&bull; Work closely with product, research, and engineering leaders to understand ML applications and define success
<br>
&bull; Design evaluation tasks and guidelines for human judgment to measure the performance of machine-learned and other advanced algorithms.
<br>
&bull; Help design A/B tests for our cloud offerings, and use human judgment vs. end-user A/B tests as appropriate
<br>
&bull; Create a winning culture built on collaboration and shared accomplishments- have fun along the way!
<br>
Qualifications:
<br>
&bull; BS or MS in a technical field (Computer Science, Physics, Math, Statistics) OR in a huna-centered field such as Psychology, Linguistics, Human-Computer Interaction.
<br>
&bull; Exposure to applied machine learning in an industrial setting
<br>
&bull; Experience in validation and evaluation of machine learned models
<br>
&bull; Strong quantitative orientation
<br>
&bull; Understanding of issues around ground truth and training sets for ML, including human judgment and A/B testing
<br>
&bull; Hands-on experience using third-party judgment services such as Crowdflower, Appen, or Amazon Mechanical Turk
<br>
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you&rsquo;re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Culture Amp is growing and we are looking to hire another People Scientist based in San Francisco. You’ll be a champion of feedback strategy and people analytics, serving as the primary lead for customers wishing to link their feedback data to business outcomes.
<br>
<br>
<b>Who We Are:
</b><br>
<br>
Culture Amp is the world’s leading people analytics platform. We're passionate about helping companies understand the connection between people and culture. Our customizable survey platform captures employee feedback and real-time data, telling a story to help organizations make better people decisions. Our team combines deep knowledge in psychology, statistics, UX, and engineering. We help thousands of the most culture focussed organizations in the world build better workplaces. From the likes of Airbnb, Adobe, Tumblr, Slack, Warby Parker, Etsy and many more.
<br>
<br>
<b>What is the opportunity for you?
</b><br>
<br>
The People Scientist role entails being a thought leader in the HR and employee feedback space while assisting customers with survey question design, analyzing survey results, and establishing feedback strategies for our customers at the organization, group, and individual level. Your greatest skill is being able to listen, understand our customers’ needs, and provide direction around advanced analytics that help customers get the most from their survey data. You love people and your passion lies in diving into data to uncover stories and provide insights, as well as imparting knowledge to up-skill customers and coworkers. We want someone who shares our passion for simplifying the feedback strategy and data analysis with the goal of elevating our clients’ effectiveness. Someone who is comfortable meetings with customers to discuss their goals, dive into data that might be messy, and think with innovation about how to link feedback data with customer business outcomes to answer research questions and tell the best story. This customer-facing position is a mid- to senior-level role with no direct reports.
<br>
<br>
<b>Your role at Culture Amp:
</b><br>
<ul><li>Work with client data and survey outcomes to identify the most valuable themes and stories to help our clients improve their culture and business outcomes
</li><li>Mine and analyze data from customer databases to drive feedback strategies, answer research questions, and improve company culture in companies across markets and industry sectors
</li><li>Serve as a champion for Culture Amp’s philosophy on how to best collect, understand, and act on employee feedback
</li><li>Contribute to survey question design sessions and lead virtual & in-person survey results review sessions with a variety of clients (e.g., People Managers, HRBPs, CEOs/Executives teams)
</li><li>Generate actionable and predictive insights from HR data sets, including engagement surveys, lifecycle experience surveys (onboarding to exit), and individual/team effectiveness feedback
</li><li>Support and build domain expertise for our customer facing teams through coaching and training
</li><li>Contribute to improving internal processes and culture within Culture Amp
</li></ul><b>What you’ll bring to Culture Amp:
</b><br>
<ul><li>Experience working with surveys throughout the employee lifecycle (candidate, onboarding, engagement, inclusion, exit) and/or 360-type feedback processes.
</li><li>Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on linking data to business outcomes.
</li><li>Experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, including knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
</li><li>Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large (often messy) data sets preferred. Experience with People Data is a plus.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Twitter's Consumer Product Teams are responsible for core features of twitter.com, which includes Timelines, Tweets, Search, Trends, Recommendations, Notifications, Tweet details/permalink, and more! Our code operates at massive scale and speed, serving billions of requests per day, connecting hundreds of millions of active Twitter users to real-time information about their lives and the world we live in.
<br>
<br>
<b>Who We Are:
</b><br>
<br>
At Twitter, our mission is to instantly connect users to the information most meaningful to them. Realizing this involves work in areas such as machine learning, applied data science, recommendation systems, information retrieval systems, natural language processing, large graph analysis, spam, etc.
<br>
<br>
Do you love Twitter? Do you want to make a huge impact while working with large data sets at a really big scale? If so, this might be a good fit for you!

<br>

</b>Although you will work on cutting-edge problems, this position is not a research position. You will participate in the engineering life-cycle at Twitter, including designing distributed systems, writing production code, conducting code reviews and working alongside our infrastructure and reliability teams. <div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Overview of the Role
<br><br>
The Data Scientist will leverage their deep expertise in machine learning, informatics, cancer biology, data integration and/or immunology to work on projects that ultimately drive the development of new immunotherapies.
<br><br>
There is a great deal of flexibility in this role, however Data Scientists and PICI typically contribute to:
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Developing new methods for integrative data analysis</li>
<li>Creating high-throughput pipelines to process any of the 10+ data types we work with</li>
<li>Building new tools to incorporate open data and knowledge from existing literature into analysis workflows</li>
<li>Evaluating novel technologies for immune profiling</li>
<li>Analyzing multi-modal data sets to uncover mechanisms of response and resistance to immunotherapies</li>
<li>Collaborating with PICI investigators at our member sites</li>
</ul>
Reporting Structure and Team
<br><br>
The Data Scientist reports to the VP, Informatics and is a key member of the Informatics team.
<br><br>
Essential Job Functions
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Perform translationally-relevant research in cancer immunotherapy</li>
<li>Develop informatics methods to analyze one or more of the 10+ data types we work with, including CyTOF, MIBI/IMC/Vectra, 16S Ribosomal Sequencing, ATAC-seq, Whole Exome Sequencing, Nanostring, and RNA-seq</li>
<li>Develop methods to integrate and analyze clinical patient data as well as publically available data sources</li>
<li>Leverage a cloud-based compute environment based around tools such as Docker, Cromwell/WDL, Google Cloud Platform, and deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, to perform rigorous, reproducible analysis on large data sets.</li>
<li>Mentor and train postdoctoral associates and other research fellows</li>
<li>Contribute to the scientific environment at the PICI by presenting at internal meetings, identifying relevant literature, and serving as an in-house expert on your research area.</li>
<li>Present at national conferences and/or make other contributions to the broader scientific and computational community through publications and/or community projects</li>
</ul>
Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Complete their Ph.D. in applied math, statistics, biophysics, bioinformatics, machine learning, computer science, immunology, cancer biology, or similar</li>
<li>Substantial experience using analytic packages in Python, R or similar to analyze data. Knowledge of both the practical and theoretical aspects of data science is essential</li>
<li>Experience with high performance computing, with an empahsis on cloud computing</li>
<li>Have a drive to translate your research ideas into practical tools and insights</li>
<li>Have a passion for collaborative, interdisciplinary research that generates real impact</li>
<li>Be highly motivated and able to work independently</li>
<li>Have excellent oral and written communication skills</li>
</ul>
Introduction to the Organization
<br><br>
The Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy (“PICI” or the “Parker Institute”) is a not-for-profit organization whose mission is to accelerate the development of immunological cures for cancer through innovative science, advanced technologies and new modes of research collaboration. The Institute is based in San Francisco, California and officially launched in April 2016.
<br><br>
To achieve its mission, PICI has established significant new cancer immunology research centers at six of the top cancer research and treatment institutions in the country (Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, Stanford Medicine, the University of California, Los Angeles, the University of California, San Francisco, the University of Pennsylvania and The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center), and will organize and support a portfolio of advanced, collaborative research efforts across this consortium.</span><br><div id="p_a5066216a4aaedd4">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">As a Data Scientist, you will evaluate and improve Google's products. You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers and analysts on a wide range of problems. This position will bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of measuring quality, improving consumer products, and understanding the behavior of end-users, advertisers, and publishers.
<br>
<br>
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, data scientists not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
<br>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Responsibilities

</li><li>Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive understanding of Google data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for both products development and sales activity.
</li><li>Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. Work closely with engineers to identify opportunities for, design, and assess improvements to google products.
</li><li>Make business recommendations (e.g. cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
</li><li>Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods to improve the quality of Google's user facing products; example application areas include ads quality, search quality, end-user behavioral modeling, and live experiments.
</li></ul><br>

<li>Influence product teams through presentation of findings.</li>
<li>Communicate the state of business, experiment results, etc. to product and management teams.</li>
<li>Exploratory Analysis & Statistical Modeling</li>
<li>Understand ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends.</li>
<li>Identify levers to help move key metrics.</li>
<li>Evaluate and define metrics.</li>
<li>Build models of user behaviors for analysis and powering production systems.</li>
<li>Identify and correct for any biases or errors in our data sets.</li>
</ul>
--------------
<br>Qualifications
<br>--------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>2+ years Data Science experience outside of academia.</li>
<li>Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics, or other related field) from a leading academic institution.</li>
<li>Expert in Python and SQL. (Must have experience writing production level code.)</li>
<li>Proficiency working with Spark to process large data sets.</li>
<li>Excellent communication skills with demonstrated success presenting complex data and analysis (qualitative and quantitative) in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action</li>
<li>Strong understanding of statistical analysis</li>
<li>A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data. A passion for problem solving, comfort with ambiguity, and creativity.</li>
<li>A flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision.</li>
<li>Quick learner, with the ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance.</li>
<li>Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Drive change and collaborate effectively with a variety of individuals and organizations</li>
</ul>

---------------------------
<br>About the Data Science Team
<br>---------------------------
<br><br>
At Thumbtack, the Data Science team combines big data with innovative modeling and analysis techniques to shape the system logic that serves millions of customers and professionals. Challenging problems include:
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Design innovative A/B testing techniques. Understanding the true impact of a test in Thumbtack’s marketplace requires well-designed separation among millions of interconnected customers and professionals, and sound methodology to interpret test results in the face of such extensive interconnection.</li>
<li>Model complex relationships in the presence of many confounding factors. Predictive modeling problems are everywhere across our product. Our team works to scope, design and implement machine learning models to support Thumbtack’s products.</li>
</ul>
--------------

<br>--------------

<br>----------------
<br><br>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The Data Scientist will derive, validate, and analyze large data sets, and develop novel predictive models using statistical techniques and machine learning, with a goal of deploying these to impact the delivery of patient care in real-time.
<br>
<br>
The Data Scientist will frequently analyze problems without precedent and/or existing structure within UCSF Health, and address complex problems with an organization-wide scope. He or she will serve as a mentoring resource to advance understanding of data science within the health system. The Data Scientist will develop comprehensive expertise in the predictive modelling module of the Epic Electronic Health Record, and serve as a collaborator and reference for improvement activities involving predictive modelling, implemented in the Epic EHR and outside it.
<br>
<br>
Competitive applicants for this position are data scientists or quantitative analysts who have experience in delivering actionable findings from large data sources. Candidates are ideally fluent in programming languages such as R, SQL, or Python, or other tools used for data manipulation and visualization and have a background in machine learning.
<br>
<br>
Prior relevant work with clinical data, and/or the Epic electronic health record, is favorable but not required.
<br>
<br>
Required Qualifications
<br>
<ul><li>Three to five years of experience in positions of increasing responsibility, working with large datasets and conducting statistical and quantitative modeling, melding analytics with strong programming, data mining, clustering and segmentation
</li><li>Bachelor’s degree and a combination of 6 years of education and work experience in predictive modelling, machine learning, and or a related quantitative field (Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Bioinformatics, etc.)
</li><li>Strong data and statistical programming skills. e.g. SQL, Python, R, Stata, SAS, SQL, Hadoop, Hive, and/or other large data systems
</li><li>Data scientist with in-depth knowledge and experience with machine learning and predictive analytics, proficiency in R or Python programming languages, or other tools used for data manipulation and visualization, and experience working with data warehouses. In-depth knowledge of all relevant clinical informatics software and systems, and of the highly-complex concepts, principles, policies, methodologies, techniques, best practices, regulations, and standards practices involved with patient care and electronic medical data management in the UC health care system
</li><li>Broadly encompassing and highly in-depth knowledge of machine learning, and deployment of predictive analytics in operational environments. Knowledge of controlled terminology, clinical workflows, user interface optimization, clinical decision support, rules development, data integration and mining, clinical ontologies and adoption of technology. (clinical domain knowledge is preferred but not required, and may be developed or expanded after hiring)

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">At Kinsa we are driven by <b>our mission to track and stop the spread of contagious illness </b>. We use data analytics and machine learning to forecast where and when illness will break out. Our award winning connected thermometers provide the sensor network needed to collect real-time, geolocated, clinically accurate health data.
<br>
<br>
We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to use Kinsa’s unique symptomatic, geographic, and demographic data to help us understand and predict the spread of infectious disease. You will help improve the existing Kinsa illness signal, derive new signals based on proprietary symptoms and fever data, as well as external data. The role includes extraction of epidemiological information from the proprietary and external data. In addition, you will help improve existing and develop new flu forecasting models. The ideas, research, and tools you develop will contribute directly to the realization of Kinsa’s mission.
<br>
<br>
The ideal candidate is skilled in a range of data science, machine learning and other statistical approaches; has the engineering experience to build prototypes around these tools, and/or has experience with epidemiological modeling and forecasting. You’ll be comfortable working cross-functionally with internal and external stakeholders. You understand how to work in a scrappy startup environment, and know how to balance speed vs. accuracy. Most importantly, you’ll have a genuine passion for Kinsa’s mission, and act as a force multiplier as we enter this next phase of growth in our organization. <br>

<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">We're looking for:
</h3><ul><ul><li>Undergraduate or advanced degree in a quantitative discipline — e.g. Statistics / Biostatistics, Physics, Computer Science -- MS/PhD preferred
</li><li>1 year of commercial or post graduate academic experience in data science

</li><li>Experience with machine learning techniques
</li><li>Industry experience in a relevant quantitative field is preferred, ideally at a high growth / early stage company

</li><br>
<br>
</ul></ul>About Kinsa:
<br>
<br>
Kinsa has re-imagined the first device parents turn to during an illness - the thermometer - into a support system to keep the whole family healthy. Kinsa supports families from the first sign of illness through recovery and beyond by focusing on what’s most important in that moment - what to do next. The Kinsa system remembers health details for future reference, offers personalized guidance on how to soothe symptoms, take medications and call the doctor, and allows for instant access to relevant services (e.g., telemedicine, sick child care services) right when they’ll be most helpful. We’ve been humbled by powerful stories about how Kinsa has helped users get their sick children the right care they need - for example, one mother believes Kinsa saved her child’s life and another says Kinsa has helped give her 5 year old son with autism a voice . <br>
<br>
Kinsa is FDA-cleared and pediatrician recommended, has won 8 national parenting awards, and appeared in an Apple's "Parenthood" TV commercial. Kinsa was founded by Inder Singh, a software engineer turned health executive who has dedicated his life to improving the health of children. Before starting Kinsa, Inder worked for former President Bill Clinton and brokered the deals that lowered the price of medicines for infectious illnesses, saving over $1 billion and enabling tens of millions of children to receive life-saving treatment. Kinsa is backed by Kleiner Perkins, the earliest investor in Amazon and Google, and others.</span><br><div id="p_c40e02cb4095f284">

</b><br>

We tackle complex problems in machine learning, computer vision, image recognition, natural language processing and deep learning.<br>

Your role within our Kingdom</h2><div><p>
If you want to improve the experience of King&rsquo;s 300 million+ players across our network of games, then this may be the right opportunity for you. You&rsquo;ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment and retain our players. You will be part of a community of 80+ business intelligence &amp; analytics experts, while working on a daily basis in smaller teams of 3-6 people. As a data scientist at King, your role will be focused on particular games.</p><p>
Specifically, you&rsquo;ll:</p><ul><li>
Support the game team with developing hypotheses and execute qualitative and quantitative tests to understand what resonates with the target audience</li><li>
Identify potential business opportunities and scope/design approaches to capture those opportunities</li><li>
Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB-tests, then work with development teams to ensure correct implementation and tracking</li><li>
Develop an analysis strategy and perform analysis of complex scenarios and AB-tests, both systematically and on a one-off basis.</li><li>
Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis and reports, even when confronted by subtle data complications</li><li>
Provide an analytics perspective to discussions and helping to drive the priorities within your team</li><li>
Be the pro-active owner of the entire data chain for your game(s)</li></ul></div></div><div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader">
Skills to create thrills</h2><div><ul><li>
You have a passion for quantitative analysis, understanding player behaviour and will have the ability to draw business insights which will add real value to King. You will need to demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and will have worked in a fast paced and collaborative environment. This role will involve working with teams and individuals across King - such as Game Developers, Business Performance Managers and Marketeers, so excellent communication skills are essential.</li></ul><ul><li>
Experience working on mobile games or in a live games environment</li><li>
Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions</li><li>
Player behavior: Understanding the players&rsquo; motivation is key to design valuable tests and interpret results</li><li>
SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players, and work effectively with both Hive and relational database systems</li><li>
Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python (and also Excel) for analytical purposes</li><li>
Stats: Understanding the appropriate statistical techniques to use in different circumstances</li><li>
Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous</li></ul></div></div><div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader">
Bonus points</h2><div><p>
There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.
</p><p>Specific experience that might be helpful, includes:
</p><ul><li>experience in the games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses</li><li>
experience in &quot;big data&quot; systems such as Hadoop, Hive</li><li>
experience in behavioural psychology/economics; robust understanding of more advanced statistical techniques suitable for analysis of highly skewed populations</li><li>
experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas</li><li>
experience in experimental design; software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently)</li><li>
skills with standard reporting tools such as QlikView/Tableau/Looker/etc.</li></ul></div></div><div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader">
A great saga needs all sorts of heroes</h2><div><p>
Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can&rsquo;t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that&rsquo;s it.</p></div></div><div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader">
King in San Francisco</h2><div><p>
It&rsquo;s a small team out on the West Coast, but when it comes to platform partnerships, it&rsquo;s an invaluable one. With its mild climate, stunning scenery and cosmopolitan character, San Francisco is one of North Americas most beautiful and exciting cities. You&rsquo;ll find our studio within striking distance of the AT&amp;T stadium and only a short tram ride away from the heart of the city.</p></div></div></div></span><br><div id="p_02e4ffc513103016">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">About Castle Global
</b><br>
<br>
Castle Global is a full-stack deep learning company solving visual intelligence problems. Our flagship platform, Hive, consists of Hive Data—100k distributed workers performing data labeling tasks—and Hive Enterprise, where we build vertical-changing applications leveraging computer vision and deep learning. We're working with some of the world's largest technology and content businesses to change the way they analyze unstructured image and video data through machine learning.
<br>
<br>
We are funded by leading investors like Peter Thiel (Founders Fund), General Catalyst, and Formation 8. We have ~100 people globally, based in our San Francisco and Delhi offices.
<br>
<br>
<b>Data Science Team
</b><br>
<br>
In order to execute our vision, we are looking to expand our team of data scientists. We generate an enormous amount of valuable proprietary data in a number of verticals, and we are building a team dedicated to deriving insights from this data. This team will bridge the gap between the "tagged" data that our machine learning team builds and the product team in delivering business insights. Our ideal candidate has experience working with massive data sets (think 10B+ rows of data) and is comfortable with both statistics and engineering. <br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Responsibilities
</h3><ul><ul><li>Everything involved in analyzing a production data set, including:
</li><li>Writing code to transform massive raw data output into a structured, usable form
</li><li>Leveraging more traditional machine learning techniques to uncover hidden relationships in our data sets
</li><li>Conducting statistical analysis of results to prove / disprove hypotheses, and
</li><li>Write up reports that our other team members can use to deliver in a product
</li><li>Interface closely with the Product, Business Development, and Sales teams to answer questions about our data sets that our customers and partners are seeking solutions for </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Requirements
</h3><ul><ul><li>You have an undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science or similar technical field, with significant coursework in mathematics or statistics
</li><li>You have 1-2 years of industry data science experience
</li><li>You have successfully worked with complex data sets and are familiar with Hadoop / Spark
</li><li>You know the ins and outs of Python, especially as it applies to the above data processing frameworks
</li><li>You are capable of quickly coding and prototyping data pipelines involving any combination of Python, Node, bash, and linux command-line tools, especially when applied to large data sets consisting of millions of files
</li><li>You have a working knowledge of the following technologies, or are not afraid of picking them up on the fly: C++, Scala / Spark, R, Matlab, SQL, Cassandra, Docker
</li><li>You are comfortable with running and interpreting common statistical tests, and also with common data science techniques including dimensionality reduction and supervised and unsupervised learning
</li><li>You have great communication skills and ability to work with others
</li><li>You are a strong team player, with a do-whatever-it-takes attitude </li></ul></ul><b>What We Offer You
</b><br>
<br>
Castle Global offers a network of companies with extensive resources and exceptional people. We are a group of individuals who are young and hungry to make a mark on the world and build a long-term investment holding company. You will be based in San Francisco and we offer all the standard benefits available to top startup companies. At Castle, you will have a significant career development opportunity and an opportunity to learn directly from our founder / CEO.
<br>

Thank you for your interest in joining Castle.</span><br><div id="p_66eec69a109ecf8d">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Who Are We?
<br><br>
Prosper ( https://www.themuse.com/companies/prospermarketplace ) is built on a simple idea: connect people who want to borrow money with those that have money to invest. Prosper is an online marketplace that gives borrowers access to individual and institutional investors. Borrowers get low, fixed rates with no hidden fees or prepayment penalties. Investors can earn great returns through the platform’s data-driven underwriting for personal loans, creating a new and diverse investment opportunity. Through Prosper, more than $11 billion in personal loans have helped borrowers consolidate their credit card debt, pay for large purchases, make home improvements and cover medical expenses. Prosper Marketplace is headquartered in San Francisco and operations in Phoenix.
<br><br>
Prosper Marketplace is headquartered in San Francisco. The Prosper marketplace lending platform is owned by Prosper Funding LLC. For more information visit: www.prosper.com and follow Prosper on Twitter @ProsperLoans.
<br><br>
Our Team ( https://www.prosper.com/about-us/management/ )
<br><br>
Our Blog ( https://www.prosper.com/about-us/blog/ )
<br><br>
What We Need
<br><br>
We are seeking an experienced data scientist to join our Marketing Analytics team in San Francisco. The successful candidate is a rigorous data analyst with a passion for seeking truth and driving Prosper's omni-channel marketing strategy. You will apply statistical and economic models to inform spend decisions for Prosper's multi-million dollar marketing budget. You must be able to work both independently and in a collaborative environment with acute attention to detail. This role will report to the Director, Marketing Analytics.
<br><br>
What You Will Do
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Lead investigations into marketing program economics - segmentation, targeting, messaging, conversion, and loan performance - to drive growth and increase efficiencies.</li>
<li>Leverage models to inform key marketing initiatives such as cross-channel spend allocation (UA and retention), expected response, multi-touch attribution, and LTV.</li>
<li>Partner with marketing, product & risk teams to create, develop and integrate marketing testing that align with product and risk strategies.</li>
<li>Perform A/B test analysis and present test results and recommendations.</li>
<li>Influence key decisions across marketing, product, and risk programs through robust data analysis, distilling and presenting actionable insights.</li>
<li>Align closely with business units to develop analysis and predictive modeling to drive critical business organizational decisions and optimization efforts.</li>
</ul>
What You Will Need To Have
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Master’s Degree in STEM or other quantitative field.</li>
<li>PhD preferred but not required</li>
<li>2+ years experience in a data analytics or statistical modeling oriented role; marketing analytics experience preferred.</li>
<li>Strong knowledge of SQL / Python / R or other mathematical programming languages; experience working with large data sets preferred.</li>
<li>Proven experience with statistical modeling techniques.</li>
<li>Demonstrated experience presenting data cross functionally and integrating with a business unit.</li>
<li>Ability to work in a fast paced, ever changing, start-up environment.</li>
<li>Ability to drive solutions to complex problems quickly and successfully, both individually and as part of a team effort.</li>
<li>Willingness to learn new skills and embrace a team-first culture.</li>
</ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Reimagining healthcare starts with exceptional experiences that bring clarity and insight to those receiving and paying for care. Our role in administering health plans puts us a unique position to dig into the most granular level of America's healthcare payment infrastructure. This gives us control over our data quality, which is key for getting specific and actionable insights.
<br><br>
We are looking for an full-stack Data Scientist to join the Analytics team at Collective Health. This position requires that rare mix of applied modeling, data visualization skills and a genuine passion for building flexible and scalable frameworks. You will develop tools for analytics of both health data and financial data. You will work closely with teams across the company to develop these into specific critical analyses as well as revolutionary products that deliver specific insights.
<br><br>
<b>We expect to see:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>An advanced degree (MS/PhD) in a data- and modeling-heavy discipline (e.g. statistics, computer science, economics, econometrics, linguistics, neuroscience, astrophysics, atmospheric science, geophysics, etc.)</li>
<li>Proficient skills in statistics and data modeling (regression, significance testing, multivariate statistics, dirty data, sparse data</li>
<li>Excellent programming skills in Python</li>
<li>Demonstrated experience in data integration in various ways (web APIs, SQL, noSQL, files)</li>
<li>A track record of getting stuff done with minimum supervision and proven success working with data and software engineers</li>
</ul>
<b>Nice to have:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>A flair for visualization</li>
<li>Experience with secure cloud infrastructure (S3 data storage, identity management integration, Unix tools)</li>
<li>Successful record collaborating with multidisciplinary teams</li>
</ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">About the Team
<br>--------------
<br><br>
The inventory algorithm team is responsible for algorithmically buying the right amount of inventory at the right time for Stitch Fix. For example, we’re here to make sure that shorts are in stock in Summer at the right sizes in each one of our warehouses. We are a cross-functional team that continuously collaborates with Stitch Fix’s excellent business partners as well as with the fantastic Stitch Fix Algorithm Team.
<br><br>
About the Role
<br>--------------
<br><br>
This role will be responsible for the Stitch Fix algorithmic allocation efforts, which helps the company send the right amount of inventory to each warehouse. Additionally, this role will also participate in consolidating the team's inventory forecasting use cases (including allocation efforts) into a unified and easy to use code base. This role focuses more on software engineering compared to the other data scientists on the team.
<br><br>
You're excited about this opportunity because you will…
<br>--------------------------------------------------------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Improve the reliability of the inventory forecasting and allocation code through standard software engineering practices</li>
<li>Maintain fast runtimes for the inventory forecasting and allocation code to promote interactive use cases</li>
<li>Iterate and implement service level agreements with the rest of the inventory algorithm team in order to best fulfill business objectives</li>
<li>Communicate and collaborate directly with business partners on allocation efforts in order to maintain healthy inventory across Stitch Fix warehouses</li>
<li>Generalize inventory forecasting service into a re-usable platform that facilitates the creation of new inventory algorithm verticals</li>
<li>Cross-functionally add new features and improve reliability and speed of inventory forecasting code</li>
</ul>
We’re excited about you because…
<br>---------------------------------------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Master's in Statistics/Math/Physics with some professional experience as a software engineer</li>
<li>You have 3-5 years of experience with at least 2 years Software Engineering experience. You like to take a SCRUM approach and implement best engineering practices such as setting up unit tests</li>
<li>You are proficient in Machine Learning</li>
<li>A background in Statistics</li>
<li>You have experience working in cross-functional teams and find there is a strength in numbers</li>
<li>You have production level data science experience, i.e. not just fitting a model, but being held accountable for for performance & reliability in production.</li>
<li>You have excellent communication skills that help simplify and move complex problems forward with business partners.</li>
</ul>
Why you'll love working at Stitch Fix...
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>We are a group of bright, kind and goal oriented people. You can be your authentic self here, and are empowered to encourage others to do the same!</li>
<li>We are a successful, fast-growing company at the forefront of tech and fashion, redefining retail for the next generation</li>

Stitch Fix is an online personal style service for men and women combining art and science to disrupt and redefine the retail industry. <div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>About Us:</b><br>
Coalition was founded by repeat entrepreneurs, Joshua Motta (Cloudflare) and John Hering (Lookout), with a mission to solve cyber risk. We believe that technological risk is among the most pervasive facing society, and we've built the first holistic solution to it by combining free cybersecurity tools to help prevent loss, expert response to mitigate it, and up to $10M of insurance coverage to recover from it. Our technology platform encompasses insurance, threat intelligence, patch and vulnerability scanning, DDoS mitigation, ransomware protection, and more. Coalition’s team of engineers, data scientists, security researchers, incident responders, and insurance personnel protect customers before, during, and after cyber incidents. Our insurance products are backed by Swiss Re, one of the world’s largest (re)insurers, and Argo Group. Our customers are in every industry, and all across the US. We are based in San Francisco, although you'll find some of our team in more exotic places.
<br><br>
If you enjoy solving problems at scale (with lots riding on it) we hope you'll consider joining us.
<br><br>
<b>About the role:</b><br>
In this role you will work closely with our back-end engineering and information security teams. You can expect to analyze large, sparse datasets across the full spectrum of our signals collection efforts, as well as claims and breach data. You will use these signals to develop predictive analytics, and to improve our underwriting and rating models. You will confront, head-on, numerous computational statistical problems resulting from the large number of heterogenous variables that characterize the technological risk surface and security of an organization, as well as underlying risk dynamics that are constantly changing over time.
<br><br>
<b>Responsibilities:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Be(come) an expert on cyber/technological risk, and apply this expertise to make the entire system better.</li>
<li>Take ownership of our data analysis from helping with data collection and ingestion, to visualizing and interpreting results.</li>
<li>Create real-world, risk-based models to project cyber loss and prioritize cyber risk remediation based on historical data.</li>
<li>Work with our security team to address factors not captured by an expected loss model such as serious new vulnerabilities.</li>
<li>Identify aggregation risks and interventions that could minimize them.</li>
<li>Investigate new data sources and work with our back-end engineers to improve data collection and to turn your modeling into production-grade code.</li>
<li>Leverage the large and sparse data sets we collect on technical infrastructure to improve our risk modeling.</li>
</ul>
<b>Requirements:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>MS or PhD in a quantitative discipline.</li>
<li>2 years of relevant work experience in data analysis or related field (e.g., data science, machine learning, financial engineering).</li>
<li>Experience across the spectrum of decision-making and (business) analytics, with demonstrated ability to utilize the appropriate statistical tools to solve a given data analysis problem.</li>
<li>Eager to work with messy, real-world datasets from many disparate sources (expect to interface with high-dimensional, sparse data).</li>
<li>Know how to operate in a modern data science stack - you will have strong SQL skills, experience with data wrangling and script writing, and have familiarity with Python data science tooling.</li>
<li>See data science as a powerful tool to get things done rather than as an end in itself.</li>
<li>Passionate about breaking down and understanding complex systems and taking ownership of solving them in a fast-paced and self-starter environment.</li>
<li>Eager to learn and apply new techniques to a unique data set.</li>
</ul>

</li><li>Advanced knowledge of data management tools including SQL/RDBMS, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB), Hadoop and/or other big data technologies
</li><li>Advanced programming skills in at least one of Java, Python, R, C++, C#, etc.
</li><li>Experience linking multiple data platforms (social media, open, etc) and with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
</li><li>Experience with digital analytics (Next Product to buy, cross channel attribution modeling, digital analytic tools, dynamic ecommerce pricing, etc).
</li><li>Intellectual curiosity, along with excellent problem-solving and quantitative skills, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes and recommend solutions
</li><li>Ability to independently own database development and decisions, balancing demands and deadlines
</li><li>Distinctive communications skills and ability to communicate technical content in an easy to understand way
</li><li>Strong people skills, team-orientation, and a professional attitude
</li><li>Willingness to travel up to 80% (Monday-Thursday)
</li></ul><br>

You will shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and using that data in creative ways, and create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations, with an eye on optimizing every aspect of our clients’ marketing practices.

Through the measurement, manipulation, reporting and dissemination of broad sets of data, you will create valuable, transformative business strategies. <span id="job_summary" class="summary">WHO WE ARE
<br><br>
Bold Metrics Inc. (BMI) has created a suite of AI technologies that allows brands to accurately predict customer body measurements and relate them to garment specifications. Using our cutting-edge machine learning algorithms, retailers and brands are ditching conventional sizing solutions and leveraging our technology to reduce returns and increase conversions. Ultimately, our goal is to revolutionize the apparel industry by leveraging this data to unlock body-relative apparel design.
<br><br>
Historically, apparel sizes have been generated in the absence of customer-driven body data. This has lead to a worldwide apparel waste problem caused by a high rate of returns coupled with a bad consumer experience around fit and sizing, often amplified online. Along with garment sizing optimizations, the downstream experience becomes more customer-driven, leading to a significant reduction in returns and happier customers.
<br><br>
We are a venture-backed well funded company ($3.77M raised to-date) with year-over-year growth of 350%. Bold Metrics works with some of the world’s largest brands, retailers and clothing manufacturers in the US, Europe and Asia, and has offices in Austin, TX and San Francisco, CA.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>About Uber
</b></p><p>We&rsquo;re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we&rsquo;re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it&rsquo;s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.</p><p>

And that&rsquo;s just what we&rsquo;re doing today. We&rsquo;re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we&rsquo;re in for the long haul. We&rsquo;re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.</p>
<p>The mission of the Labs team is to leverage applied behavioral science to power products and cities. As part of the Product Platform Organization, we act as internal consultants who partner with data science, product, and marketing teams to tackle some of Uber&rsquo;s toughest challenges. We&rsquo;re looking for behavioral science enthusiasts with expertise in experimentation, hypothesis testing, causal inference, and other skills to grow our diversity of skills.</p><p>
Example Projects</p><ul><li>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Whistle was born out of our love for pets. As the world’s first technology company dedicated to helping pets live longer and happier lives, we build solutions for common problems faced by pet parents everywhere. Whether a pet is an escape artist, an avid adventurer or a happy couch potato, Whistle provides information and insights to help ensure both pets and their people stay healthy and happy for years to come.
<br><br>
Our current market-leading products include a cellular-enabled GPS tracker and a WiFi & Bluetooth-enabled activity monitor. We do all design and development in-house, from PCB design to embedded software, data analytics to mobile apps. Our pack thrives on solving hard problems in nimble teams.
<br><br>
Backed by the largest petcare company in the world, Whistle is now embarking on one of the largest big data health initiatives in the world; the Pet Insight Project (www.petinsight.com ( http://www.petinsight.com )). By observing pets’ behavior and health histories with unprecedented detail and scale, we seek to detect previously unseen patterns that are early indicators of changes in well-being. This role is a part of the Pet Insight team and will be critical in the research and development of this next generation of petcare.
<br><br>
If you believe you have what it takes to work in a highly independent, fast-paced environment where teamwork is critical and flexibility is a must, then Whistle might be the place for you.
<br><br>
Whistle is looking for a skilled and dynamic engineer that is excited to improve the health of pets by aggregating and learning from large datasets only available to us. <br><br>
<b>You will:</b><br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>About Us</b></p>
<p>Product Madness burst into life in 2007 as the brainchild of two Stanford Business MBA graduates who possessed an innate love of gaming. Initially, the entrepreneurs developed casual games for Facebook and mobile, before having a &lsquo;light-bulb moment&rsquo; in 2009 and refocusing their efforts with laser-guided precision on the exploding social casino genre. They have been bringing world-class social slots to real slots fans ever since.</p>
<p>We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. You should be interested in gaming domain and have passion for data.</p>
<p><b>Who Are You (Requirements)?</b></p>
<ul><li>Degree or equivalent in a relevant field required (Math, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, etc.)</li>
<li>Strong SQL</li>
<li>Experience coding in Python (PyData stack) or other programming language</li>
<li>Experience with any BI tool is a plus</li>
<li>Highly analytical and structured thinking</li>
<li>Extensive experience as a Data Scientist ; PhD is a plus!</li>
<li>Demonstrable interest in Data Science, Big Data, Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics</li>
<li>1-2 year experience in an analytical field</li>
</ul><p><b>What Will You Be Doing (Responsibilities)?</b></p>
<ul><li>Provide data insights for product management and marketing decision making</li>
<li>Build new data products</li>
<li>Participate in &ldquo;deep-dive&rdquo; research projects, such as detailed product analysis, customer segmentation, lifetime value analysis, etc.</li>
<li>Identify potential business opportunities within your area and scope/design approaches to capture those opportunities.</li>
<li>Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB-tests, and work with teams to ensure correct implementation to allow easy, precise analysis of the impact.</li>
<li>Develop an analysis strategy and perform analysis of complex scenarios and AB-tests, both systematically and on a one-off basis.</li>
<li>Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis and reports, quickly, even when confronted by subtle data complications.</li>
<li>Provide an analytics perspective to discussions and prioritization within your team, so that the overall team selects the right ideas to work on.</li>
<li>Be the pro-active owner of the entire data chain for your game(s).</li></ul>
<p><b>How Will You Be Doing it (Our Stack)?</b></p>
<ul><li>Analytics: Python (pandas, scikit-learn, pymc3, statsmodels, bokeh, mpl), SQL, Jupyter notebooks</li>
<li>Big Data: AWS Redshift, Apache Spark, S3</li>
<li>ETL: python, SQL, Spark, Scala, MongoDB</li>
<li>Data viz: D3.js, re:dash, Tableau, bokeh</li></ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>As a DATA SCIENTIST within our Personalized HealthCare function you will work with meaningful data to generate impactful evidence and insights on our molecules/ medicines and patients, that support R&amp;D, advance scientific and medical knowledge, and enable personalized patient care and access.<br>
</p>
<p>You will collaborate with peers within the function and across the organization to develop evidence generation strategies, identify evidence gaps and data sources, design and execute studies, and implement analyses to address molecule and disease area questions. The data will be varied in type - patient-level clinical data, supplemented with deep patient data such as omics (e.g. genomics, proteomic), imaging, digital health, etc. Source data will be diverse - real-world data, including patient registries, electronic medical records, claims, biobanks, and clinical trials. The evidence and insights will be used to inform the research and development of our molecules, and support healthcare decisions by patients, physicians, health authorities, payers, and policy-makers. You will also contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives that shape our business and healthcare environments. This will require a good understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, healthcare environments, as well as strong scientific and technical data science expertise. You will need strong strategic, collaboration and communication skills, as well as an entrepreneurial mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to develop and deliver medicines for our patients.<br>
</p>
<p>As Associate Data Scientist you will typically be responsible for specific studies/ analyses, with support and oversight by more senior data scientists.<br>
</p>
<p>RESPONSIBILITIES<br>
</p>
<ul><li>IDENTIFY EVIDENCE NEEDS &amp; RECOMMEND DATA SOLUTIONS: Ask the right scientific questions, understand the evidence needs for research and development, regulatory and market access, and ideate and make recommendations on fit-for-purpose data and analytics solutions.</li><li>
DEVELOP DATA STRATEGY &amp; GAIN ACCESS TO DATA: Develop strategic plans to access fit-for-purpose data sources to support evidence generation, and gain access to data through collaboration or data generation.</li><li>
DIVE INTO DATA: Develop a comprehensive and deep understanding of the data we work with and foster learning with colleagues using analytical tools and applications to broaden data accessibility and advance our proficiency/efficiency in understanding and using the data appropriately.</li><li>
BE AN EXPERT IN APPLYING METHODS: Stay current with and adopt emergent analytical methodologies, tools and applications to ensure fit-for-purpose and impactful approaches.</li><li>
PRODUCE HIGH QUALITY ANALYSES: Apply rigor in study design and analytical methods; plan for data processing; design a fit-for-purpose analysis plan, assess effective ways of presenting and delivering the results to maximize impact and interpretability; implement and/or oversee the study, including its reporting; ensure compliance with applicable pharma industry regulations and standards.</li><li>
INTERPRET AND SHARE RESULTS: Communicate findings to internal stakeholders, regulatory, health technology assessment (HTA) bodies and scientific communities; publish results; participate in external meetings and forums to present your insights (e.g. congress/conference).</li><li>
COLLABORATE &amp; SHAPE: Collaborate and contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external data science communities, networks, collaboratives, initiatives or goals on knowledge-sharing, methodologies, innovations, technology, IT infrastructure, policy-shaping, processes, etc. to enable broader and more effective use of data and analytics to support business.</li></ul>

About the Position
<br>The associate data scientist is part of the Global Innovation team based in San Francisco. The role supports Goodyear’s efforts to learn, pilot and build a digital platform for new business solutions around emerging automotive trends (shared, autonomous, connected and electric). <br>Support scouting and sourcing new partners to accelerate the Global Innovation portfolio, where relevant

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>POSITION SUMMARY<br>
As a DATA SCIENTIST within our Personalized HealthCare function you will work with meaningful data to generate impactful evidence and insights on our molecules/ medicines and patients, that support R&amp;D, advance scientific and medical knowledge, and enable personalized patient care and access.<br>
<br>
You will collaborate with peers within the function and across the organization to develop evidence generation strategies, identify evidence gaps and data sources, design and execute studies, and implement analyses to address molecule and disease area questions. The data will be varied in type - patient-level clinical data, supplemented with deep patient data such as omics (e.g. genomics, proteomic), imaging, digital health, etc. Source data will be diverse - real-world data (RWD), including patient registries, electronic medical records, claims, biobanks, and clinical trials. The evidence and insights will be used to inform the research and development of our molecules, and support healthcare decisions by patients, physicians, health authorities, payers, and policy-makers. You will also contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives that shape our business and healthcare environments. This will require a good understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, healthcare environments, as well as strong scientific and technical data science expertise. You will need strong strategic, collaboration and communication skills, as well as an entrepreneurial mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to develop and deliver medicines for our patients.<br>
<br>
As Data Scientist you will typically be responsible for a molecule/indication and partner with cross-functional teams and external partners with considerable independence. We have open vacanies for different roles focused on RWD, Omics and Imaging.<br>
<br>
RESPONSIBILITIES<br>
</p>
<ul><li>IDENTIFY EVIDENCE NEEDS &amp; RECOMMEND DATA SOLUTIONS: Ask the right scientific questions, understand the evidence needs for research and development, regulatory and market access, and ideate and make recommendations on fit-for-purpose data and analytics solutions.</li><li>
DEVELOP DATA STRATEGY &amp; GAIN ACCESS TO DATA: Develop strategic plans to access fit-for-purpose data sources to support evidence generation, and gain access to data through collaboration or data generation.</li><li>
DIVE INTO DATA: Develop a comprehensive and deep understanding of the data we work with and foster learning with colleagues using analytical tools and applications to broaden data accessibility and advance our proficiency/efficiency in understanding and using the data appropriately.</li><li>
BE AN EXPERT IN APPLYING METHODS: Stay current with and adopt emergent analytical methodologies, tools and applications to ensure fit-for-purpose and impactful approaches.</li><li>
PRODUCE HIGH QUALITY ANALYSES: Apply rigor in study design and analytical methods; plan for data processing; design a fit-for-purpose analysis plan, assess effective ways of presenting and delivering the results to maximize impact and interpretability; implement and/or oversee the study, including its reporting; ensure compliance with applicable pharma industry regulations and standards.</li><li>
INTERPRET AND SHARE RESULTS: Communicate findings to internal stakeholders, regulatory, health technology assessment (HTA) bodies and scientific communities; publish results; participate in external meetings and forums to present your insights (e.g. congress/conference).</li><li>
COLLABORATE &amp; SHAPE: Collaborate and contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external data science communities, networks, collaboratives, initiatives or goals on knowledge-sharing, methodologies, innovations, technology, IT infrastructure, policy-shaping, processes, etc. to enable broader and more effective use of data and analytics to support business.</li></ul>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Who You Are</h2>
<p>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS<br>
</p>
<ul><li>MSc, PhD or similar qualification in a quantitative data science discipline (e.g., statistics/ biostatistics, epidemiology, bioinformatics, health economics, computational biology, computer science, mathematics, outcomes research, public health, biology, medicine, psychology)</li><li>
Demonstrated track record of developing and execution of data science research projects, patient-level data analyses (e.g., real world data, surveys, clinical trials, registries, claims, genomic or imaging data) with publications and presentations</li><li>
Demonstrated experience with managing project scope and driving delivery in an evolving environment requiring proactivity and effective problem-solving and prioritization when faced with challenges</li><li>
Demonstrated strong collaboration skills and excellent communication skills</li><li>
Demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to teach others and willingness to learn new techniques</li><li>
Proficiency in English, both written and verbal</li><li>
For Senior &amp; Principal Data Scientist: Track record of effectively working in a matrix environment with global, international team members coming from scientific, business and operational backgrounds, using influence without authority</li></ul>
PREFERRED/ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS<br>
<ul><li>PhD degree in a quantitative discipline as listed in Minimum Qualifications</li><li>
Fluency in statistical programming languages (R, Python, etc.)</li><li>
Experience implementing advanced analytics approaches (machine learning, longitudinal data analysis, etc.)</li><li>
Experience with technologies required to undertake analyses on large data sources or with computationally intensive steps (SQL, parallelization, Hadoop, Spark, etc.)</li><li>
Experience producing interactive outputs (Shiny, etc.)</li><li>
Contributor to open source packages, libraries or functions</li><li>
Experience implementing reproducible research practices like version control (e.g., using Git) and literate programming</li><li>
For RWD focused role: Experience analyzing RWD (non-interventional studies, electronic medical records, claims, disease registries etc.)</li><li>
For Omics focused role: Experience analyzing next generation sequencing data, proteomics etc.</li><li>
For Imaging focused role: Experience analyzing high dimensional imaging data in healthcare</li></ul></span><br><div id="p_178af76275edc695">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>About Uber
</b></p><p>We&rsquo;re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we&rsquo;re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it&rsquo;s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.</p><p>
For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.</p><p>
And that&rsquo;s just what we&rsquo;re doing today. We&rsquo;re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we&rsquo;re in for the long haul. We&rsquo;re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.</p>
<p><b>About the Role</b></p><p>
We&rsquo;re looking for an experienced data scientist on our Marketing Data Science team to apply statistical and machine learning models to drive investment decisions for Uber&rsquo;s multi-million dollar marketing budget. You will be responsible for building quantitative models and developing actionable analytical solutions that will inform decisions across Uber&rsquo;s marketing budget, accelerating both demand and supply growth within Uber&rsquo;s cities worldwide! The right person for this role has a passion for leveraging large scale data analysis, predictive modeling, machine learning, experimentation and technology to power decisions across our marketing investment.<br>

Work with cross-functional teams to implement and deploy models and enhance analytical solutions by providing data-driven recommendations</li><li>
Leverage large scale data processing such as Spark, Hive, and Uber&rsquo;s proprietary machine learning platform, and more</li><li>

Minimum 1 year of experience as a data scientist at a company with global operations</li><li>
Expertise with R or Python</li><li>

Advanced SQL skills - comfortable working with very large data sets</li><li>
Experience with big data using technologies like Hadoop, Hive, and Spark a plus</li><li>
Previous experience in advertising tech is a plus</li><li>
Experience in building advertising bid optimization algorithms a plus</li><li>
Great communication skills, organized, able to multitask and be a team player</li><li>
Balance attention to detail with swift execution</li><li>

Enthusiasm about Uber and UberEats!</li></ul></span><br><div id="p_89c358f3e5778600">

The PDS team works with executives, product managers, designers, developers, user researchers, marketers, and sales team members across all Salesforce Cloud businesses to discover new opportunities for growth and optimization, experiment with data, drive adoption, and provide actionable insights that impact product strategy. Role Description: The Growth Analyst position will report to a Sr. Growth Analyst on the Product Data Science team. The Growth Analyst Intern&rsquo;s main objective will be to help shape Salesforce products by delivering data-driven product insights, conducting adoption tests, and guiding a team of Data Engineers and Data Scientists to productize these insights. All Growth Analysts must be able to build relationships and collaborate across a large, matrixed environment, and comfortably present findings to large groups of product executives. Responsibilities: - You will be partnered with one of our Sr. Growth Analysts to help support a Salesforce cloud business with their strategic business objectives, product direction, roadmaps, key metrics, and growth goals. - Day-to-day, you will collaborate with other Growth Analysts to produce growth insights, identify opportunities for product improvements, and advise investment decisions. Experience with Splunk, Python, and BI tools (e.g. Salesforce Wave, Tableau) is a plus. - Strong communication and visualization skills; can easily create powerful visualizations that transform complex data into easily-consumable, actionable insights. - Expert level experience with Excel and PowerPoint. - Extremely proactive mindset; can anticipate questions, lead growth conversations with the product team, and automate answers to routine questions. - Detailed knowledge of and curiosity about latest trends in SaaS growth industry, including evaluating and testing new tools, techniques, and frameworks. - Hands-on on Salesforce knowledge of products and functionality a plus.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Job Description<br>
<br>
<p>Atlassian is looking for a Data Engineer to join our Marketing Data Engineering team and build world-class data solutions and applications that powers crucial business decisions throughout the organization. We are looking for an open minded, structured thinker who is passionate about building systems at scale. You&rsquo;ll be the genius who understands data at Atlassian, knows where to find it, and manages the process to make that data useful for Analytics. You love thinking about the ways the business can consume this data and then figuring out how to build it.<br>
On a typical day you will be building the data models and ETL processes to provide this data for business use. You've got industry experience working with large datasets. You are interested in reporting platforms and data visualization. As the data domain expert, you will be partnering with our technology teams, analytical teams, and data scientists across various initiatives.<br>
You'll own a problem end-to-end, so those skills will come in handy not just to collect, extract, and clean the data, but also to understand the systems that generated it, and automate your analyses and reporting. On an on-going basis, you'll be responsible for improving the data by adding new sources, coding business rules, and producing new metrics that support the business. Requirements will be vague. Iterations will be rapid. You will need to be nimble and take smart risks.<br>
</p><p>
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.</p> Qualifications<br>
<br>
<p>As a data engineer, you may have experience spanning traditional DW and ETL architectures. But for this role it is important to have industry experience working with big data ecosystems like Spark/Hadoop and Redshift. You&rsquo;ve probably been in the industry as an engineer for 2+ years and have developed a passion for the data that drives businesses.</p><p>
On your first day, we'll expect you to have:</p><ul><li>
Deep understanding of big data challenges and eco-system<br>
</li><li>Experience with solution building and architecting with public cloud offerings such as Amazon Web Services, Redshift, S3, EMR/Spark, Presto/Athena<br>
</li><li>Experience with Spark and Hive<br>
</li><li>Expertise in SQL, SQL tuning, schema design, Python and ETL processes<br>
</li><li>Expertise in data pipeline with such workflow tools as Airflow, Oozie or Luigi<br>
</li><li>Solid understanding experience in building RESTful APIs and microservices, e.g. with Flask<br>
</li><li>Experience in test automation and ensuring data quality across multiple datasets used for analytical purposes<br>
</li><li>Experience with Lambda Architecture or other Big Data architectural best practices<br>
</li><li>A graduate degree in Computer Science or similar discipline<br>
</li><li>Commit code to open source projects<br>
</li><li>Experience with test automation and continuous delivery</li></ul><p>

Experience with Tableau<br>
</li><li>Experience with Machine Learning<br>

More about our team<br>
Atlassian is over a decade old, but our team is much younger. We'll have to blaze new trails to enable important growth decisions, so we're constantly growing, learning, and trying to do things differently. You&rsquo;ll be joining a team that is crazy smart and very direct. We ask hard questions and challenge each other to constantly improve our work. We are self-driven but team oriented. We're all about enabling growth by delivering the right data and insights in the right way to partners across the company.<br>
