<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>About Uber
</b></p><p>We&rsquo;re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we&rsquo;re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it&rsquo;s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.</p><p>
For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.</p><p>
And that&rsquo;s just what we&rsquo;re doing today. We&rsquo;re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we&rsquo;re in for the long haul. We&rsquo;re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.</p>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">About the Team</h2><p>
This data science and economics team works with the Legal team on Uber&rsquo;s most important legal issues. We work with the Legal team to develop analyses and arguments&mdash;based on data, economics, and the law&mdash;to defend Uber against risks in litigation and provide regulators answers to their requests for information.</p><h2 class="jobSectionHeader">
About this Role</h2><p>
Data Scientists on the this team work at the intersection of data science, economics, and the law. The data analyst is responsible for developing a deep understanding of Uber's databases and their quirks as well as assembling, analyzing, and telling compelling stories with data.</p><h2 class="jobSectionHeader">
What We&rsquo;re Looking For</h2><p>
Responsibilities</p><ul><li>
Describe and explain Uber&rsquo;s data to lawyers, regulators, and other key stakeholders</li><li>
Generate ideas for analyses to advance Uber&rsquo;s legal goals</li><li>
Design queries of our databases that can be replicated to satisfy Uber&rsquo;s legal data reporting requirements</li><li>
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as business development and engineering</li></ul><h2 class="jobSectionHeader">
Requirements</h2><ul><li>
2-4 years of experience and a bachelor&rsquo;s or master&rsquo;s degree in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative field preferred</li><li>
Strong data skills and a shown ability to use tools such as SQL, Python, and R to work efficiently at scale</li><li>
Balance attention to detail with swift execution, including the ability to deliver on tight timelines</li><li>
Hustle is critical, as moving quickly and executing to allow for continual iteration is a strength of our team</li><li>
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently</li><li>
Strong communication and organization skills</li><li>
Experience working with a legal group or interest in Uber&rsquo;s global legal and policy issues is a plus</li></ul><p>
Ideally you are not only fluent in the language of data but are also an adept written and verbal communicator. You should have the ability to get through to external parties and help them understand the nuances of our arguments. Fluency in English, both oral and written, is critical.</p></span><br><div id="p_790614a068929864">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Introduction
</h2><br>
<br>
<b>THIS ANNOUNCEMENT HAS BEEN REISSUED FOR ADDITIONAL RECRUITMENT. APPLICANTS WHO PREVIOUSLY SUBMITTED AN APPLICATION NEED NOT RE-APPLY. THIS POSITION MAY CLOSE ANY TIME, BUT NO EARLIER THAN JULY 31, 2017.
</b><br>

<b>Salary range: $124,228 - $168,298. Salary upon appointment will be based on candidate’s documented and substantiated exceptional skills and experience.
</b><br>
<br>
<b>Appointment Type: </b>Permanent-Exempt. This position is exempt from Civil Service Commission rules pursuant to the City and County of San Francisco, Charter Section 10.104, and incumbents serve at the discretion of the Appointing Officer.
<br>
<br>
SFO is a world-class, award-winning airport that served more than 54 million guests in 2016. SFO offers non-stop flights to 49 international cities on 41 international carriers. The Bay Area's largest airport also connects non-stop with 83 U.S. cities on 13 domestic airlines. In fiscal year 16/17, the Airport, an enterprise department of the City & County of San Francisco, accounted for $8.4 billion in business activity and supported over 42,800 direct jobs.
<br>
<br>
SFO’s mission is to provide an exceptional airport in service to our communities and is committed to redefining air travel. SFO has embarked on the renovation of Terminal 1, the largest capital project in the Airport’s $7.3 billion Ascent Program. For more information, visit www.flysfo.com . View an Inside SFO video about careers at SFO.
<br>
<br>
<b>POSITION DESCRIPTION:
</b><br>
<br>
Under the general direction of the ITT Managing Enterprise Architect, this position will be responsible for integrating business, information, and technology into analytical models that help drive business performance and competitive advantage and providing the business with answers to questions. The role collaborates with Business Analysts and Platform architects to create value from varied data sources. Creating value from data requires a range of talents: from data integration and preparation, to architecting specialized computing/database environments, to data mining and intelligent algorithm development. This role is viewed as an expert in making sense of complex data environments, encompassing both business data and process understanding and technical expertise. Leads in developing innovative, technical solutions to important, highly complex strategic and operating problems. Provides technical consulting on complex projects.
<br>
<br>
<b>Job Duties:
</b><br>
<br>
* Wrangle, interpret, and integrate data from diverse internal and external sources and systems using appropriate client libraries and APIs.
<br>
<br>
* Apply and evaluate statistical models and machine learning algorithms to help answer business questions and solve business problems.
<br>
<br>
* Dig beneath the surface to unearth data-driven, consumable insights that help to bust myths, reinforce strategies, or suggests new opportunities for the business.
<br>
<br>
* Create data visualizations and stories that convey key insights to business audiences in an impactful manner, while also seeking innovative solutions for sharing knowledge more widely across the organization.
<br>
<br>
* As needed, collaborate within and across teams to improve the ways in which key data streams are captured, managed, and made accessible for analysis.
<br>
<br>
* Apply data-mining and machine learning techniques for a variety of modeling and relevance problems involving DNS and networking data.
<br>
<br>
* Build complex statistical models that learn from and scale to petabytes of data.
<br>
<br>
* Work with architects and product managers to identify analytics initiatives and develop efficient and reliable algorithms.
<br>
<br>
* Work collaboratively across multi-disciplinary teams throughout the company as a subject matter expert in analytics with a focus on security solutions and implementation.
<br>
<br>
* Apply statistical and econometric models on large datasets to: (a) Measure results and outcomes; (b) Identify causal impact and attribution; (c) Predict future performance of users or products; and, (d) Solve real problems at the airport to drive tangible outcomes.
<br>
<br>
* Design, analyze, and interpret the results of data mining and research experiments.
<br>
<br>
* Architect and deploy machine learning systems to production.
<br>
<br>
* Design and implement metrics that align with enterprise performance objectives and goals.
<br>
<br>
* Analyze a wide variety of data: structured and unstructured, observational and experimental.
<br>
<br>
* Advise technology, operations and business unit teams on sound statistical practices.
<br>
<br>
* Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources.
<br>
<br>
* Analyze and process huge amounts of data by using data mining, statistics, and database techniques.
<br>
<br>
* Develop techniques and algorithms for mining large social data sets.
<br>
<br>
* Work in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment as in a competitive landscape new data keeps flowing in rapidly and the world is constantly changing.
<br>
<br>
* Work autonomously.
<br>
<br>
* Develop a scalable, extensible and reliable distributed data architecture for our technology services and solutions.
<br>
<br>
* Work with Enterprise Architect to scope the requirements to build/extend large-scale data hubs, data ingestion, feature extraction, model development and risk scoring systems built on Big Data technologies.
<br>
<br>
* Work with the Enterprise Architect to support Data component development for the overall Enterprise Architecture Framework for the airport.
<br>
<br>
* Hand on development of critical data science components.
<br>
<br>
* Ensure compliance with data and technology standards and with approved / agreed upon design and development patterns including design reviews.
<br>
<br>
* Develop and enhance design documents to reflect the latest implementations.
<br>
<br>
* Develop test cases, test strategies and test plans.
<br>
<br>
* Work with agile methodology.
<br>
<br>
* Provide prompt resolutions to data related and/or other technical issues.
<br>
<br>
* Perform other duties as assigned.
<br>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Definition
</h2>Working under general administrative direction, the Technology Expert plans, organizes, performs, delivers, directs and/or controls highly complex technology-related work products requiring industry or product expertise in broad areas of information technology.
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Minimum Qualifications
</h2><em>These minimum qualifications establish the education, training, experience, special skills and/or license(s) which are required for employment in the classification. Please note, additional qualifications (i.e., special conditions) may apply to a particular position and will be stated on the exam/job announcement.
</em><br>
<br>
<b>Education:
</b><br>
<br>
An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) quarter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field]; <b>AND
</b><br>
<br>
<b>Experience:
</b><br>
<br>
Five (5) years of recent and verifiable experience with probability and statistics, including experimental design, predictive modeling, optimization, and causal inference.
<br>
<br>
<b>**Please note: The five (5) years of experience requirement must be obtained within the last seven (7) years.**
</b><br>
<br>
<b>Substitution:
</b><br>
<br>
Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). Thirty (30) semester units or forty-five (45) quarter units equal one (1) year.
<br>
<br>
<b>Additional Requirement: </b>In addition to meeting the minimum qualifications, this position requires sufficient strength and coordination of lifting, pushing, pulling and/or carrying the 35 Lbs. weight of computer systems equipment. It also requires bending, stooping and/or crawling in order to install or repair computer systems hardware (TST029).
<br>
<br>
<b>Working Condition: </b>Essential duties require the following physical skills and work environment: Ability to work in a standard office environment which may involve prolonged sitting, bending and operation of typing, word processing and other office equipment; and ability to work evening meetings.
<br>
<br>
The above minimum qualifications reflect special conditions associated with the position(s) to be filled. They may differ from the standard minimum qualifications associated with this classification.
<br>
<br>
<b>DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS:
</b><br>
<br>
The stated desirable qualifications may be used to identify job finalists at the end of the selection process when candidates are referred for hiring.
<br>
<br>
* Knowledge of a statistical language such as R or Python.
<br>
<br>
* Familiarity with a scripting language and/or shell scripting.
<br>
<br>
* Excellent written and verbal technical communication skills.
<br>
<br>
* Experience in architecting/designing large and complex data analytics including data modeling and feature extraction.
<br>
<br>
* Experience in performance optimization, in depth understanding of schedulers, data pipelines & processing, workload management, availability, scalability of distributed data platforms.
<br>
<br>
* Knowledge with Security, machine learning, Cloud (S3, EC2, ELB, MapReduce, CloudFormation).
<br>
<br>
* Ability to query databases and perform statistical analysis.
<br>
<br>
* Ability to develop or program databases.
<br>
<br>
* Ability to advice senior management in clear language about the implications of their work for the organization.
<br>
<br>
* Understanding of how a business and strategy works.
<br>
<br>
* Ability to create examples, prototypes, demonstration to help management better understand the work.
<br>
<br>
* Understanding of design and architecture principles.
<br>
<br>
* Possession of a Bachelor’s degree in applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics, engineering or other relevant technical field; A Master’s degree is desirable.
<br>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">How To Apply
</h2>Applications for City and County of San Francisco jobs are only accepted through an online process. Visit www.jobaps.com/sf to register an account (if you have not already done so) and begin the application process.
<br>
<br>
* Select the 9976 Technology Expert I – Data Scientist (PEX-9976-076996) job announcement
<br>
<br>
* Select “Apply” and read and acknowledge the information
<br>
<br>
* Select either “I am a New User” if you have not previously registered, or “I have Registered Previously”
<br>
<br>
* Follow instructions on the screen
<br>
<br>
Computers are available for the public (from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday) to file online applications in the lobby of the Dept. of Human Resources at 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor, San Francisco, or the Airport Commission Human Resources at 710 N. McDonnell Road, 3rd Floor, San Francisco, CA 94128 for use by the public to apply for City jobs. The hours of operation are from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.
<br>
<br>
Applicants may be contacted by email about this announcement and, therefore, it is their responsibility to ensure that their registered email address is accurate and kept up-to-date. Also, applicants must ensure that email from CCSF is not blocked on their computer by a spam filter.
<br>
<br>
To prevent blocking, applicants should set up their email to accept CCSF mail from the following addresses (@sfgov.org, @sfdpw.org, @sfport.com, @flysfo.com, @sfwater.org, @sfdph.org, @asianart.org, @sfmta.com, @sfpl.org, @dcyf.org, @first5sf.org). Applicants will receive a confirmation email that their online application has been received in response to every announcement for which they file. Applicants should retain this confirmation email for their records. Failure to receive this email means that the online application was not submitted or received.
<br>
<br>
All work experience, education, training and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included on your application by the filing deadline. Information submitted after the filing deadline will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications. Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification or may lead to lower scores.
<br>
<br>
If you have any questions regarding this recruitment or application process, please contact the exam analyst, Charlene Cun, by telephone at 650-821-2018, or by email at Charlene.Cun@flysfo.com .
<br>
<br>
<b>Note: </b>Make sure your application and any attachments to the application submitted at the time of filing are complete and accurate and include details on all experience, education, training and other information that qualifies you for this recruitment. Failure to submit a complete and accurate application at the time of filing may result in your ineligibility for this recruitment. Only the most qualified applicants will continue on in the selection process.
<br>
<br>
<b>Verification: </b>Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency, can be found at http://sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=456
<br>
<br>
Verification of qualifying experience, when requested, must be documented on the employer's business letterhead and must include the name of the applicant, job title(s), dates of employment, description of job duties performed, and signature of the employer or the employer’s authorized representative. Experience claimed in self-employment will only be accepted if supported by documents verifying income, earnings, business license and experience comparable to minimum qualifications above. Copies of income tax papers or other documents listing occupation and total earnings must be submitted. Employees of the City and County of San Francisco may submit performance evaluations showing duties performed to verify qualifying City experience. City employees will receive credit for the duties of the class to which appointed. Credit for experience obtained outside of the employee's class will be allowed only if recorded in accordance with the provisions of Civil Service Commission Rules. Verification may be waived if impossible to obtain. The applicant must submit a signed statement explaining why verification cannot be obtained. Waiver requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Failure to provide the required verification, or request for waiver when requested may result in rejection of application.
<br>
<br>
<b>Note: </b>Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.
<br>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Selection Procedures
</h2>The selection process will include evaluation of applications in relation to minimum requirements. Applicants meeting the minimum qualifications are not guaranteed advancement to the interview. Depending on the number of applicants, the Department may establish and implement additional screening mechanisms to comparatively evaluate the qualifications of candidates. If this becomes necessary, only those applicants whose qualifications most closely meet the needs of the Department will be invited for an interview.
<br>
<br>
<b>Notes: </b>Applicants who meet the minimum qualifications are not guaranteed advancement through all of the steps in the selection procedure.
<br>
<br>
<b>Transportation Security Administration (TSA) Security Clearance: </b>Candidates for employment with the San Francisco Airport Commission are required to undergo a criminal history record check, including FBI fingerprints, and Security Threat Assessment in order to determine eligibility for security clearance and may be required to undergo drug/alcohol screening. Per Civil Service Commission Rule Section 110.9.1, every applicant for an examination must possess and maintain the qualifications required by law and by the examination announcement for the examination. Failure to obtain and maintain security clearance may be basis for termination from employment with the Airport Commission.
<br>
<br>
<b>Selection Procedures Notes: </b>Candidates must pass each part of the selection procedure.
<br>
<br>

</h2><b>Reasonable Accommodation Request: </b>Applicants with disabilities requiring reasonable accommodation for this examination can find information on requesting a reasonable accommodation at http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#applicantswithdisabilities

<br>
<br>
<b>Terms of Announcement and Appeal Rights: </b>Applicants must be guided solely by the provisions of this announcement, including requirements, time periods and other particulars, except when superseded by federal, state or local laws, rules or regulations. Clerical errors may be corrected by the posting the correction on the Department of Human Resources website at www.jobaps.com/sf .
<br>
<br>
The terms of this announcement may be appealed under Civil Service Rule 111A.35.1. The standard for the review of such appeals is ‘abuse of discretion’ or ‘no rational basis’ for establishing the position description, the minimum qualifications and/or the certification rule. Appeals must include a written statement of the item(s) being contested and the specific reason(s) why the cited item(s) constitute(s) abuse of discretion by the Human Resources Director. Appeals must be submitted directly to the Executive Officer of the Civil Service Commission within five business days of the announcement issuance date.
<br>
<br>
<b>Copies of Application Documents: </b>http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#copies . Applicants are advised to keep copies of all documents submitted. Submitted documents become a permanent part of the exam record and will not be returned. The hiring department may require applicants to submit the same documents and/or additional documents at a later date.
<br>
<br>
<b>Right to Work: </b>All persons entering the City and County of San Francisco workforce are required to provide verification of authorization to work in the United States.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">We have an opening on our assay development team for a skilled research scientist who has experience with Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS). The assay development team designs and develops fully-automated, high-throughput next generation sequencing-based genetic tests from concept through commercial launch. Our team strives to create a highly collaborative environment, with an emphasis on cross-functional projects and teams. We are constantly assessing and integrating cutting-edge technology into our laboratory and development process. You will play a key role in early development work on new assays and features to move toward our goal to make affordable and comprehensive genetic testing a reality.
<br><br>
<b>What you will bring:</b><br>
--------------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>The ideal candidate will require minimal scientific guidance beyond project goals and can design/execute experiments independently</li>
<li>Extensive molecular biology experience</li>
<li>Understanding of human genetics, particularly classes of genetic variation and their intersections with cutting edge molecular technologies</li>
<li>Master’s degree and/or Ph.D. with at least 2 years of industry experience</li>
<li>Demonstrated ability to optimize processes and/or complex reactions</li>
<li>Experience designing and optimizing genetic assays</li>
<li>Experience with and understanding of high throughput sequencing instruments (Illumina, PacBio)</li>
<li>Exquisite attention to detail and organization</li>
<li>Ability to multitask and operate in a dynamic environment</li>
<li>Preferred: Assay or technology development experience</li>
<li>Preferred: Experience with high throughput liquid handlers</li>
<li>Preferred: Performing analysis of large genetic data sets, use and understanding of common NGS analysis toolkits (gatk, bedtools, samtools), Unix, R, Python</li>
<li>Ability to work in our lab in San Francisco 5 days/week</li>
</ul>
At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.</span><br><div id="p_24347fb3b884caef">

You make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.
<br>
<br>
You can see different angles of a product or business opportunity, and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You have substantial experience with analytical tools and techniques, and bring a solid skill-set in analyzing data and communicating recommendations. You will deepen your skill-set by working with analytical thought leaders across the company.
<br>

Data Scientists are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
<br>

This is a unique hybrid role that will focus on your knowledge of data infrastructure and your ability to drive insights.
<br>
<br>
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">We are looking for a Signal Processing and Data Analysis Scientist to be a part of the team that designs, implements, tests algorithms and conducts data analysis for Sano’s novel sensor platform focused on continuous body chemistry monitoring.
<br><br>
<b>What you'll be doing:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Mathematically model complex, stochastic physical phenomena associated with a wearable electro-chemical bio-sensor which is used for real-time, physiological analyte estimation.</li>
<li>Develop new and improve existing signal processing algorithms for bio-sensor anomaly detection and correction.</li>
<li>Implement new and existing proof-of-concept algorithms (for basic analyte tracking, subsequent real-time inference of user state, identification and estimation of meaningful, long and short-term metrics associated with user health) in production-quality, cloud-based software.</li>
<li>Contribute to the design of experiments intended to isolate error sources. Statistically analyze the impact of errors on performance.</li>
</ul>
<b>What you'll bring:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Very significant, proven industrial experience in statistical modeling, time-series analysis, and signal processing (i.e., digital filtering, spectral analysis, probability, multi-dimensional random processes).</li>
<li>Demonstrated expertise using variety of classical and modern methods of statistical inference and learning (i.e., regression, point and interval estimation, hypothesis testing, classification, Markov-modeling, clustering) for solving practical problems.</li>
<li>Superior software skills with expertise in Python (pandas, numpy, scipy, matplotlib) and best-practices methodologies (i.e., revision control, test-based development).</li>
<li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li>
<li>Highly systematic thinker who displays a blend of theoretical rigor and practical, deadline driven task completion.</li>
</ul>
*
<br>Masters or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering or related field required with 8-10+ years of direct, relevant industry experience.
<br><br>
Sano
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Driven by the desire to understand the human body.</li>
</ul>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">VIA Overview
</b><br>
<br>
Verisk Innovative Analytics (VIA), a unit of Verisk Analytics (VRSK), develops advanced analytical solutions to challenging problems related to risk and decision-making in industry verticals related to insurance, healthcare, financial services, energy, and retail. We are an internal analytical consultancy for various Verisk business units and a research and development team for new analytical products that cross business areas or extend us into new industry verticals. Our work combines vast data resources with advanced technology to create innovative and technically rigorous solutions. VIA employs a multidisciplinary team of individuals with advanced backgrounds in statistics, actuarial science, mathematics, computer science, machine learning, operations research, and many other fields.
<br>
<br>
<b>Position Overview
</b><br>
<br>
Verisk Innovative Analytics is looking for a bright, energetic analytic scientist/data scientist. In this position, you will work, in small teams on all aspects of varied analytic projects.
<br>
<br>
<b>Responsibilities include:
</b><br>
<ul><li>Designing analytic solutions for our industry verticals and cross-enterprise product research
</li><li>Developing analytic solutions using a variety of methodologies including predictive modeling, text mining, forecasting, network analytics and image processing
</li><li>Performing model validation, and measuring model performance
</li><li>Presenting model methodology and results to senior stakeholders and clients
</li><li>Work with deployment team to implement final models in production
</li><li>Provide technical assistance to development partners and clients
</li><li>Keep abreast of and adapt to technical innovations and new developments
</li><li>Manage/mentor more junior analysts
</li></ul><br>
<b>Qualifications include:
</b><br>
<ul><li>Masters or PhD in quantitative field
</li><li>Level of hire will be based on years of relevant experience
</li><li>A track record of outstanding academic performance
</li><li>Ability to solve problems analytically and creatively
</li><li>Strong communication (written and oral) skills
</li><li>Strong programming skills, particularly in Java, Python, R and SAS
</li><li>Familiarity with SQL or NoSQL databases
</li></ul><b>Opportunities:
</b><br>
<ul><li>Apply Online at http://www.verisk.com/careers/
</li><li>All members of the Verisk Analytics Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers.</li></ul></span><br><div id="p_7b78e1e2158099d9">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>Our mission:</b><br>
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.
<br><br>
<b>The team:</b><br>
We are a rapidly growing and highly capable engineering team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.
<br><br>
<b>Your job:</b><br>
As a Data Scientist at Indeed your role is to follow the data. Analyze, visualize, and model job search related data. You will build and implement machine learning models to make timely decisions. You will have access to unparalleled resources within Indeed to grow and develop both personally and professionally.
<br><br>
We are looking for a mixture between a statistician, scientist, machine learning expert and engineer: someone who has passion for building and improving Internet-scale products informed by data. The ideal candidate understands human behavior and knows what to look for in the data.
<br><br>
<b>About you:</b><br>
Requirements
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Ph.D. or M.S. in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics</li>
<li>Minimum 2+ years of professional industry experience in data science</li>
<li>Expertise in machine learning and statistical modeling</li>
<li>Passion to answer Product/Engineering questions with data</li>
<li>Strong ability to code in Python</li>
</ul>
We get excited about candidates who
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Have full stack experience in data collection, aggregation, analysis, visualization, productionization, and monitoring of data science products</li>
<li>Are proficient in small data modeling work: Python, R, Julia, Octave</li>
<li>Are proficient in big data modeling work: Hadoop, Pig, Scala, Spark</li>
<li>Can fish for data: SQL, Pandas, MongoDB</li>
<li>Deploy data science solutions: Java, Python, C++</li>
<li>Communicate concisely and persuasively with engineers and product managers</li>
</ul>
Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.
<br><br>
<b>View our bounty of perks:</b> [1] http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits</span><br><div id="p_16f780e35819b8bf">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Thanks for your interest in working at LeapYear.
<br>
<br>
This is an overview of the problem we are solving, what we’ve done so far, and how you can get involved.
<br>
<br>
LeapYear is a secure, automated machine learning platform for integrating, analyzing, and protecting sensitive data.
<br>
<br>
Enterprises cannot safely leverage their data for analytics and machine learning because of security, privacy, and regulatory risks. LeapYear's technology enables enterprises to securely analyze and share sensitive data without exposing any confidential information.
<br>
<br>
Unlike traditional methods which remove or obfuscate information, LeapYear enables analytics across all data elements and data sources with the highest standard of security and privacy.
<br>
<br>
LeapYear is deployed with the world’s largest enterprises across healthcare, technology, and financial services, solving entrenched problems around operationalizing data. We have raised $12.6M in capital and contracted seven-figure annual recurring revenue from customers. LeapYear is backed by Bain Capital Ventures, Nyca Partners, Silicon Valley Bank, Bloomberg, and Peter Thiel.
<br>
<br>
LeapYear has a strong culture of teaching, learning, and constant improvement. Our team includes senior executives from Fortune 500 companies as well as PhD-level cryptographers, researchers, and machine learning engineers with decades of experience with top organizations such as Google, Uber, MIT, and the US Department of Defense.
<br>
<br>
We are advised by Enrique Salem , former CEO of Symantec, Hans Morris , former President of VISA, and world experts in security and machine learning.
<br>
<br>
To learn more about our mission, team, and company culture, please see: http://leapyear.ai/careers .
<br>
<br>
Your Role
<br>
<br>
As a data scientist at LeapYear, you will be responsible for conceptualizing, developing, testing, and deploying machine learning products on customer data sets. You and our data science team will use LeapYear's platform to create value from the world's most sensitive, siloed data sources.
<br>
<br>
For details on the specific responsibilities and requirements of this role, please see below. <br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Responsibilities
</h3><ul><ul><li>Leverage LeapYear’s secure machine learning platform to deliver value from the world’s most sensitive and previously siloed data sources
</li><li>Conceptualize, develop, test, and deploy machine learning products on customer data sets using LeapYear’s platform
</li><li>Become an expert user and advocate of LeapYear’s secure machine learning SDK and collaborate with product and engineering to develop best practices and new features
</li><li>Serve as a technical and subject matter expert in financial services and healthcare information technology, assisting sales during pre-sales and post-sales efforts </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Qualifications
</h3><ul><ul><li>PhD or equivalent in machine learning, computer science, math, statistics, or physics
</li><li>Strong foundations in the theoretical underpinnings of machine learning
</li><li>Minimum 2 years of data science experience required
</li><li>Experience manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
</li><li>Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
</li><li>Experience working with large data sets and tools like MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.
</li><li>Experience working with large data streaming technologies like Spark, Flink, etc.
</li><li>Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced startup environment
</li><li>Expert knowledge of data analytics architecture, including knowledge of RDBMS, ETL, BI, and advanced machine learning libraries (e.g. Scikit-learn, MLlib, TensorFlow, Theano, Caffe), etc.
</li><li>Deep understanding of data science process, machine learning, data architecture, and IT systems
</li><li>Experience with the analytical workflows used in financial services and healthcare </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">A few of the perks

Airbnb has become a global platform that connects travelers and hosts from over 34,000 cities. As such, it has collected a diverse set of numerical, textual, visual, and unstructured data, which our Data Science team mines for insights that will propel our community and product forward.

<br><br>

<li>Work with our marketplace team to develop a new price recommendation algorithm for our host community</li>
<li>Develop machine learning models with our Trust and Safety team that can identify risky behavior before impacting our community</li>
<li>Improve the statistical methodology behind our experimentation platform to ensure that our understanding of product changes is rigorous and accurate</li>
</ul>
We have a strong team of Data Scientists, our work is highly sought-after, and our impact on the business is tremendous. If you have a proven background in this field and are excited to help build Airbnb’s community, we want to hear from you.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">With over 200 million users in 196 countries, Change.org is the world’s largest technology platform for social change. We’re a social impact business, and we’re aiming to build a world where no one is powerless and where creating change is a part of everyday life.
<br>
<br>
<b>About The Role: </b><br>
We’re seeking an experienced Data Scientist, focused on funnel optimization, who will own the vision and execution of projects from start to finish.
<br>
<br>
The ideal candidate is passionate about having an enormous impact on a company that is quite literally helping to change the world. Change.org uses data science to increase the reach and effectiveness of our social justice platform via sophisticated recommendation algorithms.
<br>
<br>
This individual will be flexible and interested in learning new skills, tools, and technologies as necessary. Given our small team size and the scope of our global mission, we must select the right tools as necessary. At any given point in time, you may find team members working with one or more of the following: Redshift, Cassandra, AWS (Elastic MapReduce, SimpleWorkflow, EC2, etc), Spark and Redis driven by Ruby, Python, Java, and Javascript. <br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Here’s what you’ll do as part of our team:
</h3><ul><ul><li>You will help set technical/product direction of our data science team.
</li><li>Use machine learning techniques to present relevant content to our diverse user base in order to increase engagement and raise the impact of our social justice platform.
</li><li>Take the lead on data science research projects and pursue them through production.
</li><li>Apply statistics, modeling, and ML to improve the performance of financial models and recommendation algorithms, as well as other areas where you see fit. .
</li><li>Work with product managers and engineers to design and debug A/B experiments.
</li><li>Own the architecture, delivery, and evolution of interrelated big data systems.
</li><li>Contribute to back-end distributed systems engineering in implementation/integration/monitoring/maintaining our applied data science/machine learning infrastructure. </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Here are the skills & experience we hope you have:
</h3><ul><ul><li>Masters in Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, Statistics or a quantitative field with a strong engineering background.
</li><li>Experience with Python and SQL is required.
</li><li>A combined 6+ years of industry experience in the data science arena dealing with large volume and variety of datasets.
</li><li>4+ years professional experience with modeling and analysis, statistics, machine learning, and/or large-scale data mining. Has deep experience in the data science methodology from exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, model selection, deployment of the model at scale and model evaluation by using AB testing in production
</li><li>Experience with multiple supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques, such as logistic regression, naïve bayes, decision trees, k-means clustering, and principal components analysis. Specific experience with natural language processing techniques is highly desirable.
</li><li>Specific experience in solving machine learning problems that have very sparse data.
</li><li>Work with other data and engineering professionals—as well as additional stakeholders across the company—to respond to business problems with practical solutions.
</li><li>Choose the most effective technologies and approaches for a variety of big data and data science challenges, and own application thereof. </li></ul></ul>The is a full-time opportunity based in San Francisco.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><div><div>Research Scientist Machine Learning, Deep Reinforcement Learning 18WD27034 Americas-United States of America-California-San Francisco</div><div>
<p>Research Scientist for Machine Learning in Building Construction</p>
<p>
Location: San Francisco, CA- United States</p>
<p>
Job ID: 18WD27043</p>
<p><b>
Position Overview</b></p>
<p>
The Design Research team works within in the Office of the CTO and is focused on discovering new, innovative experiences for designers. We design, test, and iteratively refine new user experience concepts by deeply understanding our users&rsquo; unique needs and behaviors. Our team helps customers to re-imagine the future of building design and construction by designing and deploying virtual construction agents.</p>
<p>
The Design Research team is seeking a research scientist passionate about building the next generation of Autodesk products for architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry. Using construction planning, scheduling, and execution data, our researcher will design a &lsquo;virtual agent' that can help designers with encoding construction knowledge into their design, engineers with producing constructible engineering designs, and contractors with planning and executing construction projects.</p>
<p><b>
Responsibilities</b></p>
<ul>
<li>Develop the next generation of Autodesk applications for AEC industry using novel deep RL algorithms</li>
<li>Perform applied research in related areas including machine learning, deep learning, NLP, data-driven simulation, and optimization</li>
<li>Collaborate with a team of user experience designers, engineers, research scientists, and interns</li>
<li>Contribute to writing research papers</li></ul>
<p><br>
</p><p><b>Minimum Qualifications</b></p>
<ul>
<li>MS or PhD in computer science, computer engineering, or any other relevant disciplines with a background in machine learning and deep reinforcement learning</li>
<li>Hands-on experience on machine learning and deep reinforcement learning, specialized in data-driven machine learning, predictive models, and NLP</li>
<li>Proficient in Python and deep learning frameworks including Tensorflow, Pytorch, and Caffe</li>
<li>Experience in quick prototyping and scientific research methods</li>
<li>Strong math and programming skills</li></ul>
<p><br>
</p><p><b>Preferred Qualifications</b></p>
<ul>
<li>Knowledge of architectural design</li>
<li>Knowledge of civil/structural engineering</li>
<li>Knowledge of construction management</li>
<li>Knowledge of existing AEC workflows</li></ul>
<p><br>
</p><p><b>About Autodesk</b></p>
<p>
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.</p>
</div><div>
Engineering</div><div><p>
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world.</p></div></div></span><br><div id="p_f97f5a394faf6167">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Description:
<p>San Francisco - CA, SF211MN, 211 Main St, 94105-1905<br>
Lance Alan Britton<br>
20180110-249<br>
</p><p><b>
We believe that</b>, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. <b>We are driven</b> by our purpose to champion every client&rsquo;s goals with passion and integrity. <b>We respect</b> and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. <b>We challenge</b> conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of &lsquo;own your tomorrow&rsquo; every day. <b>We champion</b> our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. <b>We hire</b> optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.</p>
<p>
As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future.</p>
<p><b>
Our Opportunity:</b></p>
<p>
The Analytics &amp; Business Insight (ABI) organization supports multiple business units across Schwab through quantitative-based decision support. Our mission is to help Schwab better understand the needs and behaviors of our prospects and clients through statistical analysis, predictive modeling, market research, and business intelligence.</p>
<p>
The data science team within ABI leverages machine learning and artificial intelligence to provide the organization with advanced quantitative analyses and insights that help guide development of new product/service offerings, better target prospects and clients through informed marketing efforts, increase acquisition of desired prospects, understand the ROI of advertising and marketing promotions, measure and assess the impact of business strategies, and identify strategies to grow client engagement, retention, and loyalty. Our services are in heavy demand as our team is a critical component in Schwab's commitment to being a leading data-driven organization.</p>
<p>
 <b>What you&rsquo;ll do:</b></p>
<p>
The Senior Data Scientist will partner with business teams across a variety of areas and applications. He/she will work with business partners to understand business objectives and scope data science projects that deliver insights and results. He/she will work hands-on with large disparate datasets and analyze them leveraging state-of-the-art techniques and tools. He/ she will also work in a cross-functional manner with other consultants, analysts, statisticians, data engineers, and external vendors to deliver insights and solutions based on machine learning, statistical and econometric analyses.</p>
<p>
Displaying strong business acumen and communication skills, the Senior Data Scientist will communicate analytical results to business partner in various settings to help drive results. Our business partners place great emphasis on our ability to translate statistical and mathematical results in a way that tells a clear story and guides them in actionable decisions.</p>
<p>
Responsibilities include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Scope data science projects including identifying resources and assets needed, determining analysis approach, conducting analysis, and developing execution plans.</li>
<li>Work independently or collaboratively throughout the complete data science project lifecycle including data extraction/preparation, design and implementation of scalable machine learning analysis and solutions, and documentation of results.</li>
<li>Refine, improve and take ownership of existing machine learning models, systems and implementations; Refine and improve data science workflow and processes</li>
<li>Partner with technical and non-technical resources across the business to leverage their support and integrate our efforts.</li>
<li>Partner with infrastructure and platform teams to configure, tune tools, automate tasks and guide the evolution of internal big data ecosystem; serve as a bridge between data scientists and infrastructure/platform teams</li>
<li>Pro-actively analyze data to uncover insights that increase business value and impact.</li>
<li>Support various business partners on a wide range of analytics projects from ad-hoc requests to large-scale cross-functional engagements.</li>
<li>Approach analytical problems with an appropriate blend of statistical/mathematical rigor with practical business intuition.</li>
<li>Hold a point-of-view on the strengths and limitations of statistical models and analyses in various business contexts and demonstrate ability to evaluate and effectively communicate the uncertainty in the results.</li>
<li>Approach analyses in multiple ways in order to evaluate approaches and compare results.</li>
<li>Bring a creative approach to quantitative analysis and problem solving and demonstrate an ability to comfortably think outside traditional methodologies (such as those from the academic literature, for example).</li>
</ul><p><b>What you have:</b></p>
<ul>
<li>B.S. degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or similar quantitative field</li>
<li>Graduate degree in a quantitative field highly preferred</li>
<li>5+ years of industry experience as a data scientist or machine learning engineer</li>
<li>Experience in financial services would be a plus but not necessarily a requirement</li>
<li>Strong understanding of how analytics supports a large organization including being able to successfully articulate the linkage between business objectives, analytical approaches &amp; findings and business decisions</li>
<li>Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated ability to solve problems</li>
<li>Mastery of Python plus SQL programming/data processing experience; knowledge or ability to learn Scala, R as necessary</li>
<li>Strong experience with Apache Spark and related ecosystem</li>
<li>Ability to work with large transactional databases across multiple platforms (Teradata, Oracle, HDFS, SAS)</li>
<li>Experience in visualizations and visualization frameworks such as d3 would be a plus</li>
<li>Good oral and written communication</li>
<li>Strong interpersonal skills to successfully build long-term relationships with colleagues and business partners</li>
<li>A results-driven individual with a passion for data/analytics who can work collaboratively with others to solve business problems that drive business growth</li>
</ul><p><b>What you&rsquo;ll get:</b></p>
<ul>
<li>Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits package</li>
<li>Financial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discounts</li>
<li>Work/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts Program</li>
<li>Everyday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness Champions</li>
<li>Inclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnerships</li>
<li>Not just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life</li></ul><p>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>About Us:</b><br>
GE is the world's Digital Industrial Company, transforming industry with software-defined machines and solutions that are connected, responsive and predictive. Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, GE delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.<br>
GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.<br>
<br>
<b>Role Summary:</b><br>
We are looking for an expert Data Scientist to join our world-class team. We are seeking individuals with strong backgrounds in statistics, machine learning and computer science who have demonstrated success in building data-driven applications. On our team, you will be in charge of building ML applications to solve targeted problems in industrial and healthcare use cases.<br>
<br>
<b>Essential Responsibilities:</b><br>
<p>You will be given the freedom to dive deeply into a variety of technologies and explore cutting edge<br>
ML approaches. You will have the full power of our proprietary, patented machine learning<br>
technologies at your disposal as well as the support of our talented Data Science Team, which<br>
consists of several PhDs and ex-professors from top-tier universities.<br>
</p><p>
In short, by joining our team you&rsquo;ll be immersed in a start-up culture that is backed by the<br>
resources of a Fortune 15 company with access to some of the most valuable and compelling data<br>
in existence. You&rsquo;ll work with some of the top minds in statistics and ML to build and deploy high value<br>
applications on top of that data.</p>
<br>

field</li></ul><p><b>

investigation and drug screen<br>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Research Scientists at Google work closely with Software Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with researchers at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new learning algorithms, Research Scientists work on challenges in machine perception, data mining, machine learning, and natural language understanding. As a Google Research Scientist, you will continue to be an active contributor to the wider research community by collaborating with academic researchers and by publishing papers.
<br>
<br>
Researchers on the Google Brain team have the freedom to set their research agenda and to engage as much or as little as they wish with existing products, choosing between doing more basic, methodological research or more applied research as necessary to produce the most compelling results. Because many of the advances we develop today may take years to become useful, the team as a whole maintains a portfolio of projects across this spectrum. It is our philosophy that making substantive progress on hard applications can help drive and sharpen the research questions we study, and in turn scientific breakthroughs can spawn entirely new applications.
<br>
<br>
The Google Brain team’s research focuses on methods that can learn multiple layers of rich, non-linear feature extractors and can scale to large amounts of data. Much of our work is best understood as part of the deep learning subfield of machine learning, but we are interested in any methods capable of efficient and effective feature learning that get good results on challenging problems. We have resources and access to projects impossible to find elsewhere. Our broad and fundamental research goals allow us to collaborate closely with and–contribute uniquely to–many different product teams across the company.
<br>
<br>

</h2><ul><li>Participate in cutting edge research in machine intelligence and machine learning applications.
</li><li>Develop solutions for real world, large scale problems.
</li></ul><br>

About Lumiata
<br><br>
Lumiata is a venture-backed company based in San Mateo, California inventing predictive analytics for healthcare leveraging the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our flagship Data-as-a-Service (DaaS) product, the Lumiata Matrix Suite, is an enterprise-grade, individual-to-population predictive analytics solution powered by AI. It enables the hyper-segmentation of vast amounts of patient data to predict which patient cohorts may be at highest risk for disease progression. Action-ready insights are returned to enterprise healthcare data analysts to enable more effective early-intervention strategies that lead to improved revenues, better patient outcomes, and lower overall costs of healthcare delivery.</span><br><div id="p_05ae58aeb102fbaa">

<br><br>
We are looking for a Data Analyst to turn data into information, then information into insight and
<br>observations, with the goal for our business unit to review the pattern of these observations and use
<br>this information when making business decisions. The candidates need to be very curious , who
<br>enjoy diving deep into the material to find observations into a yet unknown question. They need to
<br>have a natural desire to go beneath the surface of a problem. They need to be thinkers who can ask
<br>the right (business) questions. We’ll ask this data analyst to collect and study data to reveal ways to
<br>improve our business, or databases. The data would involve almost surveys, marketing, sales,
<br>research or resources databases. This position involves problem-solving, mathematics, computer
<br>skills and studying sets of both unstructured and structured data.
<br><br>
We will supply the data analyst with data sets, a scenario or problem, and the analyst must regularly
<br>pour through data and make observations. The analyst will analyze information from various sources
<br>that might help us better understand our situation and then study the information to uncover patterns
<br>and outliers. They must be able to identify and interpret patterns and trends, assess data quality and
<br>eliminate irrelevant data.
<br><br>
The data analyst communicates the results of their analysis as a comprehensive report to company
<br>decision makers. He/She designs the report and includes tools that can help those involved easily
<br>digest the data, such as statistics, graphs, images and lists. He/She wouild distribute the report via a
<br>face-to- face meeting presentation to SME.
<br><br>
The data analyst could provide database design services (nice to have, not need to have). They also
<br>collect data using a variety of methods, such as data mining and hardcopy or electronic
<br>documentation, to improve or expand databases. Additionally, the data analyst should be able to
<br>make recommendations about the methods used to collect, analyze and manage data to improve
<br>data quality and the efficiency of our systems.
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports</li>
<li>Implement strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality</li>
<li>Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems</li>
<li>Identify, analyze, and observe trends or patterns in structured and unstructured data sets</li>
<li>Filter, “clean” and “normalize” data</li>
<li>Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs</li>
<li>Locate and define new opportunities for process improvement</li>

<b>ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</b><br>
The Business Intelligence / Data Analyst will be responsible for performing complex financial and operational analysis to support the Supply Chain Organization in meeting strategic business objectives. This position will report to the Director of Strategic Sourcing within the Supply Chain Organization.
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Identify cost reduction opportunities primarily focused on product cost but also other areas of the company.</li>
<li>Build and maintain a cost database for all products.</li>
<li>Establish should-cost models and provide recommended cost positions to support supplier negotiations.</li>
<li>Track and evaluate cost reduction goals and metrics.</li>
<li>Develop capital investment models and perform ROI analysis.</li>
<li>Develop cost review presentations and present to Supply Chain team members and Executive Management.</li>
<li>Participate in cost reviews with management, internal teams, and supplier representatives.</li>
<li>During NPI phase, the Business Intelligence / Data Analyst will work with Engineering and Marketing teams to model cost feature/trade-offs and estimate fully loaded COGS.</li>
<li>General strategic planning support for the Supply Chain Organization.</li>
</ul>

</ul>
Vapor, JUUL, Work Culture, Fast Paced, Start-up, Growth, Vape, Technology, Software, Hardware, Consumer Electronics, Manufacturing, Design, Product, Disruptive, Revolutionary, Cutting Edge, App, Android, eCommerce, B2C, San Francisco, Bay Area, IoT, San Jose, Los Angeles

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">About Hive
</b><br>
<br>
Hive is a deep learning company solving visual intelligence problems through 3 main pillars of the business: Hive Data, Hive Predict, and Hive Enterprise. Hive Data is the world’s largest two-sided marketplace for machine learning data labeling. We have over 100,000 distributed workers helping research labs and enterprise clients generate high quality truth data sets in fields like autonomous driving and robotics. Hive Predict is our set of proprietary visual intelligence models that solve problems like the identification of celebrities and logos. We sell these APIs to companies looking to incorporate our models into their own workflows. Hive Enterprise is our own product platform where we sell stand-alone solutions that change the way companies view visual data in their sector. Our flagship product is Hive Media, through which we are selling the world’s largest television analytics dataset.
<br>
<br>
We are funded by leading investors like Peter Thiel (Founders Fund), General Catalyst, and Formation8. We have ~100 people globally, based in our San Francisco and Delhi offices.
<br>
<br>
<b>Machine Learning Role
</b><br>
<br>
In order to execute our vision, we need to grow our team of best-in-class machine learning engineers. We are looking for developers who are excited about staying at the forefront of deep learning technology, prototyping state-of-the-art neural net models and launching these models into production. We value hard workers who have no qualms working with terabyte-scale datasets, who are interested in learning new technologies at all levels of the machine learning stack, and who move fast and take ownership of their projects. Our ideal candidate has experience creating a working machine learning-powered project from the ground up, contributes innovative ideas and ingenious implementations to the team, and is capable of planning out scalable, maintainable data pipelines. <br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Responsibilities
</h3><ul><ul><li>Everything involved in applying a ML model to a production use case, including, designing and coding up the neural network, gathering and refining data, training and tuning the model, deploying it at scale with high throughput and uptime, and analyzing the results in the wild in order to continuously update and improve accuracy and speed
</li><li>Interface closely with the Backend and DevOps teams as well as with our internal data labeling services </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Requirements
</h3><ul><ul><li>You have an undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science or similar technical field, with significant coursework in mathematics or statistics
</li><li>You have 1-2 years industry machine learning experience
</li><li>You have successfully trained and deployed a deep learning machine model (image, NLP, video, or audio) into production, with measurably improved performance over baseline, either in industry or as a personal project
</li><li>You have strong experience with a high-level machine learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, Caffe, or Torch, and familiarity with the others
</li><li>You know the ins and outs of Python, especially as it applies to the above ML frameworks
</li><li>You are capable of quickly coding and prototyping data pipelines involving any combination of Python, Node, bash, and linux command-line tools, especially when applied to large datasets consisting of millions of files
</li><li>You have a working knowledge of the following technologies, or are not afraid of picking it up on the fly: C++, Scala/Spark, R, Matlab, SQL, Cassandra, Docker
</li><li>You are up-to-date on the latest deep neural net research and architectures, both in understanding the theory and motivations behind the techniques, as well as how to implement them in the ML framework of your choice
</li><li>You are comfortable with running and interpreting common statistical tests, and also with common data science techniques including dimensionality reduction and supervised and unsupervised learning
</li><li>You have great communication skills and ability to work with others
</li><li>You are a strong team player, with a do-whatever-it-takes attitude </li></ul></ul><b>What We Offer You
</b><br>
<br>
We are a group of individuals who are young and hungry to make a mark on the world and build a machine learning company for the long run. You will be based in San Francisco and we offer all the standard benefits available to top startup companies. At Hive, you will have a significant career development opportunity and an opportunity to learn directly from our founder / CEO.
<br>
<br>
Thank you for your interest in joining Hive.</span><br><div id="p_ab5efceafc4b21f1">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>Description:</b><br>
<p><b>PROGRAM DESCRIPTION</b></p>
<p>The mission of the Data Science and Information Technology Program (DSITP) is to leverage leading-edge data science and information technology skills and capabilities to provide the best tools and services to accelerate translation of biomedical data to scientific discoveries, medical treatments, and diagnostic and prevention tools for cancer and AIDS patients.
</p><p>The DSITP Strategic and Data Science Initiatives Group has a focus to establish new collaborations in computing and data science to address cancer challenges and accelerate cancer research. The group&rsquo;s efforts include developing the capacity within the NCI intramural research community to increasingly employ high-performance computing, as well as establishing a longer-term direction and path forward for broader NCI, academic, government, and private industry participation in predictive oncology.</p>
<p>The Accelerating Therapeutics for Opportunities in Medicine (ATOM) Consortium is a public-private partnership with the mission of transforming drug discovery by accelerating the development of more effective therapies for patients. ATOM founding members are GSK, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Frederick National Laboratory, and the University of California, San Francisco. The ATOM consortium members will develop, test, and validate a multidisciplinary approach to drug discovery in which modern science, technology and engineering, supercomputing simulations, data science, and artificial intelligence are highly integrated into a single drug-discovery platform that can ultimately be shared with the drug development community at large.
</p><p>Frederick National Laboratory is hiring a Senior Drug Discovery Data Scientist to work in computationally-driven cancer drug discovery as part of the ATOM Consortium.</p><p>
This position is based in San Francisco, California.</p><p><br>
</p>
<p><b>KEY ROLES/RESPONSIBILITIES</b></p>
<ul><li>Provide technical and strategic input to develop, implement and maintain a data and model lake to support the ATOM consortium</li><li>
Acquire, augment, analyze and act on complex, high-dimensional data sets using high performance computing and advanced algorithms</li><li>
Computational models R&amp;D: includes building predictive computational models to accelerate cancer drug discovery and assessing the predictivity and uncertainty of computational models used by the ATOM consortium</li><li>
Be able to work independently as part of a multi-disciplinary team to support the ATOM Consortium scientific and technical goals</li><li>
Create and maintain strong professional relationships with all ATOM stakeholders</li><li>
Foster and nurture collaborative work environment</li></ul><br>
<b>
Qualifications:</b><br>
<p><b>BASIC QUALIFICATIONS</b></p>
<p><b>To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:</b></p>
<ul><li>Possession of a Master&rsquo;s degree in a related discipline from an accredited college or university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation. (Additional qualifying experience may be substituted for the required education). Foreign degrees must be evaluated for U.S. equivalency</li><li>
In addition to the education requirements, a minimum of eight (8) years of progressively responsible job-related experience including three (3) years of experience in a leadership capacity.</li><li>
Familiarity with large datasets, handling of biomedical datasets and understanding of data analysis workflows is required.</li><li>
Proficiency with one or more programming language such as Java, Perl, Python, R with data analysis packages or modules is required.</li><li>
Must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance.</li></ul>
<p><b>PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS</b></p>
<p><b>Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:
</b></p><ul><li>Ph.D. in a relevant discipline</li><li>
A strong background in any one or more of the following: cancer biology, pharmaceutical or medicinal chemistry, pharmacology, toxicology, drug discovery, computational biology, in silico biology, bioinformatics, biostatistics, computational science, systems biology, molecular dynamics, multiscale modeling, machine learning, adaptive learning or high-performance computing.</li></ul>
<p><b>Expected Competencies:
</b></p><ul><li>Analytical approach to defining scientific questions/design of scientifically testable hypotheses</li><li>

Leidos is a global science and technology solutions leader working to solve the world&rsquo;s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company&rsquo;s 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported pro forma annual revenues of approximately $10 billion for the fiscal year ended January 1, 2016 after giving effect to the recently completed combination of Leidos with Lockheed Martin's Information Systems &amp; Global Solutions business (IS&amp;GS). <span id="job_summary" class="summary">About Haven
<br><br>
Haven is the SaaS-based technology company that thoughtfully advances global trade.
<br><br>
Global trade has grown beyond human scale. Increasingly complex routes and higher stakes demand more efficient systems. Haven believes open collaboration and access to information are key to enabling faster, smarter, and more reliable freight shipping. That’s why we build powerful technologies to foster improved communication between companies, decrease trade roadblocks, and mitigate the inherent risks in global trade. Haven is built for companies that ship large volumes of cargo in need of a powerful, easy-to-use tool that allows them to negotiate, ship, and track across thousands of providers and destinations through a single unified platform.
<br><br>
Machine Learning Engineer
<br><br>
We are looking for a machine learning expert to work in a fast-paced startup environment, building scalable features to help transform global trade and remake the industry that moves 90% of all physical goods in the world. If you’re a machine learning engineer with strong fundamentals in machine learning algorithms (i.e. neural networks, dimensionality reduction, feature utilization and extraction, and clustering), programming (i.e. Python, MATLAB, and C++), statistics, and mathematics, you might have what it takes to drive the next great technological shift.
<br><br>
About You
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Entrepreneurial leader with strong track record with applied machine learning in the technology sector</li>
<li>Passionate about technology and enjoys hacking/prototyping on the side</li>
<li>Analytical, inquisitive, adaptable, think beyond the normal shaped box</li>
<li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li>
</ul>
Requirements
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>BS/MS/Ph.D. Computer Science with 5+ years relevant work experience</li>
<li>Experience with machine learning, deep learning, data mining, and/or statistical analysis tools.</li>
<li>Ability to build and evaluate predictive models</li>
<li>Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, high-performance computing</li>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Element Analytics creates industrial analytics software that empowers organizations to achieve new levels of operational performance. The Element Platform makes industrial time-series data easy to use and helps engineers, data scientists, and technologists rapidly turn data into actionable reliability, productivity, and sustainability insights.
<br><br>
You’re a self-starter who thrives on solving hard problems. More importantly, you want to build technology that matters. As part of our team, you’ll turn code into real-world impact, where purpose-built technology can prevent dangerous mechanical failures, for example. You’ll be responsible for driving the machine learning aspects of the platform. This differs from other machine learning problems in that your outputs will become part of the product and will be production-grade, repeatable systems-based solutions rather than bespoke for a specific problem.
<br><br>
Visa sponsorship is available for qualified candidates.
<br><br>
---------------
<br><br>
<b>What You'll Do:</b><br>
---------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Develop a production-grade learning system powering on-demand analytics for our web application, including:</li>
<li>Classifiers that detect patterns/anomalies in time-series data so end users can assign them labels</li>
<li>Grammar inference systems to learn structure in semi-structured data</li>
<li>Building feedback-based learning systems that can assist humans in extracting signal from large data sets</li>
<li>Work with data scientists, product managers, and application developers to support the architecture of new product features</li>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>What we&rsquo;re looking for</b></p>
<p>
A naturally inquisitive and detail-oriented Junior Research Analyst to assist in the design, management and execution of research projects for the firm&rsquo;s legal and professional services clients, business development efforts and strategic initiatives. Ideal candidates for this entry-level role will have strong project management, communication and time management skills as well as qualitative research experience. Experience with quantitative analysis, media measurement and analytics tools is all a plus but not required.</p>
<p><b>
What you&rsquo;d do</b></p>
<ul>
<li>Conduct comprehensive research on and analysis of companies, industries, markets, competitors, journalists and key executives and deliver objective, meaningful insights in concise, compelling ways.</li>
<li>Assist with report creation, including analysis, data entry, and chart/table creation in Excel/PPT.</li>
<li>Maintain operational research platforms and engage with client teams on ongoing media priorities and strategy.</li>
<li>Monitor media outlets for awards, features, topics, trends and developments that impact the company&rsquo;s clients and/or potential clients.</li>
<li>Assist in the preparation of presentations, proposals and marketing materials and ensure their relevance, quality and accuracy.</li>
<li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge of our tools, platforms and research methodologies.</li>
