You'll get to work on what you like (we practice open allocation) and one of our explicit goals as a team is to build a uniquely fun and growth-oriented culture. Our team of hackers and thinkers is small, lean, and empathetic.

<br>---------------------
<br><br>

<br>------------

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientist Technical Leads work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.
<br>
<br>
With your leadership and professional expertise, you manage a team of analysts, plan project goals and lead the overall strategy for your group. You are a recognized authority in your functional area and develop, organize and launch projects that span engineering and analysis.
<br>
<br>
As a Data Scientist Technical Lead for YouTube or Search, the scope of your role will impact the entire Product.
<br>
<br>
For the YouTube Creators platform, the role will be focused on defining and understanding the core metrics (top-level and granular) that drive the supply-side of our business. YouTube viewers have nothing to watch and advertisers have no audiences to market to without the content that our “creators” produce. Creators range from you/me making silly videos to share with our friends - often referred to as casual to professional content (music videos, etc.), and of course in between is our homegrown stars and musicians.
<br>
<br>
You have previous analytical work to understand the varying types of our creators and the inequality dynamics of viewership (we are a “hits” driven platform, just like any media company). We have the basics down, but we need a great leader and communicator to talk to senior leadership across the organization about this, especially given the nuance. This is where you come in!
<br>
<br>
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
<br>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Responsibilities
</h2><ul><li>Work with large, complex YouTube data sets; solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed. Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables and presentations.
</li><li>Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive understanding of Google data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for both products development and sales activity.
</li><li>Directly manage a data science team. Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams; work closely with engineers to identify opportunities for, design, and assess improvements to google products.
</li><li>Make business recommendations (e.g. cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
</li><li>Research and develop analysis, forecasting and optimization methods to improve the quality of Google's user facing products; example application areas include ads quality, search quality, end-user behavioral modeling, and live experiments.
</li></ul><br>

</li><li>5 years of people management / leadership experience
</li><li>Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python, MATLAB, pandas) and database languages (e.g., SQL).
</li></ul><br>
Preferred qualifications:
<ul><li>PhD degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, operations research, bioinformatics, economics, computational biology, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering).
</li><li>12 years of directly relevant, tech industry work experience (e.g., as a statistician / bioinformatician / data scientist), including deep expertise and experience with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, sampling methods. <span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>System1 Biosciences is a well-funded stealth mode startup revolutionizing drug discovery for brain disorders. Founded by professors from Columbia University and UCSF along with experienced Silicon Valley technology entrepreneurs, we combine novel biotechnology, neuroscience, robotic engineering, and machine learning techniques. Join us as we try and revolutionize the treatment of previously hard to treat conditions like autism and schizophrenia.</p><p>We’re building a world-class high-throughput bioscience data-processing platform that includes static image processing, video analysis, multi-modal data integration, feature extraction, Bayesian modeling, sequence modeling, and deep learning (using both feed forward and recurrent architectures) for classification and regression. Our current tech is a custom Python pipeline built on top of existing image and video processing and machine learning tools.</p><p>This role is as a core member of our machine learning team. You’ll participate in team-wide projects as well as lead the design and delivery of independent initiatives.</p><p>Our ideal candidate will have:</p><ul><li>5+ years experience in machine learning</li><li>PhD in a quantitative field such as physics, computer science, or theoretical neuroscience</li><li>Highly skilled MS with demonstrated machine learning expertise also encouraged to apply</li><li>Python fluency</li><li>Facility with TensorFlow/Keras, Pytorch</li><li>Deep learning experience; MLP and CNN expertise required; RNN/LSTM familiarity preferred</li><li>Demonstrated strength in both supervised and unsupervised learning</li><li>Bayesian modeling background preferred</li><li>Experience working in biotech image processing or gene expression data ideal</li><li>Best object-oriented programming practices</li><li>Familiarity with AWS preferred</li><li>Experience in a fast-paced startup environment and the ability to deal well with ambiguity and act with autonomy</li><li>Initiative, curiosity, a bias for action, and a problem-solving attitude</li><li>A deep desire to learn</li><li>High personal standards of reliability and a track record of driving projects to completion</li></ul><p>In this position you will:</p><ul><li>Design and implement data preprocessing, integration, and analysis solutions</li><li>Mentor and cross-train with other ML scientists via academic-style discussions and reviews</li><li>Interface with biology team in the understanding and interpreting of data</li><li>Interface with software engineering team in the deployment of production analysis tools</li><li>Work full-time hours in our San Francisco office</li></ul><p>We offer competitive salaries and benefits, and opportunities for professional growth, in an intellectually stimulating and fast-paced environment.</p><p>If this excites you, then we are excited to hear from you! Please contact us and include your CV or résumé.</p><p>System1 Biosciences is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.</p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Required experience:</p><ul><li>machine learning: 5 years</li></ul><p>Required education:</p><ul><li>Doctorate</li></ul><p>Job Location:</p><ul><li>San Francisco, CA</li></ul></span><br><div id="p_9f6c6e3408fd987c">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>About iRhythm:</b><br>
iRhythm is a leading digital healthcare company focused on the way cardiac arrhythmias are clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable biosensing technology with powerful cloud-based data analytics and machine- learning capabilities. Our goal is to be the leading provider of first-line ambulatory ECG monitoring for patients at risk for arrhythmias. iRhythm’s continuous ambulatory monitoring has already put over 1 million patients and their doctors on a shorter path to what they both need – answers.
<br><br>
<b>About this role:</b><br>
We are looking for a senior statistician to join the iRhythm Data Science team in our San Francisco, CA location, to aid insight discovery from an expansive big data set of cardiac information captured from wearable medical sensors. This research position provides a unique opportunity to work with clinicians, clinical researchers, and peer data scientists and engineers to enhance/expand insights into patient cardiac health.
<br><br>
<b>Responsibilities include:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Work with clinicians, clinical researchers, and peer data scientists to investigate/explore large data sets of cardiac information to develop new insights into patient cardiac health.</li>
<li>Participate in prospective/retrospective clinical studies including study development, execution, and publication.</li>
<li>Participate in R&D initiative feasibility assessment through the execution of analyses of large, diverse, and complex data sets.</li>
<li>Recommend test designs, sampling requirements and data collection strategies to help with predictive modeling as well as hypothesis testing.</li>
<li>Present research findings to internal stakeholders, iRhythm leadership, as well as at industry conferences.</li>
<li>Work closely with our software engineering team and clinical experts to implement solutions into production.</li>
</ul>
<b>About you:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>MS with 3+ years of experience or PhD in a quantitative field with expert understanding of statistical/machine learning and predictive analysis.</li>
<li>Strong programming experience using statistical software packages based on Python or R.</li>
<li>Excellent knowledge of database languages (such as SQL).</li>
<li>Previous experience with experimental study (preferably clinical) planning, design, execution, and publication.</li>
<li>Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.</li>
</ul>
<b>Additional Desired/Preferred Qualifications include:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Experience applying learnings from statistical analyses to product development</li>
<li>Familiarity with software development cycle including code standards, reviews, and unit testing</li>
<li>Familiarity with a regulated industry and standards compliance</li>
<li>Familiarity with cloud computing and big data technologies</li>
<li>Experience working with raw signals</li>
</ul>
<b>What’s in it for you:</b><br>
This is a full-time position with competitive salary package and excellent benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, paid holidays and paid time off.
<br><br>
iRhythm also provides additional benefits including 401K (w/ company match), annual organizational and cultural committee events and more!
<br><br>

About Tipping Point Community
<br><br>
Tipping Point fights poverty in the Bay Area. We screen non-profits rigorously to identify and invest in the most
<br><br>
effective education, employment, housing, and early-childhood organizations. Once in our portfolio, Tipping Point
<br><br>
grantees have access to unrestricted funds and risk capital, and receive assistance in critical areas like
<br><br>
communications, strategy, legal services, and technology. In addition, Tipping Point looks for opportunities to
<br><br>
partner with the public sector to leverage its impact for the common good. Since 2005, Tipping Point has raised
<br><br>
more than $150 million and helped put 23,000 people on the path out of poverty in the last year alone. Our Board
<br><br>
covers 100% of our operating costs, so every dollar donated goes where it’s needed most.
<br><br>
Our Values
<br><br>
Tipping Point’s core values are at the heart of everything we do and we look for individuals who share our
<br><br>
<b>commitments:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>We are one community. We believe that the responsibility for fighting poverty belongs to all of us.</li>
<li>We serve. Our approach is humble and respectful. We exist to meet the needs of others.</li>
<li>We celebrate generosity. Every gift counts, whether big or small.</li>
<li>We get results. We are relentless in the pursuit of our goals. We hold ourselves and each other</li>
</ul>
accountable.
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>We are always learning. We are risk takers. We commit to facing our challenges as we support solutions</li>
</ul>
that last.
<br><br>
To learn more and subscribe to our newsletter, please visit our website at www.tippingpoint.org.
<br><br>
Impact + Learning Team Overview
<br><br>
Tipping Point’s Impact + Learning (I+L) Team applies a data-driven approach as we oversee all efforts to measure,
<br><br>
analyze, report, and improve our impact and that of our grantees. We help our colleagues and stakeholders at
<br><br>
Tipping Point understand the extent of poverty and develop solutions for reducing it. We communicate technical
<br><br>
concepts and findings to a range of audiences in compelling and easily digestible manners.
<br><br>
Position Overview
<br><br>

<br><br>
Learning, (Education).

<br><br>
affecting poverty. The ideal candidate may also be well versed in educational programs and policies from pre-
<br><br>
kindergarten to post-secondary, and is passionate about leveraging investments in education to change the landscape
<br><br>
of poverty and philanthropic giving in the Bay Area. The role will work closely with Tipping Point’s Education
<br><br>
Program Officers to assess grantee performance and measure progress against Tipping Point’s education portfolio
<br><br>
strategy. This is a newly created position and will report to the Senior Director of Impact + Learning.
<br><br>
<b>Major areas of work include:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Capacity building: Work with Tipping Point’s education grantees to develop or enhance monitoring and</li>
</ul>
evaluation systems, ultimately to build data-driven cultures
<br><br>

</ul>
order to improve programs, services, and public policies
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Research + project management: Oversee projects – small and large – to help better understand the extent</li>
</ul>
to which education-related interventions lead to gains in educational achievement and success
<br><br>

<br><br>
increase our collective impact

</ul>
performance and track Tipping Point’s progress against our portfolio strategy

</ul>
key metrics, leverage findings in order to improve service delivery

<br><br>

</ul>
address issued raised by stakeholders, such as Program Officers or Board members
<br><br>

</ul>
related to poverty alleviation, grade-level proficiency, college graduation, etc.
<br><br>

</ul>
Explore innovative ideas to alleviate poverty
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Research and better understand programs that may reduce poverty or increase educational achievement</li>
<li>Work with Tipping Point colleagues as well as academic, government, and corporate partners to carry out</li>
</ul>
research that addresses the extent to which these interventions lead to poverty reduction

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.
<br><br>
Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to decision-makers in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.
<br><br>
Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data and machine learning-powered analytics to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest challenges.
<br><br>
As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.
<br><br>
We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we are iterating in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth.
<br><br>
Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.
<br><br>
Our powerful cloud-based platform passes daily imagery from Planet's satellites through a fully-automated processing pipeline. The platform allows our customers to download, search, manipulate, and extract information from a dataset with global coverage. With more daily geospatial imagery data than ever in history (the platform processes upwards of 5 terabytes of imagery per day), Planet’s Engineering team is now dedicating significant effort in the development of core platform capabilities towards delivering analytics and insights from geospatial data.
<br><br>
Imagery Analytics is a high impact team building foundational and customer facing geospatial analytics capabilities. To achieve this we’re working on software that utilizes the latest techniques in data science, computer vision and machine learning (including deep learning). We’re looking for talented engineers that have applied product experience to join our growing team.
<br><br>
<b>The Role:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Experienced Machine Learning Engineer developing predictive analytic products using multimodal geospatial data</li>
<li>Deploying new analytics models in production and evaluating their scalability</li>
<li>Collaborate closely with peers on other engineering teams and interface frequently with product and sales teams</li>
</ul>
<b>The Must Haves:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Strong background in Machine Learning</li>
<li>Strong Python software development skills</li>
<li>Good foundations software architecture and object oriented design</li>
<li>Experience with implementing machine learning models and deploying them in scalable production environments</li>
<li>BA/BS in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience</li>
</ul>
<b>The Nice to Haves:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>5+ years experience building software</li>
<li>Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: C/C++, Objective C, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, SQL or Go</li>
<li>Experience with multiple more general purpose deep learning frameworks including but not limited to Tensorflow, Theano, Keras, Caffe, Torch, etc</li>
<li>MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or related technical field</li>
</ul>
<b>Some press about us:</b><br>
Our CEO, Will Marshall's Dreamforce Talk ( https://www.salesforce.com/video/183624/ )
<br><br>

"The All-Seeing Eye in the Sky video" ( https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2017-06-28/the-all-seeing-eye-in-the-sky-video ) Bloomberg Businessweek video
<br><br>
"Q&A with Amy Truong, Planet's Director of Software Engineering" ( https://www.planet.com/pulse/ghc17/ ) —Planet Blog
<br><br>
<b>Join Us:</b><br>
Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth. If you are feeling inspired, check out our website www.planet.com/careers ( http://www.planet.com/careers ) and apply. Be sure to include a cover letter to let us know why you think you’d be a good fit and feel free to mention anyone you have previously worked with at Planet.
<br><br>
We are committed to building a diverse team and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.</span><br><div id="p_787ae96e31d43b38">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>Powerful Brands Powerful Platforms One VF
</b></p><p>VF Corporation outfits consumers around the world with its diverse portfolio of iconic lifestyle brands, including Vans&reg;, The North Face&reg; , Timberland&reg;, Wrangler&reg; and Lee&reg; . Founded in 1899, VF is one of the world&rsquo;s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies with socially and environmentally responsible operations spanning numerous geographies, product categories and distribution channels. VF is committed to delivering innovative products.
</p><p><b>We will grow by building leading lifestyle brands that excite consumers around the world
</b></p><p>Our One VF culture is perpetually driven &mdash; focused on constant innovation. Using deep research and insights, we combine the art and science of apparel to create products that excite consumers and inspire brand loyalty.
</p><p>We responsibly manage the industry&rsquo;s most efficient and complex demand chain- merchandise, assortments planning areas, which spans multiple geographies, product categories and distribution channels.
</p><p>Our goal is to continuously exceed the expectations of our consumers, shareholders and business partners. We help our retail partners win with consistently solid execution and outstanding service. And we continually find ways to improve our performance and generate bottom line results.
</p><p>Our associates are the engine of our success. They share a deep commitment to diversity &mdash; in people and ideas. We conduct business with the highest levels of honesty, integrity and respect for others, and we foster a positive work environment based on creativity, collaboration and congeniality.
</p><p>These are the things that make us a leader. These are the things that make us VF.
</p><p><b>The North Face </b>: <b>Data Scientist, Retail Analytics </b><b>: Become the Newest Member of the VF Family
</b></p><p>As the Data Scientist, Retail Analytics at The North Face you and your efforts will provide exceptional leadership in the development and execution of retail analytics to support decision-making across various functions of demand chain- merchandise, assortments planning areas. You are an expert in complex modeling, analytical methodology and have a rich history in excelling in: longitudinal analyses, multi-level modeling, multivariate analyses of variance, hierarchical demand forecasting and more. You will partner with key executives to address information needs and will analyze and synthesize analytics and insights to influence decisions and action planning. This role and your efforts are a key resource needed for business success. Which means, you are a key partner to demand forecasting, assortment optimization, and various other areas to help drive our businesses. Your output and hard work will directly influence our bottom line and data driven decisions.
</p><p>You have an inherent passion for data and data driven thinking, and can effortlessly extract patterns from volumes of data to drive strategy and operational efficiencies. You can also take that data and tell an easy to understand brand story with actionable items for others.
</p><p><b>How You Will Make a Difference:
</b></p><p>Support Development of Advanced Analytics practice to develop best in class demand chain- merchandise, assortments planning areas analytics practice for The North Face and drive analytic culture within the brand. Internal Consulting: Perform ongoing analytic projects in support of brand strategies and tactics. Topics will include, but not limited to long term demand forecast, short term replenishment, smart allocation to avoid excess inventory and lost sale opportunities, ROI analysis. Support BI Reporting: In collaboration with wholesale and DTC leadership, support the development of BI dashboarding to highlight KPI across locations and channels. Work will include multi-source data integration and development in BI tool (Cognos, Tableau). Support Process Improvement: Bring industry best practices to analytic processes to create time efficiencies, so team can broaden efforts to other focus areas. Data Infrastructure: In collaboration with infrastructure in IT teams, make recommendations for data architecture Strategy. Tool Assessment: Develop and deploy analytical tools and data science techniques to analyze complex data sets enabling useful forecast solution. Monitor trends in data science and alternative sources to ensure that The North Face is in tune with best in class tools and techniques.
</p><p><b>Skills for Success:
</b></p><p>Years of Related Professional Experience: 7+ years
</p><p>Educational/ Position Requirements:
</p><ul><li>BA/BS in a quantitative field (statistics, operations research, mathematics, computer science, economics, analytics) is required; master&rsquo;s degree in a similar quantitative field from an accredited university is highly desirable.
</li><li>Experience working in the retail/consumer goods/apparel industry a plus.
</li><li>Experience with statistical and predictive modeling in open-source software, such as, R or Python and at least basic familiarity with SAS&reg;, Matlab&reg;, or Stata&reg;
</li><li>Expertise in statistical modeling and analytical methodology including, regression, classification, clustering, variety of predictive modeling, time-series analysis, demand forecasting using SAS forecast server or similar tools to enable hierarchical forecast at Region/store/product level and automation/reporting/visualization.
</li><li>Passion for working with numbers and large datasets.
</li><li>Strong understanding of retail and apparel best practices and trends.
</li><li>Ability to influence and work through others to effectively navigate matrixed organization while ensuring that necessary stakeholders are informed.
</li><li>Strong communication skills that can influence team and senior leaders to act in a desired manner through written and verbal communication. Ability to simplify highly complex analyses and output into terms that are easily accessible and impactful in both written and verbal formats.
</li><li>High level of analytical and negotiating skills as evidence by high intelligence, strong financial and analytical capabilities and the proven ability to develop, sell and drive suitable partnerships, alliances, or other transactions to closure.
</li><li>Demonstrates a sense of calmness under periods of uncertainty or change while dealing with stress in a manner that sets the necessary tone for the team and function.
</li><li>High character and integrity, is consistent and acts in line with a clear and visible set of values and beliefs.
</li><li>Global outlook with sensitivity and awareness of social and cultural differences.
</li></ul><p><b>Special Physical and/or Mental Requirements:
</b></p><ul><li>Travel by air and overnight, as required 10% amount of time.
</li><li>Lifting and/or bending 5 pounds amount of weight.</li></ul></span><br><div id="p_81214333870d00f5">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>Powerful Brands Powerful Platforms One VF
</b></p><p>VF Corporation outfits consumers around the world with its diverse portfolio of iconic lifestyle brands, including Vans&reg;, The North Face&reg; , Timberland&reg;, Wrangler&reg; and Lee&reg; . Founded in 1899, VF is one of the world&rsquo;s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies with socially and environmentally responsible operations spanning numerous geographies, product categories and distribution channels. VF is committed to delivering innovative products.
</p><p><b>We will grow by building leading lifestyle brands that excite consumers around the world

</p><p>We responsibly manage the industry&rsquo;s most efficient and complex demand chain- merchandise, assortments planning areas, which spans multiple geographies, product categories and distribution channels.
</p><p>Our goal is to continuously exceed the expectations of our consumers, shareholders and business partners. We help our retail partners win with consistently solid execution and outstanding service. And we continually find ways to improve our performance and generate bottom line results.

</p><p><b>The North Face </b>: <b>Data Scientist, Retail Analytics </b><b>: Become the Newest Member of the VF Family
</b></p><p>As the Data Scientist, Retail Analytics at The North Face you and your efforts will provide exceptional leadership in the development and execution of retail analytics to support decision-making across various functions of demand chain- merchandise, assortments planning areas. You are an expert in complex modeling, analytical methodology and have a rich history in excelling in: longitudinal analyses, multi-level modeling, multivariate analyses of variance, hierarchical demand forecasting and more. You will partner with key executives to address information needs and will analyze and synthesize analytics and insights to influence decisions and action planning. This role and your efforts are a key resource needed for business success. Which means, you are a key partner to demand forecasting, assortment optimization, and various other areas to help drive our businesses. Your output and hard work will directly influence our bottom line and data driven decisions.
</p><p>You have an inherent passion for data and data driven thinking, and can effortlessly extract patterns from volumes of data to drive strategy and operational efficiencies. You can also take that data and tell an easy to understand brand story with actionable items for others.
</p><p><b>How You Will Make a Difference:
</b></p><p>Support Development of Advanced Analytics practice to develop best in class demand chain- merchandise, assortments planning areas analytics practice for The North Face and drive analytic culture within the brand. Internal Consulting: Perform ongoing analytic projects in support of brand strategies and tactics. Topics will include, but not limited to long term demand forecast, short term replenishment, smart allocation to avoid excess inventory and lost sale opportunities, ROI analysis. Support BI Reporting: In collaboration with wholesale and DTC leadership, support the development of BI dashboarding to highlight KPI across locations and channels. Work will include multi-source data integration and development in BI tool (Cognos, Tableau). Support Process Improvement: Bring industry best practices to analytic processes to create time efficiencies, so team can broaden efforts to other focus areas. Data Infrastructure: In collaboration with infrastructure in IT teams, make recommendations for data architecture Strategy. Tool Assessment: Develop and deploy analytical tools and data science techniques to analyze complex data sets enabling useful forecast solution. Monitor trends in data science and alternative sources to ensure that The North Face is in tune with best in class tools and techniques.

</b></p><p>Years of Related Professional Experience: 7+ years

</li><li>Experience working in the retail/consumer goods/apparel industry a plus.
</li><li>Experience with statistical and predictive modeling in open-source software, such as, R or Python and at least basic familiarity with SAS&reg;, Matlab&reg;, or Stata&reg;
</li><li>Expertise in statistical modeling and analytical methodology including, regression, classification, clustering, variety of predictive modeling, time-series analysis, demand forecasting using SAS forecast server or similar tools to enable hierarchical forecast at Region/store/product level and automation/reporting/visualization.
</li><li>Passion for working with numbers and large datasets.

</li><li>Ability to influence and work through others to effectively navigate matrixed organization while ensuring that necessary stakeholders are informed.
</li><li>Strong communication skills that can influence team and senior leaders to act in a desired manner through written and verbal communication. Ability to simplify highly complex analyses and output into terms that are easily accessible and impactful in both written and verbal formats.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Does working with real data and having impact on the small businesses that are backbone of US economy excite you? What about the opportunity to learn from Senior Data Scientists with domain expertise? With the Chase Acquisition, WePay’s payments systems will start supporting expanded use cases. To help with these exciting technical challenges, we are looking for Data Scientists to join our team.
<br><br>
As a Data Scientist, you will support the expanded use cases and help minimize the Risk/Fraud losses. You will be able to Increase WePay’s coverage of Machine Learning models, increase the iteration speed and reduce the time it takes to deliver a new model to the business. You will have the ability to work on groundbreaking technologies like Gradient Boosted Trees, Deep Learning, Tensorflow etc.
<br><br>
You would be joining the Data Science team early as it is ramping up helping to craft the processes and practices for future team members. This is your chance to work on a wide variety of verticals in the small business space. With WePay, you will have a tangible and meaningful impact on business outcomes as well as the opportunity to learn and experiment with various research ideas.
<br><br>
WHAT YOU WILL DO
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Build machine learning systems and models for detecting payment fraud, merchant fraud, and merchant risk</li>
<li>Design and Implement Knowledge graph capturing information from various 3rd party/partner data sources and relationships therein</li>
<li>Drive the complete lifecycle from data extraction, model development through model deployment and production evaluation/maintenance</li>
<li>Collaborate closely with engineering and risk detection/product teams</li>
</ul>
WHAT IMPACT WILL YOU HAVE?
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Improve our fraud/risk detection capabilities</li>
<li>Drag down losses and save hundreds of thousands of dollars for the company</li>
<li>Cut down review volume and reduce risk analysts’ workload</li>
</ul>
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>1+ years of practical experience in applied machine learning / model development</li>
<li>In-depth understanding of machine learning and modeling algorithms such as decision trees, random forest, neural networks, SVM, etc.</li>
<li>Technical expertise in data preprocessing, feature extraction, model building, and statistical analysis</li>
<li>Proficiency in databases (SQL), and programming languages (at least one of following: Python, R, Ruby, Java, etc)</li>
<li>M.S. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical field (computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics, statistics, etc.)</li>
<li>Collaborative, team player who drives to resolve customer needs</li>
<li>Outstanding track record of innovation and success</li>
</ul>
BONUS IF YOU HAVE
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Text Mining and NLP</li>
<li>Deep Learning (CNNs, RNNs and sequence modeling)</li>
<li>Graphical Models</li>
</ul>
WHAT IS EXPECTED IN THE INTERVIEW?
<br><br>
We want to see your problem-solving and analytical skills. Be prepared to write good, clean, scalable code. Ability to understand the context of the business problems we are trying to solve and craft machine learning based solutions. Demonstrate proven understanding of Machine Learning/Data Science fundamentals and modeling practices. Our hiring processes might include:
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Online Code Challenge</li>
<li>Recruiter Screen</li>
<li>Phone Interview with Data Scientist</li>
<li>Take Home Data Science Challenge</li>
<li>On-Site Interview</li>
</ul>
WHO IS WEPAY
<br><br>
WePay is the payments partner to the platform economy. It has uniquely enabled Constant Contact, GoFundMe, Meetup, and more than 1,000 other B2B and B2C platforms to provide integrated payments processing without compromising on their user experience or taking on risk and regulatory exposure.
<br><br>
WePay is a two-time honoree on the Inc. 500 fastest growing private companies list before its December 2017 acquisition by JPMorgan Chase & Co., and has earned recognition on San Francisco and Silicon Valley “Best Places to Work” lists for an open, supportive culture that focuses on delighting customers and employees and offers all the usual perks (free lunch daily, subsidized gym membership, Responsible Time Off, etc.).
<br><br>
You can find more information at wepay.com ( http://wepay.com/ ).
<br><br>
To all recruitment agencies WePay does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, WePay employees or any other company location. WePay is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.</span><br><div id="p_eebd53ce8ce24361">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">We are looking for a data scientist who is passionate about building interpretable machine learning models all the way from research to production. You will play an instrumental role in helping our customers understand their market better, give them more precise recommendations for their business, and build out our market intelligence to know where we should focus. With your help, Wheelhouse will continue to grow as the number one pricing platform in the hospitality industry.
<br><br>
---------------------------
<br><br>
<b>What you’ll be doing:</b><br>
---------------------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Deploy reproducibly testable, production-ready code</li>
<li>Write novel algorithms from scratch, but know how to use the right tools when they already exist</li>
<li>Full ownership of projects that have an immediate impact on real-world results</li>
<li>Effectively present and communicate findings to all types of audiences</li>
<li>Collaborate closely with other data scientists, engineers, and product teams</li>
<li>Exposure to the full stack: from DevOps to frontend integrations, using open source and internal tools in a cloud environment</li>
</ul>
-------------------------------------
<br><br>
<b>We’re looking for someone with:</b><br>
-------------------------------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>5+ years of Engineering & Data Science experience</li>
<li>MS or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or another relevant domain (preferred)</li>
<li>Knowledge in machine learning: building regression, classification, and recommender systems</li>
<li>Familiarity with large datasets in distributed systems</li>
<li>Proven track record on taking experimental findings and turning them into code</li>
<li>Some technologies we use are Spark, R, Ruby, Python, Redshift, and Postgres</li>
<li>Experience in any of these areas are a plus!</li>
</ul>
--------------------------
<br>Your first 90 Days…
<br>--------------------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Have a full understanding of our data architecture and recommendation engine</li>
<li>Independently build new features in collaboration with our product team</li>
<li>Advance & test novel solutions for improving our existing products</li>
<li>Own building the analytic and reporting features for the next generation of Wheelhouse</li>
</ul>

<b>About Us:</b><br>
---------
<br><br>
Lyric is building the next great hospitality company.
<br><br>
We design & manage premium short-term rentals, that combine the spaciousness of an apartment, the amenities of a 4-star hotel, the productivity of your favorite work space, and the creative inspiration of an artistic studio.
<br><br>
Powering everything we do is a proprietary software & data platform designed to inform every aspect of our operations - from location selection to inventory design, revenue management to personalized guest experiences.
<br><br>
The global accommodations industry is worth more than $1T/year, but it hasn’t kept up with the needs of today’s modern traveler. Lyric is changing that.
<br><br>
We set out to re-imagine what this future will look like, and we'd love to have you along as part of that journey!
<br><br>

<br>--------
<br><br>
We are a fast growing team founded by veteran entrepreneurs and backed by a number of the largest and most respected VC’s in the world. Headquartered in downtown San Francisco, we're hiring top talent across all business units!</span><br><div id="p_429c9744145085ee">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Why work at Doximity?
<br><br>
Doximity is rewiring healthcare and is the 6th fastest growing technology company in North America. ( http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/doximity-is-fastest-growing-company-in-bay-area-per-deloittes-2016-technology-fast-500-300367390.html ) Here's how clinicians use our products ( https://res.cloudinary.com/dhttas9u5/image/upload/WhyDocsUseDox-Infographic_20160930_adpvj6.pdf ). For us, transparency is key, so ensuring your goals and values align with ours is also an important step. Take a look at how we Work at Doximity. ( https://workat.doximity.com/ )
<br><br>
Skills & Requirements
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>4+ years of industry experience and M.S./Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or other relevant technical field.</li>
<li>4+ years experience with various machine learning methods (classification, clustering, natural language processing, ensemble methods, deep learning) and parameters that affect their performance.</li>
<li>Expert knowledge of probability and statistics (e.g., experimental design, optimization, predictive modeling).</li>
<li>Experience with recommendation algorithms and strong knowledge of machine learning concepts.</li>
<li>Solid engineering skills to build scalable solutions and help automate data processing challenges.</li>
<li>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to connect data science work to product impacts.</li>
<li>Fluent in SQL and Python; experience using Apache Spark (pyspark) and working with both relational and non-relational databases.</li>
<li>Familiarity with AWS, Redshift.</li>
</ul>
What you can expect
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Employ scalable statistical methods and NLP methods to develop machine learning models at scale, owning them from inception to business impact.</li>
<li>Leverage knowledge of recommendation algorithms to increase user engagement through personalization of delivered content.</li>
<li>Plan, engineer and measure outcomes of online experiments to help guide product development.</li>
<li>Collaborate with a team of product managers, analysts, data engineers, data scientists, and other developers.</li>
<li>Think creatively and outside of the box. The ability to implement and test your ideas quickly is crucial.</li>
</ul>
Technical Stack
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>We historically favor Python and MySQL, but leverage other tools when appropriate for the job at hand.</li>
<li>Machine learning (linear/logistic regression, ensemble-models, boosted-models, clustering, NLP, text categorization, user modeling, collaborative filtering, etc) via industry-standard packages (sklearn, nltk, Spark ML/MLlib, GraphX/GraphFrames, NetworkX, gensim).</li>
<li>A dedicated cluster is maintained to run Apache Spark for computationally intensive tasks.</li>
<li>Storage solutions: Percona, Redshift, S3, HDFS, Hive, neo4j.</li>
<li>Computational resources: EC2, Spark.</li>
<li>Workflow management: Airflow.</li>
</ul>
Fun facts about the Data Science team
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>We have one of the richest healthcare datasets in the world.</li>
<li>We build code that addresses user needs, solves business problems, and streamlines internal processes.</li>
<li>The members of our team bring a diverse set of technical and cultural backgrounds.</li>
<li>Business decisions at Doximity are driven by our data, analyses, and insights.</li>
<li>Hundreds of thousands of healthcare professionals will utilize the products you build.</li>
<li>A couple times a year we run a co-op where you can pick a few people you'd like to work with and drive a specific company goal.</li>
<li>We like to have fun - company outings, team lunches, and happy hours!</li>
</ul>
HQ Benefits & Perks
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Comprehensive benefits including: medical, vision, dental, Life/ADD, 401k, flex spending accounts, and commuter benefits</li>
<li>Pre-IPO stock incentives</li>
<li>Work from home Wednesdays</li>
<li>3+ weeks of PTO</li>
<li>12 company holidays, including company shutdown last week of December</li>
<li>Fully ergonomic setup (chairs and stand-up desks)</li>
<li>Free lunch, snacks and beverages</li>
<li>Rooftop game room and deck with a beautiful view of SF skyline</li>
<li>Team trips to fun places like Lake Tahoe, Sonoma, Seattle, and Park City</li>
<li>Sabbatical after 5 years</li>
</ul>
Remote Benefits & Perks
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Comprehensive benefits including: medical, vision, dental, Life/ADD, 401k, and flex spending accounts</li>
<li>Pre-IPO stock incentives</li>
<li>3+ weeks of PTO</li>
<li>12 company holidays, including company shutdown last week of December</li>
<li>Team trips to fun places like Lake Tahoe, Sonoma, Seattle, and Park City</li>
<li>Sabbatical after 5 years</li>
</ul>
About Doximity
<br><br>
Doximity is the leading social network for healthcare professionals with over 70% of U.S. doctors as members. We have strong revenues, real market traction, and we’re putting a dent in the inefficiencies of our $2.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system. After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time. Launched by Jeff Tangney in 2011; Jeff previously founded healthcare pioneer Epocrates (NASDAQ: EPOC). Our beautiful offices are located in SoMa San Francisco.
<br><br>
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.</span><br><div id="p_90b8e5f69be513d1">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Terabytes of data: high resolution photos, 120+ million text documents in more than a dozen languages, real-time location data, semantic business information collected from users and business owners, and more… If this gets your heart racing, you just might be a good fit for our data mining teams at Yelp!
<br>
<br>
We’re a passionate and diverse group of engineers who can work across disciplines to provide incredible insights to our users. We are responsible for the whole stack: scoping the problem by digging through data in Redshift and Jupyter, crafting a solution using research and industry best practices, training a model using gradient boosted decision trees and deep learning, and finally scaling it to millions of users, businesses, and advertisers.
<br>
<br>
Develop a learning-to-rank model on Search? Design a creative new feature to keep web-scraping bots at bay? Model the complex interactions between an advertiser, their budget, user behavior, and business inventory? All in a day’s work for our data teams. Check out the details below.
<br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">What You Will Do:
</h3><ul><ul><li>Work with the team to come up with creative ideas for new products and model features, then carry those ideas all the way to launch.
</li><li>Explore data to measure the impact of your changes and develop ideas for how to improve key metrics.
</li><li>Work closely with infrastructure engineers to make sure that your algorithms will effectively scale to large data sets and to ensure that their systems provide the flexibility needed for your ideas. </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">We Are Looking For:
</h3><ul><ul><li>5+ years industry experience in machine learning, statistics, or related fields.
</li><li>A real passion for big data, and creative ideas for what to do with it.
</li><li>The algorithms and data structures experience to make your ideas workable.
</li><li>The coding experience to turn those ideas into reality. We use Java & Python. You don’t need to be an expert, but experience is a plus and we will expect you to learn them on the job.
</li><li>A background in Machine Learning or Information Retrieval.
</li><li>Minimum BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Math, or related degree.
</li><li>If you don't have at least one year of experience in a similar role, please take a look at our College Engineering roles instead! </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Pluses:
</h3><ul><ul><li>Experience working with scikit-learn, ElasticSearch, Spark, Hadoop, or mrjob.
</li><li>Experience applying Auction theory, CTR prediction, Graph theory, Natural language processing, Recommender systems, Spam detection, Stochastic optimization. </li></ul></ul>Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
<br>
<br>
*LI-MS1</span><br><div id="p_da3f61b01f825d15">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work to be performed and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of this position.
</em><br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>About SASB & The SASB Foundation
</b></h3><br>
<br>
SASB is changing the way investors, corporations and the public think about ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) sustainability factors. Our mission focuses on setting sustainability accounting standards for public companies to bring social and environmental capital to the attention of mainstream capital markets and enhancing our outreach to key stakeholders such as the investors, companies and the SEC.
<br>
<br>
The SASB Foundation is responsible for the funding and oversight of the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB). The mission of The SASB Foundation is to support the work of SASB and provide the market with education and resources that advance the use of SASB standards and the field of sustainability accounting. The SASB Foundation is an independent 501(c)3 non-profit.
<br>
<br>
We are a dynamic, fast-growing organization that has released sustainability accounting standards that have been downloaded over 70,000 times, garnered over 11,500 media mentions, and raised over $30 million. We develop products, resources and education programs to support the adoption and use of sustainability accounting standards, and are funded by a mix of earned income and grants. We have a talented staff and executive team, and our high-profile board is led by former NYC mayor Michael Bloomberg and includes former chairs of the SEC and FASB.
<br>
<br>
Are you a good fit for this role and is it a good fit for you? Make your case in your cover letter. Generic pitches never make it to the top of the pile.
<br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Job Summary
</b></h3><br>
<br>
SASB Research Analysts are liaisons between the SASB and issuers, investors, and other stakeholders associated with their sector. Research Analysts leverage these contacts, their own sector experience and relationships with their Sector Advisory Group and the Standards Board to identify and evaluate emerging sustainability topics to be an expert on the intersection of sustainability issues and financial drivers.
<br>
<br>
<b>REPORTS TO: </b>Deputy Director of Research
<br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Areas of Responsibility
</b></h3><br>
<br>
SASB’s work is fast-paced and while the primary areas of responsibility are as follows, we value adaptability and a collaborative mindset.
<br>
<br>
<em>Research & Analysis
</em><br>
<ul><li>Research Materiality: Ensure that evidence of materiality underlying each sustainability topic in the standards is sufficient to warrant a standard for disclosure, that evidence is updated to reflect evolution or emergence of sustainability topics, and that evidence is documented.
</li><li>Research Decision-usefulness and Cost-effectiveness of Metrics: Work closely with the Deputy Director of Research to ensure that accounting metrics and technical protocols in the standards remain up to date. reflect innovation in measurement best practices, are decision-useful and cost-effective, and adhere to the requirements listed in the Conceptual Framework.
</li><li>Develop Metrics : Work with the Technical Director and outside organizations including NGOs, industry associations, government agencies and universities to source metrics which effectively communicate performance on the topics included in the SASB Standards.
</li><li>Analytics: Complete illustrative analysis of integration of SASB standards in traditional financial analysis, including the maintenance of SASB data tables as well as the development of fundamental (DCF) and comparative (ratio) analysis. Develop expert knowledge of financial value drivers, performance data on SASB standards, and run analytics on the interaction between sustainability and financial performance.
</li></ul><br>
<em>Standards-Setting
</em><br>
<ul><li>Codify, Update and Interpret the Standards: Work closely with the Deputy Director of Research to ensure that due process is followed for proposed changes to the SASB standards during the codification or update process, in accordance with the SASB Rules of Procedure.
</li><li>State of Disclosure : Understand the disclosures of major industry players, identify leaders and laggards, and review what companies are talking about in their regulatory filings. Maintain knowledge of the current state of disclosure in each industry in the sector for each topic and metric.
</li><li>Cross-cutting : Participate in, or lead, a cross-cutting team for an issue which substantially overlaps with your sector coverage. Work with the Technical Director to identify and develop industry-specific metrics, leveraging credible third-party organizations when possible. Participate in, or lead, the development and update of cross-cutting white papers and other publications.
</li><li>Community of Practice: Work collaboratively with the Research Team to develop and share best practices within the Team and across the organization on industry-specific aspects of stakeholder consultation, research and codification. Proactively engage with other SASB departments and groups in order to maximize collaboration in the interest of developing high quality and widely accepted standards.
</li></ul><br>
<em>Consultation & Adoption
</em><br>
<ul><li>Stakeholder Development: Develop strong relationships with key SASB stakeholders (corporate issuers, investors and SMEs) during research, consultation, public comment and ratification. Consider and document actionable stakeholder recommendations. Interact with key stakeholders during individual and group meetings, webinars, and other direct consultations.
</li><li>SASB Spokesperson : Represent and evangelize SASB as a speaker, panelist or participant, for industries under coverage, at financial, industry, academic, NGO, regulatory and other events in the US and internationally. Seek to engage with key high-level stakeholders (C-suite, Executive Directors…) when possible. Communicate SASB’s value proposition in a clear, compelling manner to diverse audiences.
</li><li>Produce high-quality and compelling written content : Write standards updates, blog posts, articles, presentations, white papers and other content in a technically proficient, efficient, compelling style with consistent high quality.
</li><li>Surface standards : Identify, develop, and prepare compelling narratives about SASB standards for use in publications and presentations.
</li></ul><br>
<em>Standards Board
</em><br>
<ul><li>Standards Board : Leverage sectoral expertise to equip the Standards Board with the resources needed to provide effective, efficient stewardship of the SASB Standards. Respond to requests for information or action on a timely basis, follow-up with effective plans to address Board requests and completes requested tasks in a timely manner / by agreed-upon deadlines.
</li></ul><br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Qualifications
</b></h3><br>
<br>
Research Analysts are high-energy, agile-minded, strategic, proactive, direct communicators, highly-organized and committed to the vision and values of SASB. In addition, Research Analysts have (minimum):
<br>
<ul><li>5+ years of experience as a financial research analyst, preferably at a financial institution, and/or sector (industry) experience desired in operations, finance, or consulting.
</li><li>Experience in sustainability or environmental, social and governance (ESG) research
</li><li>Experience in a regulatory or standards organization a plus.
</li><li>Undergraduate degree (BA) required. Concentration in business, accounting, finance or economics preferred. Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Public Policy or Finance preferred. CFA or CPA desired and attainment of SASB FSA required within one year of hire.
</li><li>Superior research and analysis skills, including technical aptitude and understanding of basic engineering and accounting concepts; comprehension and synthesis of complex information.
</li><li>Experience with Bloomberg terminals, qualitative and quantitative financial research, DCF models and other valuation or portfolio management techniques.
</li><li>Consultative skills and ability to manage a broad array of relationships and contacts using Salesforce.
</li><li>Excellent writing, presentation, and speaking skills across a range of formats and audiences.
</li><li>Proven ability to manage competing priorities and deliver to strict deadlines.
</li><li>Demonstrated commitment to high professional, ethical standards and a diverse workplace.
</li><li>High energy, positive, “can-do” attitude, attention to detail and high degree of initiative.
</li><li>Collaborative work style; entrepreneurial; excels in a fast-paced, changing team-based environment.
</li></ul><br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Special ADA Requirements
</b></h3><br>
<br>
SASB is in full compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and does not discriminate applicants or employees with disabilities, and will make reasonable accommodation when necessary.
<br>
<ul><li>For the purposes of ADA, the “Essential Duties and Responsibilities” and “Qualifications” are essential job functions.
</li><li>Work is normally performed in a typical interior/office work environment, with typical office noise, equipment, and with staff tending to other business transactions.
</li><li>Both standing and sitting are required for extended periods of time, with majority of work of the job done sitting. Approximately three-quarters of the time performing job duties is spent using a computer keyboard.
</li><li>Various types of office equipment/supplies are used to accomplish the job requirements and include, but are not limited to phones, computers, pens, pencils, calculators, computer keyboards, telephone, printers, etc.
</li><li>Required to drive personal auto to other work sites for meetings, conferences, etc.
</li></ul><br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><div><div>Quantitative Analyst - Model Risk Management : AVP-10018865-WD</div><div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><div>
Description</div></h2>
<div>
Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. In the U.S., we&rsquo;re 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that&rsquo;s working to fulfill its vision to be the world&rsquo;s most trusted financial group.</div>
<div><b>Job Overview:
</b></div><div>The Model Risk Quantitative Analyst within the Americas Model Risk Management (AMRM) Unit is responsible for executing best-practice model validation activities consistent with the Bank&rsquo;s Model Governance Policy and ensuring business processes related to models are in compliance with applicable governance and policy requirements.
</div><div><b>Major Responsibilities:</b></div>
<ul><li>Independently validate Bank models which will include an assessment of model conceptual soundness, evaluation of data and assumptions, testing model computational accuracy, and performing outcomes analysis (such as back-testing and bench-marking).
</li><li>Document and present observations to managers of the Americas Model Risk Management and to model owners and users, recommend management action plans, and track remediation progress.</li>
<li>Monitor model performance reports on an on-going basis to ensure models remain valid. Support the creation and maintenance of the enterprise-wide model inventory, model control standards, and model risk ranking.
</li><li>The models include those used within the various Business Units for supporting financial reporting, risk management, decision-making, CCAR stress testing, and economic capital estimation.</li></ul>
</div><div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><div>
Qualifications</div></h2>
<ul>
<li>3+ years of experience within the financial services industry.</li>
<li>An advanced degree in finance, economics, statistics or related field (Master&rsquo;s or PhD preferred) and industry certifications a plus (e.g., CFA, FRM).</li>
<li>Proven track record of strong technical model development, model management, and/or model oversight in one or more of the following areas: CCAR stress testing, credit risk management (wholesale experience a plus), operational risk, and consumer lending.</li>
<li>Knowledgeable about model risk management and associated regulatory requirements such as FRB SR 11- 7/OCC 2000-16.</li>
<li>Strong project management capabilities.</li>
<li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li></ul>

Detailed Description and Job Requirements</b>
 Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse &ldquo;big data&rdquo; sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement.<br>
<br>
Interacts with product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers.<br>
<br>
Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 8 years relevant work experience. BS/BA preferred.<br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Job Description:
</b></h2><p>Job Description
<br>
Position Summary
<br>
<br>
The Director of Risk and Analytics is responsible for the ownership and oversight of all risk related aspects of the company&rsquo;s lease portfolio.
<br>
<br>
Responsible for the development and implementation of risk management strategies which control for acquisition risk, facilitate portfolio growth, and optimize for profitability or successful entry into new markets/channels. Monitor and redevelop credit risk models as appropriate.
<br>
<br>
Establish scalable fraud-prevention framework which allows for expansion into potentially high-risk markets, whether physical retail or e-commerce. Provide proactive analysis that lead to insights that directly improve portfolio and company&rsquo;s financial performance
<br>
<br>
Responsibilities/Duties
<br>
<br>
&middot; Development and implementation of risk score cards used to underwrite leases at the point of sale in a b-b-c environment
<br>
<br>
&middot; Develop, maintain and operate consumer fraud prevention and mitigation systems
<br>
<br>
&middot; Proactively identify trends in data and draw meaningful insights about the risk performance of the portfolio
<br>
<br>
&middot; Identify opportunities for optimizing acquisition flow through customer experience and/or risk reduction
<br>
<br>
&middot; Work with Business Development to develop and structure product offerings which meet the needs of both SmartPay and potential partners
<br>
<br>
&middot; Identify new sources of data that enhance existing capabilities, from acquisition to ongoing portfolio management and collections.
<br>
<br>
Education and Experience
<br>
<br>
BS in Mathematics, Engineering, Data Sciences or related field, and at least 5 years experience in the data sciences area and at least 3 years, management and strategic experience in this field
<br>

<br>

&middot; Strong analytical skills
<br>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>POSITION SUMMARY<br>
As a Senior DATA SCIENTIST within our Personalized HealthCare function you will work with meaningful data to generate impactful evidence and insights on our molecules/ medicines and patients, that support R&amp;D, advance scientific and medical knowledge, and enable personalized patient care and access.<br>
</p>
<p>You will collaborate with peers within the function and across the organization to develop evidence generation strategies, identify evidence gaps and data sources, design and execute studies, and implement analyses to address molecule and disease area questions. The data will be varied in type - patient-level clinical data, supplemented with deep patient data such as omics (e.g. genomics, proteomic), imaging, digital health, etc. Source data will be diverse - real-world data, including patient registries, electronic medical records, claims, biobanks, and clinical trials. The evidence and insights will be used to inform the research and development of our molecules, and support healthcare decisions by patients, physicians, health authorities, payers, and policy-makers. You will also contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives that shape our business and healthcare environments. This will require a good understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, healthcare environments, as well as strong scientific and technical data science expertise. You will need strong strategic, collaboration and communication skills, as well as an entrepreneurial mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to develop and deliver medicines for our patients.<br>
</p>
<p>As Senior Data Scientist you will typically be expected to contribute to the molecule/disease area for multiple or complex projects with minimal supervision. You will contribute to the development of new concepts, techniques, and standards. We will look to you as a positive role model for peers and you will coach colleagues to improve in their role with both technical and interpersonal skills.<br>
</p>
<p>RESPONSIBILITIES<br>
</p>
<ul><li>IDENTIFY EVIDENCE NEEDS &amp; RECOMMEND DATA SOLUTIONS: Ask the right scientific questions, understand the evidence needs for research and development, regulatory and market access, and ideate and make recommendations on fit-for-purpose data and analytics solutions.</li><li>
DEVELOP DATA STRATEGY &amp; GAIN ACCESS TO DATA: Develop strategic plans to access fit-for-purpose data sources to support evidence generation, and gain access to data through collaboration or data generation.</li><li>
DIVE INTO DATA: Develop a comprehensive and deep understanding of the data we work with and foster learning with colleagues using analytical tools and applications to broaden data accessibility and advance our proficiency/efficiency in understanding and using the data appropriately.</li><li>
BE AN EXPERT IN APPLYING METHODS: Stay current with and adopt emergent analytical methodologies, tools and applications to ensure fit-for-purpose and impactful approaches.</li><li>
PRODUCE HIGH QUALITY ANALYSES: Apply rigor in study design and analytical methods; plan for data processing; design a fit-for-purpose analysis plan, assess effective ways of presenting and delivering the results to maximize impact and interpretability; implement and/or oversee the study, including its reporting; ensure compliance with applicable pharma industry regulations and standards.</li><li>
INTERPRET AND SHARE RESULTS: Communicate findings to internal stakeholders, regulatory, health technology assessment (HTA) bodies and scientific communities; publish results; participate in external meetings and forums to present your insights (e.g. congress/conference).</li><li>
COLLABORATE &amp; SHAPE: Collaborate and contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external data science communities, networks, collaboratives, initiatives or goals on knowledge-sharing, methodologies, innovations, technolog</li></ul>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Who You Are</h2>
<p>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS<br>
</p>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>Under general supervision of the Institute for Computational Health Sciences (ICHS) Bioinformatics manager, the Bioinformatics Programmer I will be required to utilize the elasticity of the AWS Cloud for Big Data Intensive (e.g. Hadoop/Spark) compute infrastructure and parallel system environment. Assist in Creating pipelines and configurations on a Linux-based distributed file system for Very Large health data, premise-hosted as well as public cloud based. Such data will be clinical, phenotypic and population level data of several categories, structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. Non-structured data includes text, images, and &ldquo;messy&rdquo; alphanumeric data. Strong AWS and Linux system administration skills will be needed to build scalable general-purpose computational and inferential software tools to work with the data. The Bioinformatics Programmer will also evaluate third party tools, especially for Natural Language Processing (NLP), text mining and information retrieval, for adaptation into and use in our system, under guidance from the Bioinformatics manager. Further the candidate will work towards ensuring system compliance with the university&rsquo;s policies with respect to privacy and security.<br>
<br>
INSTITUTE FOR COMPUTATIONAL HEALTH SCIENCES<br>
The Institute for Computational Health Sciences (ICHS) is a critical component of a global UCSF initiative in Precision Medicine, which seeks to aggregate and integrate vast, disparate datasets to advance understanding of biological processes, determine mechanisms of disease, and inform diagnosis and treatment of patients. Beginning with a base of excellent computational faculty dispersed among our four top-ranked professional schools (Dentistry, Medicine, Nursing and Pharmacy) and Graduate Division, superb research programs and outstanding Medical Center, ICHS will establish a central convening center, hire additional faculty, and build programs for research and education. ICHS will develop and enhance UCSF&rsquo;s computational approaches and strategies in basic, translational, clinical and population-based biomedical research, working with partners in industry and academia where appropriate. It will be a campus hub for computer scientists and for researchers who employ computation as a primary tool in their biomedical research.<br>
<br>
ABOUT UCSF<br>
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.</p></span><br><div id="p_1079657d2c0abe07">

Job Description<br>
Data Engineer
</p><p>Position Summary:</p><p>
At eHealth, we are passionate about solving our nation's toughest problems to bring more suitable, accessible, and affordable health insurance to Americans. We are seeking a talented data engineer to join our new and growing data team, which is already making a valuable impact on the entire company. This person will help us develop cutting-edge data tools and pipelines to drive better and faster decision making within our company and to better serve our customers. This is a fast-paced, collaborative, and iterative environment requiring quick learning, agility, and flexibility.
</p><p>Responsibilities:</p><ul><li>
Become the subject matter expert on our data and its capabilities. Your scope of knowledge will need to include various data systems that are specialized to internal departments and 3rd party data platforms.</li><li>
Design and build highly scalable data integration / ETL pipelines to improve data accessibility and consumption.</li><li>
Automate data processing using workflows tools to schedule and manage dependency of various data pipelines.
</li><li>Work directly with data scientists to develop scalable implementation of statistical and machine learning models in production, and work with software engineers to design, build, and maintain JSON APIs to interact with those models.</li><li>
Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.</li><li>
Assist eHealth&rsquo;s data architect with logical and physical data model designs and documentation.
</li><li>Work with data infrastructure team to triage issues and support issue resolution.</li></ul><p>
Minimum Qualifications:</p><ul><li>
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.</li><li>
2+ years of experience with building scalable and reliable data pipelines using technologies like Spark, AWS EMR, Kafka, etc.
</li><li>3+ years of production coding experience with at least one general software development programming language (Java, Scala), one data programming language (Python, R), and scripting languages (Unix shell) as well as solid experience with git.</li><li>
Expertise with relational databases and experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling.</li><li>
Mastery of SQL (writing complex, high performance queries in Oracle or MySQL); experience with distributed querying (Redshift, Spark SQL, Hive) and NoSQL systems (MongoDB, etc).</li><li>
Working experience with various ETL technologies and frameworks (Pentaho, SnapLogic, etc.).
</li><li>Working experience with AWS cloud ecosystem.</li><li>
Excellent communication skills in written and verbal forms, and an ability to communicate complex issues to a range of audience (management, peers, clients).</li><li>
Strong attention to detail while excellent time management and prioritization in multitasking.</li><li>
Experience as a Scrum team player in a cross functional environment.</li><li>
Highly motivated problem-solver who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment and can also be patient with the pace of highly regulated industries like healthcare.</li></ul><p>
Nice to Have:</p><ul><li>
Working experience with implementing scalable models using various statistics and machine learning toolkits (Pandas, SciPy, Scikit-learn, MLlib, Spark ML, etc.).</li><li>
Strong experience in designing and implementing data APIs.</li><li>
Product familiarity with Adobe Analytics, Cisco systems, Qlikview, or Wherescape.</li><li>
Familiarity with workflow management tools (Airflow).</li><li>
Working experience with data warehousing.</li><li>

Experience working with call center operations.</li></ul><p>
The Company</p><p>
An industry innovator over the past decade, eHealth, Inc. is a technology company that is transforming the way health insurance is bought and sold in the United States.</p><p>
Today, eHealthInsurance.com has enrolled over 5 million people in health insurance coverage and is the leading online marketplace for individually and family health insurance products in the nation. Licensed to market and sell health insurance in all 50 states and the District of Columbia, eHealthInsurance was responsible for the nation's first Internet-based sale of a health insurance policy, and we have partnerships with more than 180 health insurance companies, and offer more than 10,000 health insurance products online. Every day we provide thousands of visitors with information about a broad array of health insurance-related topics and plans, including a selection of price and benefit options, complemented by a full-service Customer Care Center of highly trained customer service representatives.</p><p>
eHealth is a publicly-traded company (Nasdaq:EHTH) with headquarters in Mountain View, CA, but this position will be based in San Francisco. Our San Francisco office is directly across from AT&amp;T ballpark.</p><p>
