<span id="job_summary" class="summary">An Equal Opportunity Employer Committed to a Diverse Workforce
<br><br>
<b>Department:</b> Community Investment Team
<br><br>
<b>Reports to:</b> Director Data and Evaluation
<br><br>
<b>Classification:</b> Union Support
<br><br>
<b>Closing Date:</b> Open until filled
<br><br>
<b>Overview:</b><br>
The United Way Bay Area (UWBA) is leading a network of corporations, government agencies, nonprofits, and individuals to create lasting change for Bay Area residents and families. With a history that spans over 90 years and programs that tackle the issue of local poverty from every angle, UWBA is uniquely positioned to mobilize and motivate all sectors of the community toward the vision of ending the cycle of poverty.
<br><br>
As UWBA responds to cultural shifts in the workplace, fundraising, and digital communications, it is guided by core values of innovation and results-driven creativity. Through a variety of existing and emerging initiatives, UWBA seeks to both strengthen and reimagine its work at all levels in order provide more and better opportunities for struggling Bay Area residents.
<br><br>
For more information about UWBA, please visit http://uwba.org .
<br><br>
<b>The Opportunity:</b><br>
The Research Analyst is an excellent opportunity to contribute to meaningful and lasting change for youth, adults, and families in the Bay Area. We are seeking an individual with strong research and analytical skills who is excellent at presenting findings and recommendations in way that is easy for audiences to understand. Knowledge of the local nonprofit and educational landscape and exceptional analytical skills is a plus. As a member of UWBA’s Equity team, this individual will support research and evaluation for UWBA’s youth workforce programming, SparkPoint Initiative, Two-Generation programming, and adult workforce and higher education programming.
<br><br>
Successful candidates will have a background in data, research, and evaluation, as well as experience in both qualitative and quantitative analysis. Successful candidates will also be skilled at writing and presenting reports.
<br><br>
This is a full-time, 37.5 hour per week support union position.
<br><br>
<b>What you’ll do:</b><br>
Research
<br><br>
Conduct research on current poverty trends, research, and evaluations of new, proven and tested program models
<br><br>
Review recent research/articles on successful poverty strategies and share learnings with team
<br><br>
Conduct and summarize latest research on economic, workforce, youth workforce, education, and other poverty-reduction best/current practices, services, and programs (i.e. latest research on credit scores, career pathways, community schools)
<br><br>
Conduct research on the nonprofit and philanthropic fields (i.e. performance-based funding models, grant making strategies)
<br><br>
Attend forums and events that discuss latest research on poverty
<br><br>
Represent UWBA in coalitions and partnerships with community-based organizations, businesses, labor leaders, and elected and appointed officials
<br><br>
Content Development
<br><br>
Create briefs and write ups on local and national poverty trends/research to share with the team, organization, and UWBA leadership team.
<br><br>
Develop compelling content for needs and challenges in the Bay Area to share with potential funders
<br><br>
Work cross-functionally with other departments to share and refine findings with external audiences
<br><br>
Write reports sharing evaluation findings
<br><br>
Program Evaluation & Analysis
<br><br>
Conduct analyses on program data
<br><br>
Conduct qualitative analysis and evaluation including interviews, focus groups, coding, and visualizing results
<br><br>
Conduct quantitative analysis and visualization including a strong background in excel. Use of other reporting tools and statistical methods preferred (Tableau, Einstein Analytics, Salesforce reporting, STATA, R)
<br><br>
Support internal evaluation including analyzing current data sets, and providing recommendations in reports and presentations
<br><br>
Support external evaluations including working with consultants and pro-bono agencies to coordinate evaluation plan, assist in collecting data, and providing context to UWBA work.
<br><br>
Data Management
<br><br>
Support the management of program data for Equity Team programs
<br><br>
Support migration efforts from old case management software to new case management software
<br><br>
Provide training and support to UWBA partners with use of database and applying recommendations.
<br><br>
Create training materials for data and evaluation
<br><br>
Work closely with Program Analyst and Director, Data and Evaluation to support the Equity team in data, evaluation, and research efforts and goals.
<br><br>
Other Responsibilities
<br><br>
Support grant reporting for Equity Team programs
<br><br>
Support board book reporting with program updates
<br><br>
Field inquiries from the Equity team and other departments for ad hoc research and statistics
<br><br>
Other duties as assigned
<br><br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>Basic Function:<br>
The Principal RWD Scientist is responsible for providing RWD expertise, strategic input and<br>
leadership to Product Development, Global and Local Medical Affairs, Global Pricing and<br>
Market Access, and Mature Products. The Senior RWD Scientist is accountable for the scientific<br>
rigor of the RWD applications across the lifecycle of the programs.<br>
</p>
<p>The Principal RWD Scientist typically represents RWDS on global development teams and<br>
global medical affairs teams, partnering with scientists in clinical, safety, biostatistics,<br>
regulatory, medical affairs, payer strategy, and MORSE. The Principal RWD Scientist<br>
accountabilities typically extend to leading the RWDS Disease Area Team.<br>
</p>
<p>Role Responsibilities:<br>
</p>
<ul><li>A member of global cross-functional teams and sub-teams (e.g. GDT, GMAT, Safety).</li><li>
Typically the leader of one or more RWDS Disease Area Teams and leads RWD strategy for an indication across multiple programs</li><li>
Provide strategic input and RWDS expertise into the CDP, TPP, AMP, and ABP.</li><li>
Understands strategy and needs in development, medical affairs and patient access and provides RWD solutions to address evidence gaps.</li><li>
Responsible for the scientific rigor of the RWD studies, regulatory submissions and HTA submissions within the disease areas.</li><li>
Oversees the deliverables from RWD CROs.</li><li>
May serve as the RWD Scientist on the cross-functional study team for RWD studies, with the incumbent responsibilities and accountabilities.</li></ul>
Functional Area<br>
<ul><li>Recognized expertise in RWD science methods and their application. Provide consultation within and outside of own projects.</li><li>
Engages in research and development of RWD science methodology in alignment with current project needs and future trends of RWDS</li><li>
Maintain knowledge of RWD sources for therapeutic area</li><li>
Leads RWDS and cross-functional initiatives</li><li>
Mentors RWD Scientists and Analysts</li></ul>

</p>
<ul><li>Excellent understanding of private and public real-world data sources</li><li>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>POSITION SUMMARY<br>
</p>
<p>As a Principal DATA SCIENTIST within our Personalized HealthCare function you will work with meaningful data to generate impactful evidence and insights on our molecules/ medicines and patients, that support R&amp;D, advance scientific and medical knowledge, and enable personalized patient care and access.<br>
</p>
<p>You will collaborate with peers within the function and across the organization to develop evidence generation strategies, identify evidence gaps and data sources, design and execute studies, and implement analyses to address molecule and disease area questions. The data will be varied in type - patient-level clinical data, supplemented with deep patient data such as omics (e.g. genomics, proteomic), imaging, digital health, etc. Source data will be diverse - real-world data, including patient registries, electronic medical records, claims, biobanks, and clinical trials. The evidence and insights will be used to inform the research and development of our molecules, and support healthcare decisions by patients, physicians, health authorities, payers, and policy-makers. You will also contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives that shape our business and healthcare environments. This will require a good understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, healthcare environments, as well as strong scientific and technical data science expertise. You will need strong strategic, collaboration and communication skills, as well as an entrepreneurial mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to develop and deliver medicines for our patients.<br>
</p>
<p>As Principal Data Scientist you will typically be expected to contribute to broad therapeutic area strategies, lead and deliver on complex projects, and interact with external partners without supervision. You will drive the application of strategies and concepts and determines best course of action. You will drive creation of best practices, and proactively share learnings/experience with colleagues both internal and external to the function.<br>
</p>
<p>RESPONSIBILITIES<br>
</p>
<ul><li>IDENTIFY EVIDENCE NEEDS &amp; RECOMMEND DATA SOLUTIONS: Ask the right scientific questions, understand the evidence needs for research and development, regulatory and market access, and ideate and make recommendations on fit-for-purpose data and analytics solutions.</li><li>
DEVELOP DATA STRATEGY &amp; GAIN ACCESS TO DATA: Develop strategic plans to access fit-for-purpose data sources to support evidence generation, and gain access to data through collaboration or data generation.</li><li>
DIVE INTO DATA: Develop a comprehensive and deep understanding of the data we work with and foster learning with colleagues using analytical tools and applications to broaden data accessibility and advance our proficiency/efficiency in understanding and using the data appropriately.</li><li>
BE AN EXPERT IN APPLYING METHODS: Stay current with and adopt emergent analytical methodologies, tools and applications to ensure fit-for-purpose and impactful approaches.</li><li>
PRODUCE HIGH QUALITY ANALYSES: Apply rigor in study design and analytical methods; plan for data processing; design a fit-for-purpose analysis plan, assess effective ways of presenting and delivering the results to maximize impact and interpretability; implement and/or oversee the study, including its reporting; ensure compliance with applicable pharma industry regulations and standards.</li><li>
INTERPRET AND SHARE RESULTS: Communicate findings to internal stakeholders, regulatory, health technology assessment (HTA) bodies and scientific communities; publish results; participate in external meetings and forums to present your insights (e.g. congress/conference).</li><li>
COLLABORATE &amp; SHAPE: Collaborate and contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external data science communities, networks, collaboratives, initiatives or goals on knowledge-sharing, methodologies, innovations, technolog</li></ul>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Who You Are</h2>
<p>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS<br>
</p>
<ul><li>MSc, PhD or similar qualification in a quantitative data science discipline (e.g., statistics/ biostatistics, epidemiology, bioinformatics, health economics, computational biology, computer science, mathematics, outcomes research, public health, biology, medicine, psychology)</li><li>
Demonstrated track record of developing and execution of data science research projects, patient-level data analyses (e.g., real world data, surveys, clinical trials, registries, claims, genomic or imaging data) with publications and presentations</li><li>
Demonstrated experience with managing project scope and driving delivery in an evolving environment requiring proactivity and effective problem-solving and prioritization when faced with challenges</li><li>
Demonstrated strong collaboration skills and excellent communication skills</li><li>
Demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to teach others and willingness to learn new techniques</li><li>
Proficiency in English, both written and verbal</li><li>
Track record of effectively working in a matrix environment with global, international team members coming from scientific, business and operational backgrounds, using influence without authority</li></ul>
PREFERRED/ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS<br>
<ul><li>PhD degree in a quantitative discipline as listed in Minimum Qualifications</li><li>
6+ years of relevant work experience</li><li>
Omics: 3+ years experience working with next generation sequencing data (DNA, RNA or epigenetic analysis), proteomics, etc.</li><li>
Proven ability to translate and communicate complex study design and findings to diverse audiences</li></ul>

<br>Data Engineer, Baseball Data
<br>----------------------------
<br><br>
Major League Baseball Advanced Media - San Francisco, CA
<br>--------------------------------------------------------
<br><br>
<b>Position:</b> Data Engineer
<br><br>
<b>Reports to:</b> Director, Software Engineering
<br><br>
<b>Outline:</b><br>
The Data Engineer position is responsible for building the data infrastructure that powers baseball online, on television, and in ballparks. In this role, you will contribute to building and maintaining our baseball data platform; work with data scientists to create first of their kind baseball metrics; work on our extensive baseball stats database; design both SQL and NoSQL approaches for data storage; and have the opportunity to analyze large amounts of data and help derive insights and value from them.
<br><br>
The Data Engineer position offers the opportunity to collaborate with other world-class engineers, product developers, and designers; contribute to award-winning and complex apps and systems; influence the innovation of products used by millions globally; and work in a highly collaborative, results-oriented, team environment.
<br><br>
Using cutting edge technology, our software is consumed by fans, broadcasters, stadiums, MLB Clubs and the League itself. We are looking for Software Engineers that are passionate about building new technologies for the baseball industry.
<br><br>
Core Responsibilities
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Creating and managing data sources, both relational and document based</li>
<li>Contributing to the ongoing development of the data warehouse ecosystem</li>
<li>Working closely with the industry's leading data scientists</li>
<li>Creating highly reusable code modules and packages</li>
<li>Developing and improving continuous release and testing processes</li>
</ul>
Qualifications
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, data sciences or engineering</li>
<li>Programming experience with large data sets</li>
<li>Knowledge of databases, including SQL/RDBMS and NoSQL, and big data platforms is required</li>
<li>Knowledge of baseball and its rules is required</li>
<li>Knowledge of machine learning/distributed systems</li>
</ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><div><div><p>We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist who has a shrewd business sense and an exceptional background in science and programming. You will work as a part of an international data science team to develop best-in-class targeting and decision-making mechanisms. The work will be day-to-day researching for new ways to improve, testing and validating the ideas, and implementing the solutions in production.</p>
<p>
Unity Monetization Team, a division of Unity, builds advertising and IAP solutions and technologies used in hundreds of thousands of apps. Our Ads team builds the technology infrastructure and ad serving systems that manage the delivery of relevant advertisements to hundreds of millions of users every day. Our data systems process massive data sets to develop targeting criteria and analytics that maximize the effectiveness and profitability of our advertising business.</p>
<p>
In this role, you will develop the processing, services and algorithms on various machine learning aspects, from providing ideas to developing procedures in production. You are comfortable with quick-paced cycle of development and you have the business acumen to understand what needs to be done and why.</p>
<p>
 This role is located onsite at the Unity office in San Francisco, CA.</p>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">What We're Building
<br><br>
lvl5 builds HD maps for self-driving cars using computer vision. Our iPhone app, Payver, (
<br>http://www.getpayver.com [http://www.getpayver.com/]) has thousands of drivers, sending us terabytes of driving data each day.
<br><br>
We receive video and other telemetry measurements from our fleet, and run advanced computer vision algorithms on the data to map the roads with high precision -- down to just a few centimeters. Unlike traditional maps, HD maps contain all the nitty-gritty details of the road, such as where the car should look for traffic lights, and how to turn through a complex intersection.
<br><br>
We work directly with automakers, and also with Tier 1 manufacturers to provide intelligent driver assist products as well as full localization capabilities for a "Level 5" self-driving vehicle.
<br><br>
<b>Responsibilities:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Reduce terabytes of artifacts from our computer vision pipeline to find the accurate 3D pose of objects of interest.</li>
<li>Automate the detection of changes to our HD map</li>
<li>Manage tiling, building, and intelligent deployment of our maps to our customers</li>
<li>Work through noisy sensors such as GPS and IMU to retroactively localize vehicles in our fleet.</li>
</ul>
<b>Requirements:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>5+ years experience with Python, NumPy, Pandas, and SkLearn</li>
<li>Bachelor degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Data Science, or equivalent real-world experience</li>
<li>Passionate about self-driving technology and its potential impact on the world</li>
<li>Attention to detail and a passion for quality</li>
<li>Knows how to take a scientific approach to solving (near impossible) problems</li>
<li>Ability to measure performance comparing ground truth</li>
<li>Strong math & stats background</li>
</ul>
<b>Bonus Points:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Masters/PhD in an discipline such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Physics, or Systems Engineering</li>
<li>You have designed and trained models for various aspects of autonomous driving such as perception</li>
<li>Self-starter, ability to operate without a manager</li>
<li>Robotics / Autonomy background</li>
<li>Running models at scale</li>
</ul>
<b>Perks:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Health, Dental, and Vision Coverage</li>
<li>$5k budget to spend on your developer workstation</li>
<li>Free snacks, coffee, and drinks</li>
<li>Flexible Work Hours</li>
<li>Fun offsites</li>
</ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>Decision Science @ Glassdoor<br>
<br>
</b>The Decision Science team drives data-driven strategy and decision making across the company through predictive analytics, testing and optimization. We work on a wide variety of problems. We drive product prioritization and inform business strategy by developing a deep understanding of our users and clients. We work with Product team to build and refine data products, such as personalization to power the site and internal products, such as fraud detection, to improve our business efficiencies. We work with Sales team to score and prioritize leads, with Marketing team to build media models, optimize spend to increase pipeline, with Marketplace to understand elasticity of supply and demand, and work with Finance and Business Operations teams on financial planning and forecasting. If gaining exposure to a wide variety of business functions across a fast-growing company excites you, this is the place to be.</p><p><b>
This Role<br>
<br>
</b>The Sr. Data Scientist will work within the Decision Science team and partner with Business Operations, Acquisition Marketing and PMs to help define, build, prioritize and optimize the best products and experiences for our users and customers. In this role, you will be focused on creatively solving for jobs marketplace inefficiencies and shaping our programmatic ads strategy through deep dive advanced analyses to meet our users and customers needs. We are highly data driven in how we set product direction and optimize product features.</p><p>
The ideal candidate will be extremely analytical and demonstrate strong business judgment. You thrive on data, analyses and insights. You ask deep business questions, generate dozens of ideas to solve them, rapidly test them and close your analyses with a solid recommendation. You are extremely results driven.</p><p>
A sampling of projects you could work on:
</p><ul><li>Use predictive modeling techniques to reveal causal relationships of customer success
</li><li>Leverage data to help us improve jobs posting performance and translate that into strategic recommendations</li><li>
Collaborate on longer-term marketplace strategy, identifying areas for improvement, new product offerings, and go-to-market approaches</li><li>
Construct models and define KPIs that allow us to better understand marketplace dynamics</li><li>
Conceptualize and build data models, tools, and dashboards that empower stakeholders, enabling them to access data and draw insights in a self-serve manner</li><li>
Manage A/B testing across mobile web and app platforms to continuously improve engagement and feature-test new product offerings</li></ul><p>

Strong presentation skills.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The Head of Data Science plays a leadership position in the data science department and is responsible for overseeing activities of the junior data science team ensuring proper execution of duties and alignment with LYNK's overall vision.
<br><br>
This role is global, and the Head will be required to manage remote teams.
<br><br>
Why LYNK?
<br><ul>
<li>LYNK is a VC-backed, product-driven startup working with leading institutional clients, top level experts and thought leaders globally</li>
<li>We operate in a high-octane environment where our people think about the big picture and always strive to “make it happen”</li>
<li>Our team, spread across four countries today (and growing!), is multinational, multilingual and multicultural. Our clients have likened us to a mini United Nations.</li>
<li>You will be constantly challenged with new problems to solve every day.</li>
<li>We are here to realize big dreams and have a firm belief in our core mission – to democratize access to knowledge.</li>
</ul>
<b>What You’ll Do:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Create new data sciences capabilities for the business to enable informed decision making, by envisioning and executing strategies that will influence improvement of the business’s performance</li>
<li>Proactively works with various departmental heads across the business in order to provide advanced analytic data modeling systems.</li>
<li>Designs and launches innovative and complex analytic models, utilizing a blend of contemporary and traditional data mining techniques, which is applied to both structured and unstructured data sets.</li>
</ul>
<b>Requirements:</b><br>
<b>What Expertise You’ll Add To The Team:</b><br>
<b>Leadership:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Lead innovation within the business and, as such, defines how the business creates additional value through the utilization of its data assets and analytics.</li>
<li>Consistently identifying and monitoring key business risks and realizing the data needs of the business.</li>
<li>Manage the data science teams and oversees all activities ensuring alignment with departmental and business-wide vision and strategies.</li>
<li>Drive education and evangelization of data sciences throughout the business by communicating the vision and use cases of advanced analytics.</li>
<li>Manage the business’s external data and analytics partners and plays a leading role in the development and design of the departmental vision, capabilities, infrastructure, and quarterly/annual roadmap for the launch of data sciences capabilities.</li>
<li>Build the business’s data science talent needs through role definition, recruitment, and development of a team of data scientists that will jointly move the business’s agenda.</li>
</ul>
<b>Strategy:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Continuously improving the business’s data analysis model, creating industry-leading performance through the leveraging of new and creative data-sources, and employing the latest in machine learning in the department.</li>
<li>Scopes, designs, and implements machine-learning models to support the business’s numerous initiatives and programs with a view of achieving overall objectives and targets.</li>
<li>Match and optimise algorithms that are fundamental to the business’s products/services identifying better matches that will ultimately improve the experience</li>
</ul>
<b>Analytics:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Drive experimental data modeling designs within the business, and constantly run A/B tests in order to evaluate changes in the business’s product/services.</li>
<li>Track the business’s performance against data analysis model and monitor trends in key business KPIs, providing valuable insights to relevant departments for overall business performance improvement.</li>
<li>Draft regular reports on departmental performance and presenting recommended models and departmental strategies</li>
<li>A good understanding of NLP</li>
</ul>
<b>Knowledge:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Maintain a deep understanding the business’s marketplace dynamics</li>
<li>Take initiative and conducts exploratory data analyses and experimental designs</li>
<li>Help the business to better understand trends and behavior within these markets and settle on the most suitable strategies to drive success and achievements of goals and targets.</li>
</ul>
<b>Bonus Attributes:</b><br>
<ul>
<li>Strong passion for business and enthusiastic about taking part in shaping LYNK’s growth</li>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AND MACHINE LEARNING
</b><br>
<br>
The World Economic Forum Center for the Fourth Industrial Revolution (the “Center”) in San Francisco is looking for a Project Lead for the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Project.
<br>
<br>
Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are already impacting governments, enterprises, institutions, and individuals in multiple ways, and will have increasingly complex and far-reaching consequences in the coming years. The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Project aims to create policy and governance frameworks that will be piloted by governments and other stakeholders around the world in order to shape the trajectory of emerging technologies so that they benefit society.
<br>
<br>
The Project Lead will work with the Project Head to define and progress the Project and the team aligned to the Project (3 to 5 people), working closely with the Forum System Initiative on Shaping the Future of Digital Economy and Society. The Project Lead will help facilitate collaboration across other Center projects such as autonomous vehicles, civilian use of drones, environment, Internet of Things (IoT), digital trade and cross border data flows, and blockchain. The Project Lead will help to facilitate engagement across the Forum's existing global communities of business executives, leading academicians from the world's top research universities, government officials, start-up community, media, civil society organizations, social entrepreneurs, and Center Partners which include salesforce, Microsoft, Kaiser Permanente, SAP, Palantir, Huawei, IDEO, Reliance Industries, and Turkcell. The position is based in San Francisco.
<br>
<br>
This position will also assist in leadership of the Forum’s Digital Protocol Network on Artificial Intelligence, Internet of Things & the Future of Trust, one of the Center’s multistakeholder and transnational working groups that develops non-binding policy and policy implementation frameworks on critical digital economy issues. The Project Lead will be part of the broader Digital Protocol Networks team and will be a key contributor to the successful development and deployment of the Digital Protocol Networks strategy across all World Economic Forum projects and activities.
<br>
<br>
<b>Duties and Responsibilities
</b><br>
<br>
In each phase of the project help to:
<br>
• Drive global survey and mapping of already existing work on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning and define gaps in current policy frameworks
<br>
• Define the issue(s) and policy-related questions to be investigated on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, identify clear opportunities for impact, set the goals for the project, and establish clear evaluation criteria
<br>
• Utilizing user-centered design, lead the development of policy and governance frameworks and the deployment of pilots with partner governments and other stakeholders
<br>
• Select, engage, and coordinate public and private partners from industry, government, academia, international organizations and civil society in the initiation, leadership and management of the project
<br>
• Drive effective project delivery, integration, and coordination, through a highly collaborative approach and effective resourcing, budgeting, project and process management, communication, and reporting
<br>
• Manage in-person and virtual teams
<br>
• Support and deliver the project review and approval by sponsors and project review committees
<br>
• Drive the deployment and utilisation of digital interactive tools for project communities
<br>
<br>
Depending on the phase of the project, the role will entail a combination of the above or more focus on certain responsibilities.
<br>
<br>
<b>Qualifications and Skills
</b><br>
• Masters (or higher) degree in Public Policy Management, Artificial Intelligence or other technology, or similar fields
<br>
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in private or public sector, including working on or consulting on relevant Artificial Intelligence related topics
<br>
• Experience crafting public policy on Artificial Intelligence (such as regulations, standards, guidelines or other policy tools), ideally inside or with governments or global organizations
<br>
• Deep knowledge of the Artificial Intelligence ecosystem, including key governing bodies, decision makers, and scholars
<br>

<ul><li>Evaluating enterprise DW architecture feasibility, risk and technologies related to business change (i.e. assessing, identifying and recommending BI and related business stakeholders' data requirements; BI solution prototyping and development; processes and performance from business and technical standpoints; and the impact of data changes on business and/or IT processes);</li><li>Advising CXO's on emerging BI/DW technologies and strategies consistent with clients' business strategies;</li><li>Prioritizing, preparing and implementing BI and/or DW architectural improvements (i.e. developing and recommending alternative DW technical and data management solutions, methodologies, strategies and architectural improvement plans)</li></ul><br>
;<br>
<ul><li>Developing and validating business stakeholders' conceptual data models, including socializing and implementing logical and physical DW/data mart data models; identifying data sources and metadata (including business rules, definitions, attributes, etc.) to deliver analytic requirements.</li></ul><br>
<br>
Skills Preferred:<br>
Demonstrates extensive abilities interacting with end-users to understand and document business and functional requirements, data sources, metadata, and conceptual data models for complex projects, including at least two full lifecycle implementations, BI/SQL, DW/SQL/ETL/Modeling tools and other related technologies involving:<br>
<ul><li>BI and enterprise DW data management, modeling, integration and/or synchronization, quality, security, conversion and analysis, star schema and relational reporting models, enterprise data management policies, procedures, compliance and risk management and/or database administration,</li><li>Design and development of data models, extraction code and cleansing routines utilizing typical data quality functions, i.e. standardization, transformation, rationalization, linking and matching that leverages data standards, processes and technology management for data, master data, and metadata; and, data security (including data masking and related data protection techniques)</li></ul><br>
.<br>
Demonstrates extensive ability to develop a business vision and lead implementation efforts with complex project management capabilities, including:<br>
<ul><li>Identification and addressing of client needs</li></ul><br>
developing and sustaining deep client relationships using networking, negotiation and persuasion skills to identify and sell potential new service opportunities; preparing and presenting complex written and verbal materials; and defining resource requirements, project workflow, budgets, billing and collection.<br>

generating a vision, establishing direction and motivating members, creating an atmosphere of trust, leveraging diverse views, coaching staff, and encouraging improvement and innovation<br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>Motif Capital &ndash; Data Scientist</b></p><p>
We are surrounded by unstructured data on companies and the economy. As an experienced data scientist, you are familiar with a variety of machine learning and natural language processing techniques and have applied them to real world problems. You will develop these algorithms at Motif Capital, apply them to interesting unstructured datasets, and derive quantitative insights. You are comfortable expressing your research process in well-structured code, and taking an idea from inception to implementation.</p><p>
You will be an integral part of Motif Capital&rsquo;s core investing team, helping to build out its data-driven investment process through infrastructure, technology, and unique datasets. This is a very demanding role within a fast-paced team environment that will require an entrepreneurial attitude and the ability to manage multiple priorities and get assignments done. The insights drawn from your research will feed into our machine learning pipelines, to continuously update and adapt our portfolios to changing micro- and macro-economic conditions.</p><p>
Motif Capital is modernizing fundamental investment research. We combine traditional and non-traditional data sources, containing structured and unstructured data, deriving quantitative insights to power our clients' long-term investments. We are a small team, dedicated to scaling through automation in order to keep our clients' money invested in their portfolios, not their advisor.</p><p><b>
Job Requirements:</b></p><ul><li>
Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, or related quantitative field with strong record of academic achievement</li><li>
3+ years of experience using machine learning and specifically natural language processing to mine unstructured data, extracting information from documents such as electronic filings, contracts, news, patents etc.</li><li>
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.</li><li>
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.</li><li>
Professional experience with one or more of Java, Hibernate, Python, Scala, C/C++.</li></ul><ul><li>
Experience with Numerical / Scientific Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas)</li><li>
Knowledge of machine learning pipelines using Scala / Spark or Python / scikit-learn</li><li>
Possess intellectual curiosity and a strong passion for investing and financial markets</li></ul><p>
 Bonus points:</p><ul><li>
Masters degree or higher in Computer Science or related quantitative field with specialization in natural language processing and/or machine learning</li><li>
Experience with distributed computing architectures</li><li>
Experience with tools for statistical computing (e.g. R, NumPy, SciPy).</li><li>
Experience with big data technologies like Apache Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.</li></ul><p><em><b><br>
About Motif Capital:</b></em></p><p>
Motif Capital Management is a next-generation global equity investment manager that specializes in the management of thematic investment strategies for financial institutions such as private wealth management, investment companies, endowments, and family offices. Our unique disciplined, scientific, and transparent approach to thematic investing relies on combining data-driven insights with objective fundamental research, algorithmic portfolio design and cutting-edge technology &amp; analytics. Our goal is to work with our institutional partners to act on the economic, socio-political, and technological forces that are shaping the global economy for the benefit of their clients&rsquo; portfolios. Learn more at www.motifcapital.com.</p><p>
Motif Capital Management, Inc. is an SEC registered investment advisory firm located in San Mateo, California. The company is privately held and a wholly owned subsidiary of Motif Investing Inc.</p><p><b><em><br>
About Motif Investing:</em></b></p><p>
Motif Investing is an online broker-dealer that is transforming the way retail investors invest and manage wealth. Motif Investing offers self-directed investors a concept-driven trading platform that enables them to trade &ldquo;motifs&rdquo;&mdash;intelligently-weighted basket of stocks and ETFs built around themes, investing styles or multi-asset models&mdash; for low fees. Based in San Mateo, the company's investors include Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, Balderton Capital, Renren, Foundation Capital, Ignition Partners, Norwest Venture Partners, and Wicklow Capital, with notable board members including former SEC Chairman Arthur Levitt and former Boston Consulting Group CEO Carl Stern. Learn more at https://www.motifinvesting.com.</p></span><br><div id="p_253985a6508c77ce">

</h2>The Team The Security Analytics Team at Salesforce is looking for an experienced, driven, and creative Principal or Lead Data Scientist to join the team. We own our solutions, from inception, through proof-of-concept, production-ready software engineering, testing, packaging, and efficacy monitoring. We are a growing, highly visible, and highly agile team where experimentation, collaboration, and spirited discussion are the norm. About You - You&rsquo;re intensely curious about data and highly adept in analyzing large volumes of data, then teasing out valuable signals therein. You maintain a healthy curiosity and investment in keeping abreast of emerging techniques. - You partner with threat experts to understand evolving threat patterns and their detection. You collaborate effectively with software engineers to champion proven detection techniques, consult in their software implementation, possibly even help build production software. <span id="job_summary" class="summary">tl;dr
<br><br>
Airtime is looking for a combined data scientist+engineer reporting to the head of data science who will own building and improving our real-time machine learning and recommendation systems.
<br><br>
About Airtime
<br><br>
Today, online means alone immersed in microblogs and success theater. We're changing that. We are charting the course for the next era of the Internet: live, shared experiences. We're building a new way to use the Internet together.
<br><br>
That’s why we’re pioneering a new kind of social experience, one designed for togetherness. At its core, Airtime is a social platform for doing whatever together. Gather with your people to explore the Internet: group video, listen to music, chat, watch stuff, send pictures, GIFs, and more.
<br><br>
Go watch the app marketing video on https://air.me/ ( https://air.me/ ) then check out the app in person.
<br><br>
Our company was founded a few years ago by Sean Parker and Shawn Fanning and is backed by Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Google Ventures, Founders Fund, and a host of other amazing partners.
<br><br>
What You’ll Do
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Work alongside the product, engineering and data science teams to build scalable real-time machine learning and recommendation systems for friends to make, rooms to join, media to watch together, and contacts to invite to Airtime</li>
<li>Transform a stream of 100k user events per minute into real time recommendation updates for millions of users.</li>
<li>Work with the backend and data science team to build a system like Uber’s Michelangelo (https://eng.uber.com/michelangelo/ ( https://eng.uber.com/michelangelo/ )) that allows for efficient exploration of different algorithms and approaches.</li>
<li>Work with multiple data sources including Kinesis, SQS, Aurora, MongoDB</li>
</ul>
Who You Are
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Motivated to do and learn what is necessary to accomplish your goals: You’ll bring your existing experience to bear but you will need to learn about our product space, engineering environment, and novel ways to meaningfully improve the quality of our recommendation systems.</li>
<li>Excited by both data engineering and machine learning challenges. It will be necessary to feel comfortable with the entire data science pipeline and engineering environment. You’ll solve theoretical problems and write code at scale.</li>
<li>Comfortable with, and better yet excited by, product exploration. We are continually changing and improving our product to delight users.</li>
<li>Have a strong engineering and analytics mindset. You don’t need any particular degree just a provable track record of delivering.</li>
<li>Works well with a team. Not a cowgirl or cowboy. Teams that encourage and foster debate in a healthy way provably deliver the best work.</li>
</ul>
Our Team
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Focused on value add for the user. That means we leverage third-party libraries and tools where it makes sense, but have also been committed to building key technology in-house that sets Airtime apart. You can read more about it on our tech blog at https://techblog.airtime.com/ ( https://techblog.airtime.com/ ). In short we’ve built a nodejs microservice based messaging backend, globally distributed WebRTC based media stack, Android+iOS mobile clients, and desktop client.</li>
<li>Similarly, on the data science side we leverage Redshift, Looker, Segment, Mixpanel and whatever else that helps us achieve our goals faster</li>
<li>Minimizes meetings. We are a distributed team across NYC, SF, and PA but besides our weekly 30 minute sprint planning and company all hands we only have one-off meetings as necessary to discuss specific product or technical topics. We generally just coordinate on Airtime and on Slack.</li>
</ul>
What Happens Next?
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>If you like what you’ve seen and heard then apply!</li>
<li>After you apply we’ll reach out to discuss to make sure there is a good overall fit.</li>
<li>If there is a good overall fit, you’ll have some phone chats with our head of data science, VP of Engineering and VP of Product</li>
<li>If that goes well, we will ask you to complete an analysis and machine learning challenge ( https://s3.amazonaws.com/airchallenge/data-science/AirtimeDataScienceChallenge.html ) directly related to what you’ll be doing.</li>
<li>If that goes well you’ll come on site and talk to around four team members where you’ll go over a variety of data science and engineering topics</li>
<li>If everything goes well we will be back to you in a day or so with our answer and maybe an offer!</li>
</ul>
Are you in?
<br><br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Who We Are
<br><br>
At BlackThorn Therapeutics we are dedicated to improving the lives of people with neurobehavioral disorders, such as depression, schizophrenia, and autism, through the discovery and development of novel, targeted treatments. BlackThorn applies data-driven approaches (INFORM™) to build an understanding of the core underlying pathophysiology of neurobehavioral disorders and uses these insights to generate objective neuromarkers that support target identification, patient stratification and objective trial endpoints.
<br><br>
The Position
<br><br>
Help us build the next generation of AI technologies to make data-driven decisions in end-to-end drug development, delivery, and deployment lifecycle. You will design, research, and validate new machine learning models and algorithms that improve the intersection between big-data and expert knowledge decision-making. You will work with scientists, data scientists, and clinical researchers to implement solutions to support our data-driven approaches to improving the lives of people with neurobehavioral disorders. At the same time, you will be rolling up your sleeves working on tactical tasks that will keep your coding and troubleshooting skills sharp. We value enthusiastic thinkers and doers who see opportunities for technology innovation in digital health.
<br><br>
Who You Are
<br><br>
You have demonstrable hands-on expertise in statistics, applied machine learning techniques, and big-data visualization tools. Bachelor’s degree is a minimum requirement for this role with a strong emphasis on practical experience in an industrial setting. You have demonstrable experience building ETL pipelines in industrial setting, and deriving critical insights from large structured and unstructured datasets. You also have hands-on experience in machine learning tools such as Python, git, Scikit-learn, and Pandas, applied statistical learning problems involving both Bayesian and frequentist approaches. Prior experience with specialized areas such as interpretable machine learning, natural language processing, convex optimization, and nonparametric statistics is a plus. Concrete experience bringing machine learning projects to industrial production, using massively-parallel tools such as Spark, Hadoop, and Docker, is a significant plus. Your good interpersonal skills help you explain your analytical insights and complex mathematical models to peers beyond the Data Science team and to the general public, as evidenced by a record of scientific publications and conference talks.</span><br><div id="p_7e2856b58019ff11">

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Job Description<br>
<br>
<p>Visa operates the world&rsquo;s largest retail electronic payments network and is one of the most recognized global financial services brands. Visa facilitates global commerce through the transfer of value and information among financial institutions, merchants, consumers, businesses and government entities.</p><p>
We offer a range of branded payment product platforms, which our financial institution clients use to develop and offer credit, charge, deferred debit, prepaid and cash access programs to cardholders. Visa&rsquo;s card platforms provide consumers, businesses, merchants and government entities with a secure, convenient and reliable way to pay and be paid in more than 200 countries and territories.</p><p>
Behind the Visa brand are more than 13,000 talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.</p><p><b>
Overview:</b></p><p>
Information security is an integral part of Visa&rsquo;s corporate culture. It is essential to maintaining our position as an industry leader in electronic payments, and it is the responsibility of each and every employee to safeguard information, protect it from unauthorized access, and ensure regulatory compliance. Information security has a significant effect on privacy, consumer confidence, external reputation, and it is a priority on everyone&rsquo;s agenda.</p><p>
The successful candidate will act in the capacity of Chief Data Scientist and lead the Cyber Analytics Data Science program working with a team of high performers comprising data scientists and engineers. This team is responsible for the design and implementation of Visa&rsquo;s cyber security data analytics solutions, as well as enabling the detection of possible malicious behavior before data is compromised or destroyed. Using data science techniques, the team will build the tools and use cases to successfully help in the prevention of cyber attacks.
</p><p>This leadership role must instill a culture that works toward the highest standards in cyber engineering while ensuring that business requirements are understood and adhered to and security risks in new and existing infrastructure are properly understood and visualized. Working with other groups such as Cyber Defense, Cyber Engineering, Operations, and Application Development organizations, this position will take a leading role in the development of Visa's Corporate Network Security strategy. This position reports directly to into of head of Cyber Engineering and will be based in Foster City, CA or Ashburn, VA locations.</p><p><b>
Job Scope:</b></p><ul><li>
Provide leadership and direction in the innovation of bleeding-edge data security technologies and utilizing a risk-based approach to properly test and introduce them into the overall environment.
</li><li>Deliver strategy as it relates to the cyber analytics program, with a focus on data science capabilities.
</li><li>Drive Visa&rsquo;s competitive advantage in payments by facilitating a best in class security infrastructure to support the data science program.
</li><li>Recruit, develop, and retain a talented group of data science and technology professionals for this core cyber analytics function.</li><li>
Collaborate with colleagues in technology departments as well as the business and product offices to establish effective, productive business relationships.</li></ul><p><b>
Responsibilities:
</b></p><ul><li>Lead cyber analytics function and responsible for modeling, design and implementation of data science techniques to fulfill the cyber security detection and prevention needs.
</li><li>Work with other Information Security teams to effectively and efficiently manage visualization of cyber events.
</li><li>Lead global projects, develop timeline, and drive deliverables on time and on budget.
</li><li>Partner with the other engineering teams to deliver seamless service and infrastructure services to critical Visa business lines.
</li><li>Responsible for management of the ongoing security engineering support, maintenance, security, and availability of Visa services based on business requirements and adherence to tight operational, security, and procedural models.
</li><li>Establish data science strategy in line with broader Cyber Security objectives.
</li><li>Responsible for planning and positioning of a solution within the company to effectively gain buy-in from all stakeholders and oversee execution.
</li><li>Construct business case, cost estimates, ROI and successfully communicate solution to business.
</li><li>Provide recommendations to management team to increase effectiveness of organization and technology solutions.
</li><li>Establish credibility throughout the organization by earning the reputation for being a proactive senior leader and change agent.
</li><li>Effectively manage cross-functional internal and external team collaboration, and communications.
</li><li>Respond to and assist with due diligence and internal / external audit requests.</li></ul> Qualifications<br>
<p><b>
Requirements/Qualifications:</b></p><ul><li>
Minimum of Masters degree in computer science, electrical engineering, information science, or a related technical discipline required</li><li>
Extensive knowledge of data science: machine learning, data mining, data engineering etc. Use case development as it relates to cyber security threats.
</li><li>A minimum of 12 years of experience in either cyber security or data science or in some combination. Must be skilled at mentoring and motivating staff, communicating goals and other corporate initiatives and driving to results.
</li><li>Extensive knowledge of Information Technology, particularly those areas related to Information Security.</li><li>
Demonstrated knowledge in advanced threat tactics and mitigation/disruption techniques.
</li><li>A track record of managing the delivery of complex, multi-faceted technology initiatives.
</li><li>Experience deploying and maintaining critical, high-availability network systems and associated security issues.</li><li>
Experience with Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) and criminal actors and advanced knowledge of associated Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTP).
<ul><li>Demonstrated expertise and experience with advanced and 0-day threats, intrusions, malware infection, packet analysis
</li></ul></li><li>Experience and familiarity working across the global cyber security community.
</li><li>High degree of technical complexity and conversancy; familiarity with complex global information security infrastructures preferred.
</li><li>Experience with a wide array of security platforms, protocols, tools, and technologies.
</li><li>Knowledge of/experience with international compliance requirements/standards (PCI, GLBA, SOX) and other security regulation requirements
</li><li>Excellent interpersonal, facilitation, and leadership skills along with effective communication (both written and verbal) skills.
</li><li>Certifications in CISSP, CCSP, CCIE-Security, or CEH highly desirable</li></ul><br>
Additional Information<br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Position Description
<br><br>
Mathematica is a nationally recognized research organization that conducts social policy research on health care, disability, education, welfare, nutrition, and other topics. Our mission is to improve public well-being by bringing the highest standards of quality, objectivity, and excellence to bear on the work we do for our clients, which include federal, state, and local government agencies, as well as private foundations.
<br><br>
Mathematica is seeking Bachelors-level statisticians to join us in our mission. The contributions of our statisticians underpin our ability to produce crucial evidence and information for policy and decision makers.
<br><ul>
<li>Apply a wide array of statistical methods and analytic techniques in support of research and operational projects</li>
<li>Assist in the preparation of technical reports and presentation of statistical methods</li>
<li>Implement and execute statistical models based on technical specifications and document analytic results</li>
<li>Utilize, revise, and build upon statistical models and programs using R, SAS, or STATA</li>
<li>Contribute to business development efforts by conducting preliminary analysis and preparing tables for proposals</li>
<li>Additional responsibilities may include assisting project directors in the management of project resources, including budget and personnel monitoring</li>
</ul>
Position Requirements
<br><br>
Education and Experience
<br>Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Math, or related field
<br><br>
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
<br>Basic understanding of statistical and quantitative methods through course work or research experience: program evaluation, experimental design, Bayesian inference hierarchical/multilevel modeling, and/or predictive modeling
<br>One year of work or academic experience with one or more of the following statistical programming languages: R, SAS, STATA
<br>Strong organizational skills and attention to detail with demonstrated ability to work efficiently, accurately and independently
<br>Excellent written and verbal communication skills
<br>Flexibility to handle multiple priorities, sometimes simultaneously, under deadline pressure
<br>Ability to work independently
<br>To apply, please submit a cover letter, resume, writing sample, transcript, and coding sample at time of application. We offer our employees a stimulating, team-oriented work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package, as well as the advantages of employee ownership. We strongly encourage applications of all racial, ethnic, and cultural groups.
<br><br>
Various federal agencies with whom we contract require that staff successfully undergo a background investigation or security clearance as a condition of working on the project. If you are assigned to such a project, you will be required to obtain the requisite security clearance.
<br><br>
<b>Available locations:</b> Cambridge, MA; Washington, DC; Princeton, NJ; Chicago, IL; Oakland, CA; Seattle, WA; Woodlawn, MD
<br><br>
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.</span><br><div id="p_a10c626c215acf37">

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Serves as researcher and consultant on projects for the Division of Research (DOR). Works independently with general supervision by higher level Research Scientists or an Assistant Director.<br>
<br>
Essential Functions:<br>
<li>Designs, develops, and directs well-defined research. Prepares grant proposals, internal reports and publications independently and collaboratively. Provides consultation on study design, analysis plans and interpretation of study results to TPMG, KFH/P managers and committees as directed.<br>
</li><li>Provides service to the scientific community through membership on peer review groups and national boards. May consult with local, state and national voluntary and governmental agencies. Provides consultation and direction to programmer analysts with regard to data management and analysis strategies. Presents papers at national scientific meetings; teaches and/or reviews papers for national journals. Seeks consultation from senior scientists for specific scientific and administrative issues.<br>
</li><li>Kaiser Permanente conducts compensation reviews of positions on a routine basis. At any time, Kaiser Permanente reserves the right to reevaluate and change job descriptions, or to change such positions from salaried to hourly pay status. Such changes are generally implemented only after notice is given to affected employees.</li></span><br><div id="p_fd9691e4e2191e44">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Counsyl is a technology company that strives to give millions of men and women access to vital information about their bodies, helping them confidently make choices about their lives. The team consists of world class engineers, scientists and clinical experts as well as a renowned engineering and scientific advisory board. Counsyl integrates sophisticated technology with custom robotic automation in its accredited medical laboratory. This focus on technology has made Counsyl a leader in helping patients and doctors communicate about medical results in real time. Its products have won the Wall Street Journal’s Innovation Award for Medicine, and have been named one of Scientific American's "Top 10 World Changing Ideas." <br>
You have a deep curiosity in digging into health data and pair with the business to produce actionable insights.
<br>
<br>
This is a great opportunity to join a fast-paced, cross-functional team, working on practical technical challenges and directly contributing to the commercial and financial success of the company. <br>
<br>
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">What You'll Do
</h3><ul><ul><li>Develop and lead business intelligence data strategy in collaboration with the Finance and Commercial team.
</li><li>Develop a deep understanding of all areas of the business that you support, and proactively define priorities, scope and approaches, driving data-driven innovation.
</li><li>Exercise judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
</li><li>Create financial, commercial, and product self-serve reporting infrastructure for use across the company
</li><li>Add visibility to the work that the product, marketing, and sales teams do by using data to support their wins, find areas of improvement, and explore the endless possibilities of what we can build
</li><li>Build and maintain self service analytics capabilities to support performance measurement needs of staff and executive decision-makers using Looker and PostgreSQL
</li><li>Work with engineering to define, implement, document, validate, and monitor metrics
</li><li>Lead a cross-functional team standardizing data governance practices; manage project pipeline around data governance projects </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">About You
</h3><ul><ul><li>5-7 years in a customer-focused quantitative role with an understanding of finance and product
</li><li>Expertise in relational databases and SQL query languages
</li><li>Skilled at processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
</li><li>Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze large amounts of data; experience with ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
</li><li>Proven ability to work across an organization to provide insight and drive data demand.
</li><li>Detail oriented, self starter
</li><li>BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics </li></ul></ul><h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Desired Skills
</h3><ul><ul><li>Familiarity with Looker and PostgreSQL
</li><li>Experience supporting revenue and financial reporting </li></ul></ul>Counsyl is a health technology company that offers DNA screening for diseases that can impact men, women and their children. The Counsyl philosophy is simple: screen for diseases where advanced knowledge makes a difference in health outcomes, whether it’s changing a behavior, pursuing preventative measures, or simply preparing for what lies ahead.
<br>
<br>
The Counsyl team includes an accomplished group of problem-solvers — top engineers, scientists, and designers — who are taking the lead on building the modern clinical laboratory. Scientific rigor, custom robotics, and software are at the heart of every Counsyl product, resulting in better, faster and more affordable screens that are broadly accessible. Beyond the laboratory, Counsyl offers doctors and patients a technology platform for results delivery in real time, with on-demand access to board-certified genetic counselors.
<br>
<br>
Counsyl has screened more than 750,000 patients and served more than 7,000 health care professionals in its CLIA-certified, CAP-accredited and NYS CLEP-permitted clinical laboratory. The company has raised a total of $102 million and is privately backed by Pilot Growth Equity, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Founders Fund, Felicis Ventures, David Drummond, and other high profile investors.
<br>
<br>
Counsyl does not accept unsolicited resumes. Further, any resumes submitted to us without a signed contract will become the property of Counsyl, Inc.
